commentary: nudged down to fine leg for a single
lovely delivery, Holds its line and beats the defensive straight bat
shaping back into him. He squeezes it thbrough the onside for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: driven to extra cover, where it's well fielded
well, that's help. 5 free runs gifted to Afghamistan, as this is so far down leg the keeper can do nought about it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: swing and a miss outside off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: picked up over midwicket and it races away for four. Great start for Afghanistan
looked to heave over cover, and he's trapped in front. It looks plumb to me, really, and the umpire agrees. Afghanistan review, though. And what do I know!! Missing leg stump by some distance
heading down leg and they come through for a run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: defended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: slapped to mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: beat the outside edge by a whisker
slapped over cover in the air. Just about clears the infield

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: driven to cover-point. Better over, but Sri Lanka need wickets
wowzers, I did not know that action was coming. What I'd only describe as extreme Malinga
Half-volley, and Hurbaz slaps it past mid-off for four
picked up the short ball and helped it over fine leg for six. Got a top edge but he only needed to use the bowler's pace
poor bowling, lovely batting. Half-volley once more, and Gurbaz times this beautifully to send it racing over cover for four
low full toss. Squeezed out to midwicket for a couple
slower ball to finish with a dot. And here's Sreshth to take you through to the end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 run
commentary: full on off and the googly is drilled to long on with some power

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: good length ball on off and turning into middle. Falls over slightly but gets a flick off his pads out of the way. To the man at deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, 2 leg byes
commentary: full ball, just outside leg. Zazai plays a paddle sweep, or atleast attempts one. Ball rolls past the keeper's right, and he comes back for two. Umpire confirms what I suspected: off the pads

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: full just outside leg and he gets low to sweep. Hits his body

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: fullish on off. Zazai backs away, ends up being a tad too far to cut it well. Mistimed to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, SIX runs
commentary: there it is! The short-arm jab over deep midwicket. Tossed up on off. Zazai clears the front leg and then almost checks his slog after connecting with the ball.
same treatment from the other end! Gurbaz moves across to the leg side and Theekshana follows him. Gurbaz gets low and plays a whippy sweep off his pads. Over deep backward square leg

swatted over the bowler! Goes into the first few rols. Full and slightly wide. Gurbaz throws his hands at it with mid off inside the circle. Bit of a toe-end but there's enough power in those arms to clear long off
the best of the lot as this full ball outside off is caressed gloriously past the diving mid off fielder!
full ball outside off Gurbaz tries to shape for a sweep past the keeper but it hits his body. Soft lbw appeal turned down with impact definitely outside off
good length ball sliding into leg stump. Gurbaz backs away and pushes it towards cover for a quick run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: clattered past the diving mid off fielder! Full, slightly wide outside off. Zazai offers minimal footwork but puts his hands out to meet it away from his body. Then just drills it past the non-striker, and mid off's dive to his left is futile. 21 off the over

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rahmanullah, SIX runs
commentary: welcome to the attack, says Gurbaz. Bit of a pace-off delivery just outside off stuff. Gurbaz doesn't commit early, lets the ball come under his eyeline, and then lofts it high into the night sky. Soars over wide long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rahmanullah, 1 leg bye
commentary: quicker ball, full on middle and angling down leg. Gurbaz attempts the flick, misses, it hits his leg and rolls away to short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: wristy! Full ball on off and angling across slightly. Zazai reaches out and plays a bit of a scoopy drive over cover. Teases the infielders, falling just beyond them, and then gathers more pace into the boundary line

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: deft! Length ball angling across and Zazai waits for the ball to get near him before playing a late cut past the diving backward point fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Hazratullah Zazai, 2 runs
commentary: full ball on leg stump and Zazai looks to swipe across his line and hit a six over square leg. But this is mistimed, and Bhanuka runs in from the deep to try and take a catch, but the ball falls just short of him despite the dive.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: ends the powerplay in style! Even though this didn't go where expected. Full outside leg. Zazai makes room exposing all three stumps. Tries to smack it behind square on the leg side off his pads but it takes a thick edge and flies over the vacant slip cordon

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, OUT
commentary: much needed for Sri Lanka and the Sri Lankans can afford to smile. Hasaranga bowls it slow, length delivery on off and a googly as well. Gurbaz charges down the track to slog over the leg side but the ball falls well before him, turns past the edge, and crashes into middle and leg stump.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: fullish on off. Punched off the back foot to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: gets off the mark. Good length ball outside off. Zadran rocks back and plays a punchy shot through the covers to the deep

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 run
commentary: tossed up on leg stump, and Zazai drills it on the bounce to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full on off stump. Big stride forward and fended back

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: flatter. Length ball outside off. Punched to cover's left and they scurry across for a single
short ball outside off and he rocks back to cut it to the deep

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: slashed and slashed hard! Full outside off and tries to smack it square through the off side. Gets an edge, and finds the gap behind point!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 leg bye
commentary: full ball, turning in, hitting his pads and rolling away to short fine
length ball slapped off the back foot to the fielder in the deep

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tosses it up a bit more. Nurdled back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length ball with Zadran backing away. He doesn't have the width to free his arms, ends up turning it over to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 run
commentary: googly on a good length. Turning across Zazai and cut to the deep

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: ,crunched!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full ball on off stump. And crunched down the ground for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full outside off and he drives away from his body through the covers. Protection in the deep though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: worked off his pads but can't beat short fine. A full ball, googly again around leg stump
fuller outside off and struck down the ground for a single

is he run out at the non-striker's? Oh dear, one of the worst ways to be out. Length all on leg stump. Zazai backs away and ends up flat-batting a shot straight back. Theekshana dives to his left, can't grab the ball completely, but gets a touch that takes the ball onto his stumps. Zadran was out of his crease, he knew it as soon as that happened, didn't really wait for the TV umpire.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: length ball outside off from around the stumps. Cut to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: sliding delivery originating on a length on off stump. But angling into middle and leg. Zazai tries to whip it across the line but the ball hits his body
another sliding delivery into the stumps after originating outside off. Cut from near his body to point
scores are tied with this flick off his pads to the deep behind square.
full on middle. Zadran tries to slog across the line but it takes an inside edge, goes past leg stump, and Afghanistan win by eight wickets
full on leg stump, and clipped off his pads. To the sweeper fielder behind square on the leg side
overpitched ball on off stump. Bit of swing into him and he drives uppishly straight. Just over the bowler's grasp and Nabi has to run back from mid on to stop the boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mendis, no run
commentary: fullish on off stump. Angling across slightly. And left alone

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mendis, no run
commentary: good length ball on middle stump. Angling away slightly. Poked to point

fullish on middle and leg stump. Bit of swing into the leg stump. Tries to flick behind square, but misses. Hits the back pad. LBW appeal turned down But Afghanistan review. Ball tracking says the umpire got it wrong. Pitching on leg, hitting leg stump too. Afghanistan strike in the first over!

is he one? Looks like! Gets this length ball landing outside off stump and zipping in, surprising the left-hander. He tried to shuffle forward to fend at it, but the ball whizzes past the inside edge and hits him in front of off stump. Asalanka considers reviewing but eventually doesn't, replays confirm that would hit top of middle
good length ball angling in from over the stumps. Shuffles onto the off side and defends
full ball on middle and leg. Flick attempted but the ball hits his heel en route to the keeper
fuller, just outside off. Crunches a drive but finds cover this time
another length ball slightly outside off stump. Fended to the off side
slower ball. Length delivery wide outside off and the cutter jags in sharply. He comes down the track, swings across the line and mistimes a shot to the right of mid on

full ball just outside off. Rolls his fingers over this delivery, and the ball ends up being a legcutter of sorts, holding its line instead of angling in with the arm. Nissanka tries to swing across the line, with an attempt to mow a shot over mid on, but the ball goes past the outside edge instead. Was there an edge? Umpire thinks so! But again there's a review: Sri Lanka ask for the TV umpire. Nervous Sri Lanka fans in the crowd as we wait for the ultraedge. And even though UltraEdge shows almost no deviation, the umpire says out! The Sri Lankan camp is stunned. Nissanka has to go while the Sri Lanka players still have their jaw on the floor.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: full ball on off. Skidding into his pads as he presses forward to drive. Inside edged onto his pad.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: full on middle and off stump. An on drive to mid on this time.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: length ball on off stump. Shuffles across to the off side and fends by standing tall

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Punches this to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: nearly chopped on! Gets tall to try and cut this length ball outside off but it comes off the bottom edge and hits his body

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: slower ball. Fullish on off stump. Keeps his eyes on the ball and smothers a shot to the off side.
lands on leg stump, punched into the onside and the pair exchange ends
full, dug out and they come through for a single

lovely pick-up, and Sri Lanka are off and away. Saw the slower delivery coming well in time, adjusted his position, and what a clean shot through the line that was! Carries all the way for a sizeable six.
hard length this time, and it's defended back to the bowler
opens the face and runs it down to short third, who's sharp with his fielding
gorgeous. That's is sigh inducing. Majestic from Rajapaksa, who spots the width and the half-volley length, gets down on one knee and times it through extra cover.
that's brave, charging Mujeeb off his first ball. Doesn't time it, though
hands back in his crease and clips it to short fine
prodded into the onside
darts it in, and he eases it to long-on
this one's a touch too wide
clipped into the onside and he keeps the strike. Raced through that over, did Mujeeb
dragged down legside
slashed away through the offside and gets the treatment it deserves. Short and wide, and an easy putaway
scoops it over fine leg and it goes all the way! Picked up very cleanly and just used Omarzai's pace to carry it over the fence
makes room and thrashes it through the covers, and it's four more. Now the runs are flowing relatively freely.
and he's dropped a dolly! Afghanistan have suddenly lost their heads. That was a really ordinary over of bowling, and it's compoundedby a simple chance shelled at cover-point
the carnage continues, I can barely keep this up. A classy little leg glance sees the ball race away for another boundary

you guessed it, it's four more! Short, sat up for Rajapaksa and he pulls it away for another boundary. That's 20 in the over, or something like it, and Sri Lanka are wresting back control of this game.
eased down to mid-off for a single. That's more the pace I can keep up with
sends this down leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: gets the front foot out and defends
nurdled to short fine and they scamper through for one
poked into the offside and they race through once more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs
commentary: darted in, but he's allowed him width, and Rajapaksa picks it up over cover-point and dispatches it to the boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: Tried to sweep it but misses. The keeper's convinced it's caught bat, but the umpire's not fooled, and declares it a wide. Afghanistan review Nothing on UltraEdge and this time the umpire decides to reprieve the Sri Lankan batter
defended
brought out the reverse sweep and while he connected well, he sends it straight down Janat's throat at deep point. Mujeeb strikes, and a colourful Sri Lankan partnership draws to a close

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: angling into the pads, defended to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: extra bounce, he plays and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: slashed to deep backward point. The 50's up
short and wide. Loose delivery, and he presses on despite the loss of his partner, slashing it away for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: opens the face and runs it to backward point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: eased to long-on
wide down legside. The keeper appeals again, but the umpire calls it a wide
that came back in and was too close to cut. Gets the under edge and bounces over the keeper for runs
jabbed to wide long-on for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: tried to heave it over midwicket, but didn't appear to read the googly. Thick inside edge onto the pad

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: looked to carve past short third, but is beaten by the skid. Neat over from the Afghan superstar
a little punch into a vacant midwicket region

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to Hasaranga de Silva, OUT
commentary: Hasaranga heaves once more, and this time there's no salvation for him. Poor batting, this. This particular shot always looked low percentage, and he skied this to mid-off, where Mohammad Nabi made no mistake
leans into a cover drive to the fielder
crunches this one past point. Rajapaksa's batting on a different surface. So quick to pick up the short length and dispatch it to the boundary
defended back to the bowler
play and a miss, and that brings a frenetic ten overs to a close. The umpires summon the drinks trolley
strikes first ball after drinks. Dangled his bat wide outside off and gets a faint edge on it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: eases it to extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: carried straight on with the angle, and he defends it back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: eases this down to long-on for a single
guides it to short third and they scurry through for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: closed the bat face and got a leading edge, but no harm done. Excellent over for Afghanistan

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: opened the face to short third and wanted a single, but he was sent back by Karunaratne. Wisely, too
leans forward and sweeps exapnsively to get a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: nurdle into the onside and they get a single despite the spirited efforts of Rashid Khan to prevent it.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: googly, defended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: googly once more. He tried to heave it over extra cover but is comprehensively beaten

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: skidded on and he had to be quick to get out of the way, or it would have been lbw. Dug out eventually, but it's another tight over

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: Nabi's so good at beating these batters outside off. The ball just gets a bit of extra bounce

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, 1 run, OUT
commentary: this is run-out, surely. Sri Lanka shooting themselves in the foot with this running. A direct hit at the non-striker's end puts an end to Rajapaksa's resistance, and SL in dire straits now

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, OUT
commentary: Whoa, I think this is another run-out, and so do Afghanistan! Another unbelievably unnecessary bit of running. he was never going to make it. The keeper has time to collect and whip off the bails, and Theekshana's on his way

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Pathirana, no run
commentary: lovely bowling. This went the other way and almost kissed the outside edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Pathirana, no run
commentary: same again. Much too good for the number ten. Almost swinging away, that
this one takes the outside edge which runs away for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Pathirana, no run
commentary: wrong'un. Beats the edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Pathirana, no run
commentary: defended back to the bowler
turned back in sharply. Fortunate to get an inside edge and squeeze it down to fine leg for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Pathirana, no run
commentary: flatter, defended
looked to smear it over midwicket. Didn't get it anywhere near the middle, but does get a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: googly strikes the pads. Rashid's adamant it's out, and strong-arms his captain into reviewing. The impact and wickets are both umpire's call, so the not out decision stands

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Pathirana, no run
commentary: another ungainly sweep, another miss
nudged into the onside and they race through for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: drives through the offside but the fielder's on his toes, and there's no run to be had

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: worked into the onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Pathirana, no run
commentary: thick outside edge to short third
finally, the sweep leads to his downfall. There was no conviction, or, frankly, ability behind that shot. So it's little surprise he skies it into the covers
spinning back in, and he squeezes it to backward point to get off the mark

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: eased to long-on, but he refuses the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: nearly cleaned up. Googly he did not see coming, and the underedge nearly dragged on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: comes back into the pads, but it's spinning too much

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: worked into the onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: keeps the strike with a slash through the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to C Karunaratne, FOUR runs
commentary: rare loose delivery. A dragdown that's sliding down leg, and it's helped away for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: good-looking shot to long-on. There was probably two on, but he didn't run at all

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slapped to long-off on the bounce. No run again

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slashed to deep cover, and once more, the single is spurned

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mujeeb to C Karunaratne, SIX runs
commentary: gets this away all the way for six! It should perhaps have been taken, but the deep midwicket fielder gets a palm on it and it carries over the rope.
keeps the strike with a single into the onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slower ball. Worked to long-off. No run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slapped to long-off. Another slower ball

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: really thought there might have been two on, but Karunaratne's opinion is the one that matters, and he turns it down

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: driven down the ground, and this time, after a bit of hesitation, he takes a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: comes down the wicket and Farooqi throws in a slower bouncer that beats him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, 1 leg bye
commentary: hits the pad and they absolutely hare through for a single. Whatever else he might have done, Karunaratne really knows how to keep the strike

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slapped down to long-on. Initially they thought about running, but decided against

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: one bounce to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: slower ball, eased into the offside
slower bouncer, but he manages to nudge it into a ga and hare back for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to C Karunaratne, (no ball) FOUR runs
commentary: waist high no-ball, and he smashes it over fine leg for four! Free hit upcoming!
To add insult to injury, he smashes it down long-off's throat, who takes a catch. Of course it won't count, but SL have come through for a single. Which means Madushanka will need to face a ball
big appeal, and Afghanistan review. But it's going down leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, FOUR runs
commentary: stand and deliver. Stayed back in his crease and smashed it down the ground for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: waist high full toss, dangerously close to a no-ball. But not quite, according to the square leg umpire

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: slower ball, places tghis in the gap around midwicket. Brilliant fielding in the deep keeps it to a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, OUT
commentary: cleans him up this time! Looked to crunch it through the offside, but gets an inside edge and it clatters into the stumps. Sri Lanka have something to defend, thanks to Karunaratne. But is it too little too late?

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: lands on a length, tailing in, defending into the onside

inside edge dragged onto the stumps, and Rahul departs first ball! Naseem strikes first ball, and Pakistan have their perfect start! Naseem reeled away in celebration, having taken KL Rahul's wicket off his second T20I ball. Is this going to be a nervy chase, then?

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kohli, no run
commentary: tailing back in at pace, and Kohli leaves. Kohli has a wry grin on his face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kohli, no run
commentary: Kohli has been dropped by Fakhar Zaman! It was at third slip, Kohli was lulled into a loose drive, got a thick edge. Tough chance, but Fakhar Zaman got two hands to it
and he's off the mark, and off strike with a single to fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide
commentary: taking down leg, and Rizwan dives to collect. He's down, looks in pain, probably cramp

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: seaming away, the keeper was celebrating, convinced it was an outside edge. The umpire was unmoved, and Pakistan don't review. All very confusing, but a scintillating start.
wicket-to-wicket, solidly defended to the onside
good ball, tailing back into Kohli, who plays with soft hands onto his pad
loose shot, hanging his bat out at one that was well wide. Lucky not to get an edge on it
didn't time that at all, went for an aerial drive over mid-off. Looped up over the fielder allowing them to take a couple
and as I say that, he plays an authoritative shot, rocking back and dispatching the sort ball with aplomb. Lovely shot of confidence through midwicket
thick inside edge, nearly carried on, but he gets away with it. Another eventful over

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kohli, no run
commentary: mistimed to long-on, catching it on the inside half. He looks irked at missing out on that one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kohli, no run
commentary: hard length from Naseem, Kohli defends. Looks for a single, but wisely reconsiders
slighty wider down leg, and nudged into the onside, allowing them to come back for a couple
thick inner edge through for a single into the onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: opens the face and runs it down to third man
carves it past backward point to keep the strike. Slightly more comfortable this over
length delivery, clipped into the onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: loosely slashed at another one on fifth stump, and it ends up whooshing past the outside edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: gets a single to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: hits the bat hard, bowling at 144kph. Defended towards the cover region

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: short ball, and Kohli takes it on once more. Gets a top edge, could have gone straight up, but instead it flies over the keeper's head and away for six! Early evidence suggests he'll attack the short ball

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: loose slower ball down legside, but gets away with it as Kohli's glance finds short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: defended solidly. The pair appear to have settled in after those early jitters

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: and as I say that, he tries an ungainly heave across the line over cow corner. Ends up beaten, completely losing his shape
shorter and wider, eased towards third man
slashed over cover and it's high enough to clear the infield. Races away for a boundary. Was a loose delivery, in truth, half-volley length
drags his length back, and Kohli defends
backfoot punch towards extra cover. The timing has improved as well from those early overs

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: inside half of the bat in that drive to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: short of a length, and oh my, the majesty of that shot. Slapped over midwicket with such authority, and that should do his confidence so much good
slower ball, runs it down to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, 4 leg byes
commentary: poor delivery, tailing down leg, and it's clipped off the pads past fine leg for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: lovely comeback. Nips away off a length and beats the bat at pace. Nips past the outside edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: back foot punch to point, where Shadab collects on the bounce. ENd of an interesting Powerplay, which India have perhaps edged by not losing more than that one early wicket
full, yorker length. Kohli digs it out
strikes Rohit with the on-drive. Rohit takes evasive action, with the ball bouncing off Rohit's hand. Fortunate it didn't pop up to Shadab there

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: quicker, skidded through. Rohit defends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: a bit of flight, lulling him into the drive, but it spins away from the outside edge. Great delivery
googly, clipped into the onside
slapped through the offside, just the three of Shadab's first over. Absorbing one
flatter and short. Kohli eases it to ong-off
smeared into the onside. There was absolutely no timing on it from Rohit, but it lands between two fielders
nurdled into the osnide and the pair exchange ends once more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: that was in the slot, and this time Rohit catches it out of the middle. A bit of a slog over long-on but the timing is perfect and it sails away for India's second six

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: quicker, and it's defended into the onside
and Rohit's grind comes to an end! Came down the ground to try and smash this through the line over mid-off, but he miscues it to long-off, where Iftikhar holds on to it
defended back to Shadab. He's in a good ryhthm, the Pakistan vice-captain
clipped into the onside
defended to the offside
googly, swiped away to midwicket
driven a tad uppishly to mid-off
works it into the onside and keeps the strike

Kohli sends it straight down long-off's throat. That was a bit of a gift to Iftikhar, who takes the simplest of chances. He struck it through the line, but didn't get the distance on it, and it almost felt like catching practice for the fielder. Huge moment in the game
gets off the mark with a drive through the cover region
spins back in to take the pad, and he goes up in appeal. But the umpire deems it to be going down, presumably
dances down the ground, gets to the pitch and smashes it straight over the sightscreen. Huge six for Jadeja, taking advantage of a proper slot delivery, sending it 98m down the ground
opens the face and runs it to short third for a single
clipped into the onside to keep the strike. Here's Deiva to take you through what should be a thrilling finish
pushed through outside off, Surya drives through the line to sweeper cover on the front foot
darted on the pads of Jadeja who flicks a single to deep midwicket
on a length and breaks away outside off, forward and forced to backward point
darted into middle stump, Surya dares to sweep from the stumps. Struck flat and hard through backward square leg. Pinged off the middle of the bat
94ks, shorter and turns away outside off, slapped off the back foot to backward point
fullish and outside off, Surya presses forward and eases a single to sweeper cover
shorter and outside off, cut off the back foot to backward point
back of a length and into middle and leg, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket. Good defensive bowling from the left-arm fingerspinner
pushed through on middle from round the stumps, Jadeja advances down the track and utterly batters it down the ground, straight through Nawaz's legs
shorter and into the body, flapped away just wide of short fine
wide on the crease, on a length and turns away outside off, dabbed with the break to extra-cover
short and down the leg side, Jadeja hangs back and swats a single to long leg
on a length and fizzing across off stump, Jadeja slashes away from the body and is beaten
darted across off stump, stabbed back off the inner half of the bat
flicked off the pads to the right of short fine leg
back of a length and turns away outside off, Surya reaches out for the ball and cracks it away behind point
shovelled between deep midwicket and wide long-on with the bottom wrist
googly, sliding into middle and leg, Surya bunts a single down to long-on
back of a length and angling in from outside off, Surya plays so very late, gliding it past the right of Rizwan who dives to his right and takes some pace off the ball, deflecting it to deep third
Jadeja backs away outside leg, Dahani drags his length back and sends it zipping through outside off. Jadeja wafts and misses

short and veering down the leg side, away from the reach of Jadeja's pull. Or did Jadeja glance it behind to the keeper? Not given out on the field. Pakistan ask for a review of the on-field not-out decision. Ultra Edge does not detect a spike. Nothing there. Dahani has to re-bowl this
short and picked off the hips to long leg
pitched-up delivery outside off, Surya opens the bat-face and carves a single to sweeper cover
Jadeja steps away outside leg, Dahani follows the moving batter with a short ball which is flapped away through midwicket. Weak pull from Jadeja as he gets cramped
back of a length and outside off, Surya clears his front leg and hauls a single to the right of midwicket off the inner half

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Yadav, no run
commentary: back of a length and sliding in at 141ks on middle, worked away to midwicket

Bam! Naseem knocks out the off stump. Back of a length and zipping in from over the wicket at 142ks, it looked a lot quicker than that, though. Surya clears his front leg, slogs and misses the ball altogether. Naseem hits his target and delivers the big breakthrough for Pakistan
Pandya shuffles across off, gets inside the line of this full ball on middle and dinks it to fine leg
Pandya walks across off and flicks another single to fine leg
hip-high short ball just a shade outside off, 115ks, Jadeja delays the pull and sends the ball to long leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Hardik, FOUR runs
commentary: slapped away behind point for four. Dug in short and outside off, Pandya rides the bounce and firmly cuts it away past Shadab who dives over the ball and misses
short of a length and on top of off, Jadeja glides it down to deep third
Dahani pounds it on a heavy length and just a shade outside off to cramp Pandya. Inside-edged into the leg side for one
on a length and sliding across off from over the wicket, Jadeja crouches and pushes the ball away to sweeper cover
on a length and outside off, flat-batted away to the right of sweeper cover. Pandya hares back for the second
rapid short ball on middle at 141ks, rushes Pandya into a hook to deep square
bouncer down the leg side, Jadeja is beaten, as is Rizwan. The ball burst out of his gloves
hip-high short ball just a shade outside off, Jadeja crouches and then pulls away to deep midwicket
mighty full and speared down the leg side at 143ks, Rizwan dives across to gather the ball. The ball slips out of his gloves once again

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, no run
commentary: back of a length and zipping away outside off at 143ks, beats Pandya for pace. He flails and misses outside off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, no run
commentary: looks like a legcutter outside off, away from the reach of Pandya, another swing and a miss
Pandya stays leg-side of this back-of-a-length delivery outside off and flays it wide of sweeper cover
140ks, banged in short and cramps the batter, Pandya pulls weakly to midwicket. Good bowling from Rauf
full and veering down the leg side, wide
full on the stumps, whipped away to the right of long leg for a couple of runs

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Jadeja, 1 leg bye
commentary: full and thudding into the pads at 144ks, Rauf goes up for an lbw appeal but that pitched outside leg stum
bouncer, angling across off, Jadeja lets it go. One for the over, says the umpire. Is Naseem struggling with cramps as well?

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, FOUR runs
commentary: Jadeja backs away outside leg and manufactures swinging room. Naseem spears it wide of off. Mid-off is up, as is cover. Jadeja reaches out for the ball and belts it away between mid-off and extra-cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, no run
commentary: back of a length and swerving away outside off. Jadeja slogs to the leg side and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, no run
commentary: Jadeja makes room once again. Naseem slams it short and wide of off, away from the reach of Jadeja. Beaten

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, no run
commentary: Naseem appeals for lbw and collapses in his followthrough. The finger goes up, Naseem goes down. Jadeja has asked for a review. 141ks, fuller and thudding into the back pad. No bat involved but the question is: did it pitch outside leg? Yes indeed.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, SIX runs
commentary: Jadeja makes room, Naseem follows him with a full ball. Jadeja lines up this slot ball and pumps a six over Naseem's head. Big strike for India

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Jadeja, no run
commentary: lifter, angling across off, beats Jadeja for pace and bouncer. Naseem ends with 2 for 27 in his four overs on debut in the oppressive Dubai heat
very full on middle and leg, just short of the yorker length, Pandya sits deep in the crease and whips it away to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, Jadeja leans back and across as he guides it to the right of point. Jadeja collides with Rauf but they're good to go again

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, FOUR runs
commentary: just short of a length and outside off, Pandya gets enough elevation to clear extra-cover. Babar chases the ball, but ends up parrying the ball into the boundary. Swung away over the off-side infield

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, FOUR runs
commentary: hip-high short ball on off stump, Pandya clears his front leg and swats it away powerfully to the right of wide long-on for back-to-back fours

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, no run
commentary: bumper outside off, Pandya leaps to catch up with it but can't touch it in the end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hardik, FOUR runs
commentary: short on middle at 146ks, but not quite short enough. Still, this is a top shot from Pandya. Bam! He swats another four, this is hammered away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Nawaz castles Jadeja. Flat and quick from around the stumps, Jadeja goes for the massive slog and does not connect. Nawaz hits the stumps. Pandya sinks to his knees at the other end
darted into the hips from round the wicket, short-armed away to deep square
Pandya backs away outside leg and flat-bats a middle-stump delivery straight to extra-cover

Pandya clears long-on and finishes it for India with a six. Flat and quick, shortish and into off stump. Pandya launches it over the boundary with a still head and smooth swing. He finishes the job that he started with the ball earlier in the evening
length ball, seamed away just a tad. Thick outside edge to point

Hit on the pads, and the umpire gives it! Rizwan reviews immediately, height the only question It's missing! Rizwan survives.. It hit him on the back leg as he looked to swipe into the onside and ended up misjudging the bounce
a touch too straight, clipped to square leg and Pakistan are off and away!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, FOUR runs
commentary: straight drive, and it's just straight enough to beat Hardik at mid-off. Babar starts with a first ball four, and the crowd erupt
a ounch through the covers, and the pair exchange ends

played on the up, and it sppeared to beat outside edge by a whisker. Bhuveneshwar is convinced Rizwan got a nick, and India review It's not out, there's no spike. India lose a review, and Rizwan survives again

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: short of a length, came back in, tucking Babar up, who defends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, 1 wide
commentary: drags this too far outside off stump, and Babar misses a loose drive. It's called wide

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: swinging back in off a length, and it's sharply fielded at short midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, 1 wide
commentary: too short, and it bounces well over the batter's head. It's called wide on height

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: loose from Babar. That was there to cut away, and the Pakistan captain missed out

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: eased down to fine leg off the chest
length ball, a little nudge from Rizwan into the covers and the pair exchange ends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, FOUR runs
commentary: exquisite from Babar. straight and a touch too full. Babar's a hawk when it comes to picking up length early, and he leans into a straight drive to finish the over with a boundary
opened the face and tried to run it down to third man, but he plays and misses
pushes this to mid-off and scampers through for a risky single. He has to put in the dive, but then again, Rizwan doesn't need an excuse to dive

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: clipped to mid-on, no run on offer

short ball, top edges to short fine leg, who takes the catch! Pakistan lose their captain early. Bouncer from Kumar and it got big on Babar as he looked to pull it to square leg. India draw first blood
top edge first ball, and it races away for four. Might have been off the glove. It's streaky from Fakhar, but it gets him off the mark
elegant cover drive on the bounce. It's a crowd catch because it was almost a bump ball. Rohit has a cheeky smile on his face as he appeals playfully.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: Rizwan's not quite found his bearings. Lost his balance driving to drive that. India seem to understand how to bowl to him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: defended into the cover region. India slowly ratcheting up the pressure

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: three dot balls in a row, another block to the offside. A ripple of applause breaks out among the Indian fans

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: gets the boundary this time! Wsn't in full control, but kept it low. It took a thick outside edge and raced away past short third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: goes straighter this time and tucks him up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: a nudge to backward point. Five dot balls and four from the over
gets it past mid-off. It was a half-volley and there to be put away. He didn't quite middle it but got enough on it to evade the fielder
thick outside edge to deep third. It looked like two might be on, but they can only get a single
defended back to the bowler. It's a bit of a grind from Rizwan so far
clipped off the hips into the onside, and the pair get back for two
bouncer from Pandya. Rizwan tried to hook it but ends up missing
beautiful delivery, seaming away and just about misses the outside edge
length ball on middle stump angling away. It's worked into the onside for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Rizwan, SIX runs
commentary: he needed to hit out or get out, and hit out he does! Steps across and whips it over cow corner; that is trademark Rizwan. It goes into the stands for a colossal, 87m six

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: full delivery, and he's whipped it tow midwicket for a boundary. What a stunning shot that was. Is Rizwan finally playing himself into form?
opens the face and runs it to third man

the extra bounce beat him, or so it seemed, but it's taken the faintest of nicks! The Indian players didn't appeal much, but Fakhar just walked off. Not sure the umpire even raised the finger. It was a short of a length ball and it bounced up higher than the batter expected
tailing in. He drives to mid-on and races through for a single
a bit too straight. Iftikhar turns it round the corner and gets another single
tried to drive on the up. He gets another thick outside edge to third man
length ball, blocked from Iftikhar
timed gloriously though the covers. Backfoot punch from Iftikhar, really. Not much more than that, and it beats a diving Chalal in the deep
eased to mid-on for a single, and the Pakistan 50 is up
pulled away. Got plenty of bat on it, but it's hit straight to square leg
skidded on, pushing Rizwan back to defend
swept to short fine leg. An errant throw meant there was a small chance of an overthrow, but Rizwan opts against it
cut away, and finds the gap between backward point and short third man. There was width on offer and it was a touch too short
flighted this time, and bowled it slower. Dinked towards leg for a single
nurdled into the onside for another single
punched towards wide long-on for another single
driven to short extra cover
eased to long-on for a single
nudged into the offside for a quick single
was there an edge? Sharp turn and bounce, and it grows big on Karthik, who can't quite collect
driven into the onside
smashed to wide long-off, where the fielding is crisp. India get in another excellent over
that looked like it was in the slot, and Rizwan tried to smash it over midwicket. Doesn't time it though, and it's smeared along the ground
darted in flat, and Iftikhar defends
had a slog to long on, but again, there was no timing, and it lands well short of the fielder
mistimes a slog through the onside once more. Inside edge through to fine leg for a single. He's tempting Rizwan, who can't execute at the moment
prodded down the ground and the pair exchange ends
came down the ground and yorked himself. Gets it down to long-on. It's 68 for 2 at the halfway mark, and Deiva comes in for a stint
pushed through outside off, slightly short, that length is enough for Rizwan to go back and late-cut it away between backward point and short third for four
sliding into off, much fuller, inside-edged onto the pad and the ball rolls back to Jadeja. Rizwan takes on Jadeja's arm for a single. A direct hit could've been tight
dragged down outside off, Ahmed rocks back and short-arms it away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
back of a length and speared outside off, late-cut away more or less straight to short third
slid into the pads, knocked away into the midwicket region for a sharp single
Ahmed goes on the back foot and punches a single to sweeper cover
tossed up slower and higher on middle and leg, hauled away off the inner half between deep midwicket and long-on
fired flatter and faster into middle and leg, Ahmed hacks it down to long-on
down the track and drilled down to long-off for one more
lobbed up wide of off and turns away, Ahmed lines up this wide legbreak and pumps it down the ground. Clears Pandya at long-on and collects six
Chahal drops a return catch. Fast full-toss on off or just a shade outside off, stabbed back to him. Chahal snatches at the ball, but it pops out of his hands
pushed through on middle and leg, Ahmed squeezes a single down to long-on
Pandya comes back and bounces out Ahmed. Lifter outside off, 142ks, rushes Ahmed into a hook. He weakly flaps at the ball and top-edges it behind to DK who leaps and grabs the ball
short and outside off, steered away to point
pitches outside leg and fizzes in to strike the pad after beating the inside edge
short and cramps Shah for room, jabbed into the leg side for a single
back of a length and slanting into off stump, no room, jammed to midwicket
Rizwan jumps across off and pulls a double to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Khushdil, no run
commentary: Shah pushes this full ball on middle back to Avesh

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Khushdil, no run
commentary: nice and full, angling across off, lures Shah into a loose drive and goes past the outside edge. Good ball from Avesh
shorter and on off stump, Shah opens the face and guides a single to the right of short cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: Rizwan shuffles across off, meets a wide full-toss and drives it in the gap between extra-cover and mid-off for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: slower cutter outside off? Keeps low. Does not come onto the ball. Swings and misses
Avesh pounds it on a hard length and outside off, 140ks, inside-edged into the covers for a single

Another short ball. Another wicket for India. Hardik bounces out another batter. Banged in short and keeps ducking in with the angle from over the wicket. Rizwan looks away and is surprised by the bounce. He goes low, aims to ramp half-heartedly and ends up guiding this 141kph delivery into the hands of Avesh at deep third
fullish and on middle, 140ks, Shadab wanders across off stump and works a single to mid-on. He takes on Surya's arm for a single. Surya misses a direct hit

Five short balls, five wickets for India. This is Pandya's third. Dug in short and angling across off from over the wicket. Shah leaps off his feet and swishes it straight to Jadeja at sweeper cover. Shah mistimes a cut and holes out This is turning out to be a terrific spell from Pandya
short and speared down the leg side, 140ks, wide called
another short ball but directed down the leg side. Re-set the radar, Hardik
gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches to sweeper cover
rides the bounce of this 142ks short ball outside off and finds a single to the right of deep third
hip-high short ball angling into Asif who swats it away to deep midwicket. End of a top spell from Pandya
wrong'un, fizzing into the pad, heading down leg. Asif may have got an inside edge there
slider just a shade outside off, under-edged past the off stump for one
Asif manufactures swinging room by backing away outside leg. Driven inside-out over extra-cover, there's a fumble in the outfield from Hooda, I think
full on the stumps, hammered past the outstretched right hand of Chahal. Pakistan settle with a single
tossed-up legbreak wide of off, Asif fetches it from there and hoicks it to wide long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahal to Asif Ali, no run
commentary: low full-toss on off, Chahal dives to his left from his followthrough to stop this push
slower ball from Bhuvneshwar, hides it away from the swinging arc of Shadab who wafts and misses outside off
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, pumped over extra-cover, but wide long-off has it covered
Holes out to Surya at long-off. Slower legcutter from Bhuvneshwar. Asif lofts in the air, does not get enough elevation. Picks out Surya at the boundary. Pakistan sink further in Dubai
rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and gets a single between backward point and short third man
offcutter into the pitch, nips away past outside edge
dinked into the covers for a risky single
Arshdeep comes back and has Nawaz nicking off to DK. On a length and wobbles away outside off from over the wicket. Nawaz has a feeble little prod at it and edges it to the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, 2 runs
commentary: fullish and angling in from round the wicket, carved hiiiiiiigh into the air. Mid-off runs back, but the ball evades his reach

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, FOUR runs
commentary: banged in short and angling into the rib-cage, Rauf is cramped but manages to glove it away past DK's left for four. The ball bobbles out of his gloves. Tough chance for DK

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: inswinging yorker from round the stumps, Rauf may have inside-edged it onto his boot as the ball rolls behind to DK

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: slower cutter floats away outside off, Rauf swings to leg and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, FOUR runs
commentary: overpitched on middle and leg, just misses the yorker, hauled away to the midwicket boundary. Much-needed four for Pakistan
Bhuvneshwar misses the yorker. Full-toss on the pads, Shadab sizes it up and swipes it over square leg for six

Bhuvneshwar spins around for an lbw appeal and the finger goes up. Shadab challenges the on-field out decision. Very full and ducks back in to catch the batter on the crease. Did Shadab nick this? Ultra Edge does not detect a spike when ball passes bat. The tracker returns three reds and Shadab has to go

another lbw appeal, and the finger goes up once again. Pakistan goes for a review once again. Full again from Bhuvneshwar, skids back in to ping the pad on the knee-roll. Not bat involved. Ball-tracking suggests it would have shaved the top of the stumps. Umpire's call and Naseem bags a golden duck on debut
good length and slanting into off, Dahani gets right behind the line and blocks to mid-off
Dahani swings for the hills. Launched over long-on for six. Pitched-up delivery outside off, slot ball from Bhuvneshwar and he cops punishment
pretty full on middle and leg, slower ball, hauled away wide of deep square leg for a double

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: slower short ball from round the wicket, Rauf swings early and does not make contact with the ball

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Haris Rauf, 3 runs
commentary: Dropped by Rohit running back from extra-cover. He gets both his hands to the ball but can't cling onto the ball. Cutter at 114ks, sliced in the air
backs away outside leg, Arshdeep follows the moving batter with a 141ks yorker which is squeezed past the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Dahani, SIX runs
commentary: Dahani clobbers another six, this is swatted over midwicket. Arshdeep bangs it into the middle of the pitch. Possibly a slower ball. Dahani has a roundhouse swipe at it. He is pumped
Arshdeep yorks Dahani and closes out the innings. Wide on the crease, inswinging yorker. Squeezes underneath the bat and clatters into the base of middle stump

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: length outside off, flat. Stays back and punches this to mid-off.
Another straight one, pushed through. Stays back again and knocks this towards midwicket.
Around the wicket, good length pushed through. Defended on the back foot.
Looks to make room and cut this square on the offside, but can't beat the infield.
length on the stumps, nudged to mid-on. No run.

Direct hit! And this looks close! Length ball nudged to mid-off and they hare for a quick single. Mid-off collects cleanly and throw's to the striker's end, and knocks down the stumps. But replays show he's a couple of inches in.
Length oustide off, angling away. Left alone.
Launched back over the bowler's head! Wow he struck this cleanly. This was just over pitched a touch, and Gurbaz leans back and frees his arms. Bang.
Swing and a miss! Walks down the track and looks to hoick this over midwicket, but misses all ends up.
back of a length on off, stays back and defends
length on the stumps, stays in the crease, opens the face and guides this towards cover. But can't beat the infield.
Driven on the up, but cover gets a hand to it and keeps it to a single. This was pitched fuller outside off, and Gurbaz just leant into it, though he couldn't quite get the placement.
length, angled in towards leg as Gurbaz looks to make room. Only manages to push it back to the bowler.
Dropped at long-on! He comes down the ground and goes big but doesn't connect. It's a tough low catch but should be taken
length, stays back and knocks it long-on for one
length on the stumps nudged to midwicket
length ball holds up in the surface a touch, knocked down the ground for one
short on off, cut hard but not timed, down to sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: Around the wicket, length ball. Back foot punch to mid-off.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 run
commentary: length on off, punched to the right off mid-off, who does well to scramble across and keep this to a single
darted in towards the pads, worked towards deep midwicket for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Rahmanullah, no run
commentary: around the wicket, leg stump line. Can't work this away cleanly.
pushed through flat and quick on middle and leg, nudged to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: looks to make room and go inside out, but Mahedi spots it early and pushes this flat towards leg. Cut into the turf for none.

Gurbaz is gone stumped! The pressure was beginning to tell, and Gurbaz is the first to lose his head. He comes down the ground but Shakib sees it early, and fires it shorter and flatter. Mushfiqur collects this quite low and breaks the stumps.
length on middle, tossed up a bit. Clipped in front of square on the onside.
good length on the stumps, pushed through again. Stays back and works this towards deep midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, pushed down to long on
length outside off, shuffles across the stumps and works this through midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, driven but straight to a wide mid-off. Great over from Shakib.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: Inside edge down to fine leg! This could have easily been chopped on as Zazai looks to cut one that's not quite short enough, but he gets four instead.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: length on off, cut straight to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: another back foot cut, and again can't beat cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, 2 runs
commentary: good length but on middle and leg, guides this behind square on the onside for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: Gets a hold of this though! Length on off, and it's absolutely bludgeoned past mid-off off the back foot!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: good length on off, cut hard but again towards cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: short, well directed. Zadran sways out of the way.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: back of a length on the stumps, worked onside but straight to midwicket
back of a length on off, poked to the left of cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 leg bye
commentary: length on the pads, looks to work this onside, but it strikes the pads. They scramble a single though.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Crunched on the up past point! Cracking shot! This was wide on a length and Ibrahim just lets his hands flow right through the stroke. Flies to the boundary.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Good length on middle, gets forward and knocks this back towards the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: Length ball, pushed back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: darted on the pads, goes for the sweep and misses. But this is going down leg.
length on off, stays back and punches this down to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: pushed through on a length, driven to the right of Mosaddek who moves across to collect
length on the stumps, clipped towards deep square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: pushed through flat and quick, and it hits the pad as Zazai looks to work this onside. Going down leg though.
Full outside off, driven down to deep extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mustafizur to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: short and it rushes Zazai who goes for the pull but barely manages to connect
good length on off, stays back and guides this in front of square on the onside for one
short again, guided pull down to deep fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mustafizur to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: Crunched through the covers! Another powerful back foot hammer from Zazai, who makes room and takes this from just outside off and beats the infield as well as the man sweeping in the deep.
short and pulled down to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: Pushed through and just misses off stump, as Zazai goes for the cut but is beaten on the under edge.

And this time he's got him! Zazai goes for the sweep, and misses it completely. He's struck flush on the back thigh pad in front of middle and leg to one that was pushed through by Mosaddek. Zazai reviews. Afghanistan retain a review as it's umpire's call, but Zazai has to go as this is shown to be clipping leg stump.
length outside off, driven towards deep cover point for one
good length on off, driven down to long off
good length on middle, pushed down to long on now

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: pushed through flatter and fuller, driven to mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to M Nabi, no run
commentary: short of a length on off, defended towards point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to M Nabi, no run
commentary: length ball outside off, 140kph, looks to cut but gets an under edge into the turf through to Mushfiqur

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to M Nabi, no run
commentary: back of a length on off, defended back towards Taskin
back of a length once more, back foot punch towards long on for one
short outside off, opens the face and guides this uppishly down to third man who collects it on the bounce

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to M Nabi, FOUR runs
commentary: Glanced fine for four! Much needed boundary for Afghanistan, as it's tickled fine from a length ball on middle and leg.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tossed up on off, driven towards mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tossed up again, driven to cover
tossed up wider, opens the face and drives this past point for couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length ball pushed through, driven back to Shakib

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shakib to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tossed up on off, pushed to extra cover
full on off, driven down to long off
short of a length, goes for the pull and checks it down to deep square leg
length on middle and leg, nipping in a touch. Worked behind square on the onside for one
short of a length, on the stumps. Gets across and works this past short fine leg for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Saifuddin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, prodded to point. No run.
slower short ball, waits for this and opens the face to guide it down to third man

length ball, angling in and it's given LBW! Nabi thinks about it but doesn't review. This is the off cutter, and it's hit him right in front of the stumps, going to knock down the stumps half way up. Bangladesh right on top here.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: pushed through flat on the stumps, back foot punch down to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, driven but only as far as Mahedi

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
makes room and drives this inside out down to sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: good length on the stumps, driven down to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, pushed through quick again. And Zadran throws back his head in disappointment as he's unable to get this away yet again.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full and quick on off, looks to lean back and smack this but gets only the inside half of the bat towards the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length outside off, goes for the big booming drive on the up, but misses all ends up
Sliced high over point, as this is pitched up wide of off. Falls inbetween point and deep cover running around to collect.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Cracking shot! Short outside off, and he just uses the pace to guide this to the left of point, while deep third has no chance as this races away.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Taskin to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Back to back boundaries! Slow ball in the slot wide of off, and this is driven hard through the covers for four more!
length on the stumps, stays back and nudges this to deep midwicket. They think about two, but it's fielded well in the deep to keep it to one.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: length on the stumps, driven down to long on
length on the stumps, goes hard but only manages to drive it down to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: slower through the air, catches Zadran early in the drive, but he gets it away towards long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, no run
commentary: full on off, driven hard but straight to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, SIX runs
commentary: Swatted over cow corner! First six of the innings and what a time to get it. This was short of a length in the slot and he gets really good hold of it!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Zadran, no run
commentary: Swing and a miss, as this is pushed through quicker outside off.
length outside off, deftly guided down to third man
short, too short! This has some tennis ball bounce well over the keeper, and Mushfiqur does well to leap and keep this to just the single extra.
Pulled for six! This was the short boundary, and so he didn't really need to time this pull to perfection. The man in the deep thinks he's in it for a moment, but it just keeps going.
Around the wicket, and he beats him outside off. Najibullah looks to go across the line and misses.
Extremely wide of off, the pressure is beginning to tell.
My word what a hit! This is in the slot outside off, and Najibullah just short arm jabs this over long off! Flat and hard, this was timed exquisitely. And that brings up the 100 as well!
Length outside off, and swings again. This time he slices this high towards cover. But it falls safe as the sweeper comes around to collect.
full on off, driven down to sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Saifuddin to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Finds the gap at midwicket! This was full and on the pads, and Ibrahim just flicks this into the gap. The timing again is pristine.
back of a length on the stumps, stays back and knocks this towards square leg for a single
And they keep finding the gaps! Length ball, just backs away smacks this between long on and deep midwicket!
goes again, but this time gets a thick inside edge onto the pads
wide outside off, and this one brings up the fifty partnership!
Another six! How do I even describe this?! This was short and he ends pull/hook/scoop/ramping this over square leg. Incredible hit! Watch it on tv if you can!
And now it's crunched over long off! This is marginally over pitched and it's outta here! Afghanistan are just four away from securing a place in the next round!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mosaddek to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length ball nudged onside
length ball, hit in the air towards deep midwicket
What a way to win it! This was in the slot, and Najibullah just leans back a launches this flat and straight down the ground. What a statement of intent from this young Afghanistan team!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, no run
commentary: full around off and shaping away, pushed it towards mid-off. Not from the middle of the bat though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, no run
commentary: once again on the fuller side. Just outside off and moving away. Naim looks to hit it down the ground but gets it low on the bat. Bounces towards mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, FOUR runs
commentary: Farooqi goes in the search of swing once again but ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps. Naim punches it down the ground, between mid-off and mid-on and picks up a boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, no run
commentary: length outside off, this time nipping back off the seam. Chops it into the ground and back towards the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, no run
commentary: just short of good length, well outside off as well. Naim goes for the cut but misses. The ball was on its way down as it reached the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mohammad Naim, 1 run
commentary: length outside off, goes for the cut but chops it next to the pitch. Rashid runs in from backward point and tries to kick it on to the stumps. Misses. Thilak tells me it would have been out had he hit
full on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg for one
length outside off, a carrom ball that goes straight. Haque was playing for the spin and gets beaten
length ball on the stumps, pushed back
length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on

carrom ball does the trick! Pitches on a length, just outside off. Naim pushes at it despite being nowhere to the pitch of the ball. The ball spins back in, through the big gap between bat and pad, and hits the leg stump

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Anamul, no run
commentary: length ball outside off, tapped towards cover-point, to the right of Rashid who ensures there's no chance of a run
length ball on the pads, tucked away behind square leg. The short fine leg puts in the chase, and the slide, to flicks it back

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Anamul, no run
commentary: slower one, 110kph. Full around off. Anamul was late to pick it and had to defend in the end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Anamul, no run
commentary: another slower one, 104kph. This time in the line of the stumps. Anamul punches it towards mid-off
slightly fuller than good length, around off. Punched to the left of mid-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Shakib, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, defended
length ball but down the leg side. Anamul goes for a sweep but fails to connect. Called a wide
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
length ball, spinning in. Shakib backs away and looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but it was going down. Gets a leg-bye to short third
length ball, spinning in big. Cuts it in front of leg stump towards cover
length ball on the pads, flicked straight towards short fine leg
length outside off, a carrom ball. Goes for the cut and gets beaten

an appeal for lbw. Not given but Afghanistan have gone for the review. Looks out to me. Was short of length on the stumps and spinning in. Anamul bends his back leg as he looks to pull-sweep it. Misses. The ball-tracking shows it hit him in front of middle and leg and would have gone on to hit the leg stump. Bangladesh lose their second wicket
length ball angling across, punched towards Rashid at cover-point
full on the stumps, clears his front leg and hits it over and to the left of the mid-on fielder. A much-needed boundary for Bangladesh
smashed past the point fielder. A length ball, width on offer and Shakib doesn't hesitate in freeing his arms
an offcutter on the stumps. Shakib defends it back towards the bowler
another slower one, 102kph. Shakib waits for it to arrive and cuts it past point. Only a single this time
full outside off, Mushfiqur reaches out for it but fails to connect
length outside off, cuts it past point for a couple

Mujeeb gets his third. Another left-hander bowled through the gate with the carrom ball. Shakib backs away to give him some room and looks to smash it down the ground. Misses it altogether and the ball clatters into middle and leg stump
length ball outside off, dabbed past the slip for two
length ball on the stumps, goes for the reverse sweep but is hit on the pad. Was heading down, I think
length ball straying onto the pads. Misses the flick but will collect a leg-bye to square leg
full on the stumps, flicked towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mushfiqur, no run
commentary: a length ball around off, looked like a googly. Defended

another googly. Comes on the front foot to defend but is beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the front pad. A loud appeal for lbw but not given. Afghanistan have sent this upstairs. No bat involved, but was it spinning down the leg side? The ball tracking says no. The impact was in front of the middle stump and it would have clattered into the leg stump. Mushfiqur walks back. Bangladesh reeling at 28 for 4
full outside off, another googly. Mahmudullah looks to drive through covers, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
length ball around off, tapped towards covers for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, goes back and defends it towards forward square leg
full outside off, 90kph. Flicked towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: use of feet to this length ball outside off. Pushed towards short midwicket
length outside off, stays back and opens the face of the bat to work it towards short third for a quick single
backs away towards the leg side but Nabi follows him with a length ball. Turned towards square leg
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Afif, no run
commentary: length ball on the pads, flicked towards short fine leg
full outside off, backs away but had to reach out in the end. Goes over covers but no real power or timing on it. Lands well short of the deep extra cover who was charging in
full, pitching outside leg and angling in. Afif goes for the pick up shot but misses and is hit on the pads. Gets a leg-bye to square leg
slower one, 100kph. Full outside off and flicked towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, cross-seam. Punched towards long-on
full outside off, flicked towards wide long-on where the deep midwicket fielder and the long-on fielder have a mild collision
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off where Najibullah Zadran slips as he tries to move to his right, and the batters collect an easy single. A sign of dew?
banged into the pitch, is a slower one as well - 111kph. Pulled towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Afif, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, finds the point fielder with the reverse sweep
another reverse sweep, this time he goes to the left of the point fielder but Ibrahim Zadran sprints to his right from deep cover and saves a boundary with a dive
length ball on the stumps, flicked in front of square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: length ball around off and spinning in. Flicked towards midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Mahmudullah, FOUR runs
commentary: length ball but this time it's down the leg side. Mahmudullah flicks it fine this time, to the right of short fine and picks up a boundary
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on. Fifty comes up for Bangladesh
full around off, goes for a slog sweep but fails to middle it. Ends up dragging it towards deep square leg. Sprints back for the second, puts in a dive as well to be on the safer side
length ball on the stumps, flicks it wide of long-on but will get only one this time

given lbw, and reviewed. A googly, pitching on leg and spinning away. The batter was caught on the back foot and was late in bringing the bat down. Hit him just below the knee roll. The replay shows it pitched on middle and leg, hit the batter in front of middle and was going to hit middle and off. Half the Bangladesh side is back in the pavilion
use his feet and flicks it towards square leg. More like from the inside half of the bat

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: length outside off, a googly. Mahmudullah chops it towards short third
