another googly, goes back and punches it to the left of extra cover, who makes a diving stop to keep it to one
length ball on the stumps, stays back and punches it towards long-on
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on for another single
length ball around off, goes back and across and steers it to the right of short third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Mosaddek, SIX runs
commentary: down the track and goes straight down the ground. Got more height than distance. Omarzai runs to his right from long-off and takes it just inside the boundary line and tosses it to Rashid, who came in from long-on. The question is if Omarzai's shoe touched the boundary cushion. The soft signal is out but I think the shoe just brushed the boundary line. The third umpire says as much, so it's a six for Mosaddek and Bangladesh

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Mosaddek, no run
commentary: length outside off, punched towards extra cover off the back foot
length ball on the stumps, moves across and flicks it past square leg for a couple
a googly outside off, 93kph. Mahmudullah looks to drive through covers but gets an inside edge towards backward square leg
use his feet but isn't to the pitch of the ball. Pushes it towards long-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: length outside off, stays back and steers it towards short third
full on the stumps, flicked in front of square leg for one
down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball, too close to it perhaps. Hits it through covers and comes back for the second
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
a carrom ball around off, flicked towards short midwicket. Mujeeb himself fields it
length ball around off, stays back and works it towards deep midwicket
a googly. A length ball outside off, opens the face of the bat to work it towards backward point

length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket. The fielder charges in and throws it to the bowler's end. On the volley to Mujeeb who too a couple of steps but could make only a partial stop
flatter around off, punched towards long-on
length outside off, steered towards backward point
full but angling towards the pads. Mosaddek moves across a touch and flicks it fine for four
a length ball around off and middle, defended
slower one, 108kph. Full outside off, flicked towards midwicket
walks at the bowler and flicks this full ball around off towards deep midwicket
short, pitched well outside off and pulled down towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg with the angle
almost a yorker on the leg stump. Mahmudullah backs away and digs it out towards wide long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mosaddek, no run
commentary: an appeal for stumping. A legbreak around off, spinning away to just miss the off stump. Mosaddek was looking to go inside out over extra cover but misses. Gurbaz collects the ball and breaks the stumps. The foot was grounded but was there some part behind the crease? Yes, a smidgen. Mosaddek survives again
length ball around off and spinning away slightly. Turned in front of square leg. Rashid sprints across to field it but cannot stop the single
full around off, it's another legbreak from Rashid. Mahmudullah goes for the slog sweep but gets more of a top edge. Ibrahim Zadran runs in from deep midwicket, dives forward and completes the catch
googly but down the leg side. Mosaddek manages a faint edge on the flick. The short fine leg should have stopped it. He dives to his right but mesess up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: further down the leg side and a much better connection this time. Even finer and short fine leg had little chance to stop it this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, 1 run
commentary: starts the new spell with a slower one banged into the pitch. 103 kph. Dabbed towards point for a quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: a full toss around off, opens the face of the bat to guide it between point and short third
a slower one bowled into the surface. Mosaddek was looking to pull it first but had ample time to change his mind. Dabs it towards short third in the end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, 1 run
commentary: another slower one. This time slightly fuller and wider. Dabbed to the right of short third. Zazai there
another full toss outside off. Slashes at it but this time there's a deep backward point in place. Only a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, no run
commentary: almost a yorker on the middle stump. Jams his bat at it
length ball outside off, worked towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to Mahedi Hasan, no run
commentary: a wide yorker. Jams his bat at it but fails to connect
another wide yorker. Mahedi throws his bat at it but it's too far away
a slower ball. Full and way outside off. Hits it aerially towards deep extra cover
full and wide. Moves across a touch and opens the face of the bat to steer it to the right of the diving short third
a yorker on the middle stump. Jams his bat at it, gets a bottom edge behind the stumps. Gurbaz sprints in and breaks the stumps with an underarm throw but Mahedi was in by then

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to Mahedi Hasan, no run
commentary: length ball around off, moves across and looks to paddle it over short fine leg but fails to connect
a slower length ball around off, steered towards sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, 1 run
commentary: full outside off, attempts to go over extra cover but mistimes it towards sweeper cover
another full toss outside off, slashed towards deep third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, 1 run
commentary: a slower one into the pitch, pitching outside leg and spinning in. Helped towards short fine leg
goes for the yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps. Worked towards extra cover where Nabi fields it and has a shy at the bowler's end. Misses. A direct hit would have been out

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mahedi Hasan, FOUR runs
commentary: Farooqi hasn't got his length right for the yorker tonight. Another full toss on the stumps, Mahedi moves across and paddles it over short fine leg for four
a length ball on the stumps, backs away and hits it towards long-off
a low full toss around off, pushes it to the left of mid-off where the fielder makes a tumbling stop
a slower one, full outside off, opens the face of the bat to dig it out towards the left of short third who makes a partial stop and that's enough to keep it to one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Azmatullah to Mahedi Hasan, FOUR runs
commentary: a length ball outside off, 140kph. Mahedi uses that pace and scoops it between the keeper and short third for four

a bouncer on the stumps, Mahedi goes for the pull but fails to connect. Mosaddek charges in for a bye but looks like Mahedi wasn't informed. He was still in his crease when Mosaddek is almost next to him. Gurbaz lobs the ball to the bowler who breaks the stumps. Mahedi sacrifices his wicket
full outside off, Mosaddek was backing away and can only watch the ball go through to the keeper. He looks at the umpire hoping for a wide but it's not
economy of six in Kohli's first over. Tidy sixth-bowler job so far. Full on off, and flicked to deep midwicket where the man runs in to ensure it stays just one
back of a length ball just outside off. Through to Pant, but the side-on umpire believes it's too high. Wide given

full ball just outside off. Pace off it seems, and Shah goes for a lofted shot over long off, but has only scooped it. Bishnoi - the sub - runs in, dives forward, and takes a catch while grazing the ground. A bit of a nervous wobble as the ball pops out but he recovered well to ensure it stayed in despite the elbows hitting the ground that can very often force the ball out of one's grasp
full ball outside off stump. Dug away to deep point for a couple more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Zeeshan Ali, no run
commentary: good length ball, just outside off. Tries the late cut, but can't beat Jadeja at short third. Jadeja did try the direct-hit at the batter's end but misses! Zeeshan would've been out since he slipped and fell halfway down the track
length ball, just outside off stump. Slapped to cover, and they scurry across for one
good length just outside off. Nurdled off the back foot with the bat's open face. Stopped at short third
McKechnie backs away with Bhuvi running in, but gets into position before the ball is delivered. Tries the reverse lap to this full ball outside off, but misses.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Zeeshan Ali, SIX runs
commentary: full ball outside off. He backs away slightly, allowing him to free his arms a bit more, and absolutely tonks a lofted six over cover! In the slot, and put away. Picked the offcutter well too.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to Zeeshan Ali, 1 run
commentary: yorker attempted, almost perfect. Zeeshan drills a drive to cover for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to McKechnie, no run
commentary: full on middle and leg. Can't get the bat's flow through the ball well. Mistimed to the bowler's left

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to McKechnie, SIX runs
commentary: that's gone all the way! Short ball outside off, McKechnie jumps up, his legs not in touch with the ground as he slaps a six over deep third!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to McKechnie, FOUR runs
commentary: flourish of the wrists as this full ball on his pads is successfully clipped behind square for four!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Avesh Khan to McKechnie, FOUR runs
commentary: short third fails to dive and stop this late cut off this length ball, and Avesh will end up conceding 53 runs. McKechnie waited for the ball to get to him before playing the shot past Chahal.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zeeshan Ali, 1 run
commentary: around the stumps, yorker attempted, ends up as a very low full toss. Swiped to deep square leg
another low full toss on leg stump. Drives with the bat's open face to backward point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zeeshan Ali, FOUR runs
commentary: full toss on off. Gets low and laps it fine, past the leg stump, and even past short fine leg! Moved to the off side to play that shot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zeeshan Ali, FOUR runs
commentary: 150 for Hong Kong - only the second team (after India in this first innings) to get 150+ in the 2022 Asia Cup. Yorker on off but Zeeshan backs away, gets low, sticks the bat out, and guides a shot between short third and point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zeeshan Ali, 1 run
commentary: full toss on off. Driven to deep point for a single
full outside off. Sliced drive to deep point and India win by 40 runs

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rahul, no run
commentary: length ball around off, stays in his crease and defends
length ball but sliding down the leg side. India open their account with a wide

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rahul, no run
commentary: length outside off, punched gently towards cover
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to work it towards third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: length ball angling towards middle and leg, helped towards deep square leg
short of length on the stumps, a bit of extra bounce. Rahul stays back and turns it towards short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: full on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket for another single
length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
length outside off, comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, looks to punch off the back foot but the ball hits the inside half of the bat and dribbles towards mid-off
length outside off, punched towards cover
length outside off, comes forward and punches it towards cover again
full outside off, comes forward and goes for a drive. Ends up mistiming it back towards the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: Rohit breaks the shackles. Charges down the track and smashes it over the bowler's head for the first six of the evening

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: short of length around off, uses his wrists to flick it towards midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: length ball around off, turns it towards midwicket and will get a single this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rahul, (no ball) 2 runs
commentary: too full on the stumps, clipped to the left of short fine leg. He puts in the chase to keep it to two. Haroon, though, has overstepped
think he tried a slower one there but it didn't come out well. Ends up bowling it high and wide, doesn't even land in the line of the pitch. So that's another no ball

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rahul, SIX runs
commentary: length ball around off, Rahul stays still and smashes it in front of deep square leg, all the way for a six
goes for the yorker but it's down the leg side. Rahul takes it on the full and flicks it behind square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: a length ball around off, Rohit stays back and punches it to the right of the cover fielder, who put in a dive but to no avail. That makes it 22 from this over
starts with a full ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, flatter at 94kph. Punched towards long-on
short of length on the stumps, goes back and punches it to the left of mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: short of length on middle and leg. Flatter and quicker. Pushed towards short midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
commentary: length ball on the pads, Rohit flicks it towards deep square leg, and comes back for the second before the deep midwicket fielder cuts it off and sends in the throw

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, goes for the sweep. Gets it towards short fine leg off the inside edge
length outside off, stays back and punches it towards cover
full outside off. Comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover. He's looking a bit tentative here
length outside off, cuts it fine towards deep third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shukla to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: length ball on the stumps, Rohit takes a step towards the leg side even before the bowler released the ball. By the time it reached him, he was still and launched it over the bowler's head for four

Hong Kong get the first wicket. This time Rohit moves towards the off side but Shukla slips in an offcutter. Rohit goes for the pull but the ball hits him high on the bat, almost towards the edge and Aizaz takes a good catch, coming in from mid-on and diving forward
full on the stumps, chips it down the ground aerially but it's well short and to the left of mid-on. He dives across to make a partial stop, mid-off tidies it up
full outside off, punched to the left of mid-off for a quick single
short of length around off, punched towards long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Kohli, no run
commentary: length around off, comes forward and defends
full around off, fired in at 104kph. Kohli uses his wrists to push it towards long-on
full around off, looks to push at it but the ball takes a thick outside edge goes to the right of the keeper. Short third chases and keeps it to one
length ball on the stumps, punched towards the left of mid-off
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards long-on for one
length, pitching on leg and going further down. Rahul leaves that alone
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
uses his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball and flicks it towards deep midwicket. Along the ground
short of length on the stumps, Rahul goes for the pull but gets a top edge towards deep third. Luckily for him, it lands safely
length outside off, stands tall and casually punches it to the right of the sweeper cover. Jogs back for the second
length ball on the stumps, Kohli places it towards midwicket, sprints for the first and is looking for the second but Rahul says no. The bowler himself does the fielding
full on the stumps, looks to hit through covers but ends up mistiming it towards midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rahul, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
Rahul skips down the track but Murtaza bowls it slow and wide. Rahul had to reach out and cuts it to the right of the diving cover fielder. The sweeper makes a diving stop to his left
length ball on the stumps, goes back and drags it towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Kohli, no run
commentary: 76kph, length ball around off, defended
length around off, rocks back and pulls it towards deep midwicket. Murtaza is bowling in the 70s, which means the batters have to create all the power

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Kohli, no run
commentary: length ball on the pads, misses the flick but the ball brushes the pad. The keeper makes it a tumbling stop to his left
full around off, looks to hit it towards deep midwicket but the bat face closes a touch too early, meaning he fails to middle it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Rahul, SIX runs
commentary: full around middle, and Rahul just launches it over deep midwicket, for an 83 metre six
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
length outside off, drops it towards cover-point and sets off for a quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Rahul, no run
commentary: length ball around middle. Was looking to turn it on the leg side but gets an outside edge towards mid-off. Rahul wanted a single but Kohli says no

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Kohli, no run
commentary: length ball outside off, Kohli comes down the track and cuts it towards extra cover
full on the stumps, turned towards the vacant short midwicket region
length ball around off, goes back and hits it aerially towards long-on. No timing on that
length outside off, 79kph. Kohli pushes it towards cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rahul, no run
commentary: length ball on the leg stump, goes for the fine flick/pull but misses and is hit on the pads. The impact was outside the leg stump
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
full on middle and leg. Flicked off his toes before the ball could turn. To deep midwicket

Kohli gets back on strike with some quick running. Full just outside off, and he came down the ground to drill it straight back. Ball was in the air and Ghazanfar put his right hand out to catch it, but it hit his fingers before going to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: was there a message passed along at the drinks break? Tossed up around off. Kohli skips down the track and hammers it over the bowler's head!
full on off. Full face of the bat offered and the legbreak is driven to long off
full on off and smothered past Kohli to long on for a walking single
he'll keep strike. Flatter delivery, and he rocks back before hammering a shot to deep midwicket
the left-arm spinner coming around the wicket pitches it full, and slightly outside off. Kohli comes down the track and mistimes a lofted shot towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rahul, no run
commentary: slower through the air. Fullish on off. Cuts off the back foot, to point

a couple more for India. Rahul moves across to the off side and the bowler delivers a fullish ball on middle and leg. Tries to play a sweep fine, but hits his glove, past the keeper's grasp. And two more to the total
full outside off. Rahul comes down the track and mistimes a shot to long on's right
full on off. Presses forward to block. Takes the outside edge and rolls away to short third for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rahul, no run
commentary: less than six runs in this over. Rahul tries the reverse paddle, but he may have gotten saved despite missing the shot, since impact on his pad/body was outside leg stump. Soft LBW appeal turned down. Rahul had changed his stance as soon as Murtaza delivered the ball, but perhaps was done in by the lack of pace from the left-arm bowler.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Kohli, no run
commentary: full on off. Presses forward to fend it to the bowler's left. He runs square to intercept
Kohli operating at a strike-rate of 100 too. Full on off. Comes down the track and drills a shot to long on along the carpet
length ball on off. And skidding into middle. Cut to deep point for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: maximum! And that's got the crowd on its feet. Full just outside off. Kohli gets down on one knee, and absolutely creams a slog sweep over cow corner. Fifty stand in 7.5 overs
flatter, and wide outside off. Slapped to deep point

out for a 39-ball 36! Full, just outside off. Rahul tries to drag a sweep from outside off, but it's taken an edge. Hits the keeper on the chest, but he keeps his eyes on the ball and collects on the rebound. Extra bounce off the surface, it seems.
full ball on middle and leg. Worked off his pads to deep midwicket, and because it is gently played they will get the second run
brings Suryakumar Yadav on strike for the first time today. Good length just outside off. Rocks back and swipes a shot to deep midwicket's left

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Yadav, FOUR runs
commentary: sweeps from way outside off and hits it behind square, past the fielder at deep square leg. Full, quite wide outside off, but that's no problem for SKY. Big stride forward, and nice low centre of gravity while playing the shot.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Yadav, FOUR runs
commentary: two in two! Another sweep, this one much finer, past short fine leg, and deep square leg can't cut it off either. Got into position early, and a simple choice for him given how slow the bowler is delivering 'em in.
good length on off. Punched off the back foot to deep midwicket. Fielder is on the line, so these guys come back for the second run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Yadav, no run
commentary: fullish, on off. Yadav stays on the back foot and gently taps it to the bowler's right. Murtaza finishes his four overs for 27
fullish on off, and a cover drive finds the infielder. Nice sound off the bat though
keeper standing up, by the way. Good length just outside off, and he flat-bats a shot to long on's right
full ball angling into his pads. Flourishing wrists in his flick to deep square leg
good length ball angling into leg stump. Clipped off his pads to deep square leg once more

his third boundary in six balls And once again behind square on the leg side. Full toss around leg, and Yadav swept it quite hard to fine leg. Fielder was there for the shot, but..... the ball bursts through his hands! Ehsan a bit lazy in his attempt, not getting low enough, nor getting his legs behind the ball by bending down
full ball just outside off. Yadav tries his well-tested sweep, but misses on this occasion. Smart grab by the gloveman

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: full on middle. Kohli skips down the ground and gets to the pitch of the ball before lofting a six over deep midwicket. Sets the tone for the over, right from the first ball. Seems like Aizaz bowled a pace-off delivery, but no problem for VK
good length ball just outside off. Opens the bat's face and gets it to short third. A few metres on either side of the fielder and that was four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Yadav, FOUR runs
commentary: strike rate of 237.50 with his fourth boundary in eight deliveries. Length ball, a bit wide outside off. Yadav backs away slightly and slashes hard, getting a thick edge on purpose over short third for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Yadav, SIX runs
commentary: that's outta here! Full ball on middle. Suryakumar gets low, moves to the off side, falls over slightly, but in that process also ends up scooping a six over the keeper's left for six
offcutter, length ball outside off. Cut square, in the air for a bit, but lands well in front of deep point
full ball on leg, but going down for a wide. Kohli did attempt a flick though
he'll keep strike, and the over ends on 20 runs. Back of a length outside off, and he mistimes a pull to deep midwicket's left

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Kohli, no run
commentary: the offie is back. Full just outside off, darting it in. Kohli tried a reverse paddle, but misses. Keeper gets low and collects.
flat delivery, length-ish just outside off. Pushed off the back foot to long on for a single
full ball, almost a flat yorker on leg stump. Tries to flick it square but inside-edged onto his pads. Ball rolls away to the off side
moves to 48 with that single. Full just outside off. Toe-ends a drive to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Yadav, no run
commentary: darts it in, on middle and leg. Almost a yorker. Dug back to the bowler.

keeper can't collect, allowing India an extra run and bringing SKY on strike for the next over. Full and wide outside off, but inside the tram-lines. Suryakumar offered no shot, but the keeper can't take it on the half volley. Hits his glove and rolls away to short third
slapped over cover! Fullish just outside off. Suryakumar stands tall and hits it over the infield. Backed away oh-so-slightly before caressing it for the boundary

make that a double, good sir! Short-ish ball just outside off. Suryakumar slashes hard at it, and gets an edge past the keeper, and it's raced past the short third fielder for four. Fifty partnership in 4.2 overs

full on leg stump and he tries the sweep. Misses, and very nearly clips leg stump. They also appeal for an lbw but the umpire puts his arms wide to give the extra. Replays suggest that hit his heel in front of leg - probably would've been out had they reviewed

is he stumped? Umpire is going up. Suryakumar attempts the ramp over the keeper off this short ball but misses. McKechnie collects in front of his eyeline and brings the hands down quickly to dislodge the stumps. Was his back leg outside the crease? Before we check the stumping, the TV umpire Asif Yaqoob wants to check if there was an edge off the bat. Nope, no edge, so we check for the stumping now. And Suryakumar is very safe, his back leg is grounded a feet or so inside the popping crease.
will that non-review hurt Hong Kong? Suryakumar joins Kohli in the forties with an outrageous flick off his toes over deep square leg! Full ball, and Suryakumar shows off how good his wristwork is.
back of a length outside off. Tries the cut, perhaps got an edge, but the keeper can't grab it. Hits his glove and rolls away to short third. We need a replay to see if there was an edge or not...
good length on off. Backs away to cut to point.

fullish on middle. Clipped to deep midwicket's right and skips back for the second run! Fifty - his 31st in T20Is, equalling Rohit's tally. A sedate celebration from him, but the pavillion is on its feet.
full on off, and drilled to long on for a walking single
full on middle, almost a yorker. Suryakumar tries to play an inside out drive but hits the bat's inside half. Rolls away to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: class personified! Ehsan goes full and flat on middle. But Kohli clears the front leg, gets down on one knee, and picks it up beautifully to deposit a six over deep midwicket. A 91-metre six.
full toss on leg stump with Kohli backing away exposing all three stumps. Mistimed drive to deep extra cover's right for two more
full ball, darted just outside leg stump, and to the keeper. Props to him for grabbing it low with Ehsan bowling it quick

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Kohli, no run
commentary: finishes on 0 for 26 despite an expensive final over. Full ball on middle. Kohli tries to go over deep midwicket again but the shot hits his body

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Yadav, SIX runs
commentary: moves to 48 with that maximum! Full toss, wide outside off, and he slashes it rather beautifully over deep backward point! Wrists to the fore again, they need to be strong for a shot like that to go for six.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Yadav, SIX runs
commentary: full and wide outside off. Suryakumar moves to the off side and slices a drive on purpose, and this has flown over deep point! A 22-ball fifty at a strike-rate of just under 250. A nice 69-metre six that gets Hardik clapping from near the dugout.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Yadav, SIX runs
commentary: eighteen off the first three balls! Slower ball on off. Yadav keeps a still head and offers the full face of the bat as he lofts it over the bowler's head.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Yadav, no run
commentary: short and wide, pace off this time. Tries to cut it behind square, but misses. On the bounce to the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Yadav, SIX runs
commentary: fourth six of the over as this slow length delivery on his body is pulled behind square. Bit of a top edge as it goes behind the keeper for six more. Crowd catch too, it appears!

a 26-run over to end the innings and India finish on an imposing 192 for 2. Length ball outside off. Suryakumar comes down the track and tries to hit it over cover, but mistimed. Ball rolls away to long on and Kohli pushes SKY for the second. Hong Kong need 193 to win
Banged in short outside off, was an on-pace ball. He keeps the pull down to wide long on and they take a couple of runs.
Edged and goes for a four. Oh, some luck now for Shanaka. Throws the slower length ball wide. Shanaka looks to force it through covers, edges and the ball races past the keeper.
Angled into Shanaka who is rapped on the pads with the ball sliding down.
Banged in short on off, he gets well across and pulls to backward square leg
Short and wide, but he does not find the gap on the cut. Finds point, who collects it on the bounce.
Back of a length angled into Shanka who punches to deep cover. There is a bit of a misfield but no harm done.
Short and wide, he slams the cut straight to point.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: A bit round arm around middle stump, he taps it to midwicket with soft hands and collects two

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: In the slot, he drills it down to long off but the field is set for such shots

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Shanaka, FOUR runs
commentary: Gets the width and gets the four. Low full toss outside off, he gives himself room and laces it through covers for a much-needed four.

Down the ground and Mosaddek takes the catch! Is this the game? Was in the slot on middle, Shanaka gets a good piece of it but not enough and long on takes a simple catch. he was looking to hit it hard but failed to clear the ropes.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: Flatter on middle and leg, he taps it to midwicket for a run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: Slower length ball outside off, he flays it in the gap between deep cover and deep point. They take on the arm and has the dive saved Karunaratne? Yes, it has. He needed to get the dive in and he made it. The throw also wasn't the best, I must add. Wasn't as powerful and bounced before Mushfiqur took it.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: Length on middle and leg, he gets across and works to deep midwicket. They once again take on the throw and make it much easily this time with the throw too wide.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to C Karunaratne, (no ball) FOUR runs
commentary: He's got it past short fine leg. Uses the crease so well. Length well outside off, he gets inside the line and helps it over short fine leg. Oh, dear it gets worse. Ebadot has over-stepped.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to C Karunaratne, 2 runs
commentary: Leg-cutter outside off, he gets deep in his crease, and slams it straight down. Shabbir runs across from long on, catches and releases the ball just as he was going over the boundary. Important runs saved

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to C Karunaratne, 1 leg bye
commentary: Back of a length on the hips, he looks to help it away, but is hit around the midriff and they take a leg bye

Shakib, you beauty! Karunaratne is run out and with that Bangladesh's chances go up by quite a notch. Short of a length on off, he gets a leading edge to Shakib at short cover. They run, for some reason. Shakib waits for it and hits the stumps to find Karunaratne way short.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to Asitha Fernando, 1 wide
commentary: Length outside off, but way down wide of the tramlines

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ebadot Hossain to Asitha Fernando, FOUR runs
commentary: Oh, that is such an important boundary! Slower length ball outside off, he clears his front leg and swipes it over covers for a four.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Theekshana, 1 leg bye
commentary: Flatter on middle and leg, he skips down and looks to hoick it away but is rapped on the pads. They sneak a leg bye

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Asitha Fernando, FOUR runs
commentary: One-bounce four! Top shot from Fernando. Tossed up outside, he gets the slog sweep out and slams it wide of long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mahedi Hasan to Asitha Fernando, (no ball) 2 runs
commentary: Tossed up on off, he slams it down the ground and some excellent running gives them two. Just one needed. Haaaang on a minute, hang on a minute! The siren goes off, it's a no ball. Yes, nothing was behind the crease. Sri Lanka win by 2 wickets and with that they qualify for Super 4.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 4 leg byes
commentary: Strays on the pads, and it's glanced fine for four! Great start for Bangladesh, bit wayward one from Sri Lanka and Madushanka.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: wide of off now, length. Miraz goes for the drive but can't connect cleanly. Dribbles to cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: Shape in from a length, bit of extra bounce. Miraz looks to drop and run but wisely decides against it.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: beats the outside edge! This one shapes away a touch from a fullish length. Goes for the drive but is beaten for pace.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 3 runs
commentary: Full outside off and wide. Slashes at this and gets the drive high over point for a couple as third man comes around to sweep up.

Paddle sweep down to fine leg! Bit of invention here, as Sabbir premeditates and just about gets the connection he wants. Fine leg is in and this flies high over his head. The timing is not quite right, but the ball has enough legs to reach the ropes.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: Goes for a big heave over square leg, but is beaten on the under edge.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs
commentary: Full on off, driven to cover. It should be just a single but there's no one backing up at the non-striker's end and they get overthrows.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: length on the stumps, gets the front foot across and works this to deep backward square leg
Carrom ball! Beats the outside edge off a good length.
Sabbir looks to work this onside from a length and almost gets a leading edge back to the bowler.
good length on the stumps, stays back and pushes this back to Theekshana.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs
commentary: Charges down the track and looks to drive this high over mid-off. He doesn't get the connection though, but still manages a couple as this just about clears the infield.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: Shorter this time and it's pulled towards deep midwicket. Again doesn't get the timing as it bounces well short of the man in the deep
short of a length and another pull. Again can't get the timing, but this is in the gap between square leg and midwicket for one.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: Short and pulled, once more mistimed down to deep square leg

Edged and taken! The peppering of short stuff gets the desired result! Sabbir goes for another pull, and he's once more late on the stroke. But this time he can only get a thick edge through to the keeper.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Shakib, no run
commentary: Big swing and a miss! This is angling away from the left hander, and he goes for an almighty heave first up. Gets nowhere near it as he's beaten on the outside edge. There's a brief chat between the SL players about a review for caught behind, but they decide against.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: length on off, stays in the crease and pokes this to point for a quick single. Good running.
length on the stumps, back foot punch to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, SIX runs
commentary: Down the ground and launched over long-off! Great use of the feet, and this goes flat and far.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: length on the stumps, gets forward and works this past midwicket for one
Around the wicket now, length on the stumps. Driven straight to cover.
Quicker ball, 103kph, but on the pads. Worked in front of square for one
Slower ball, 122kph, back of a length. Shakib is looking to smash this but is forced to hold back and dab it to mid-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: Good length, shaping away, and beats Miraz on the outside edge of his backfoot defence. Beautiful bowling.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, SIX runs
commentary: Scoop/ramped for a maximum! Reminiscent of SKY from the other night, as he uses the pace and gets this high over the keeper's head.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs
commentary: Crunched down the ground now! This was fuller from Asitha and Miraz was waiting for it, as he absolutely nails this drive past a diving mid-off.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 4 byes
commentary: Three in three! Strays on the pads and this glances off the batter's pads and past the keeper. Byes given, even though there was a clear deflection off the pad.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 3 runs
commentary: full outside off and this is slashed high over point, and incredibly falls safe as three fielders converge around it. It's in the air for quite some time and they manage three.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
commentary: short and pulled down to deep square leg. Again the timing is just not there.
length on the pads, nudged down to backward square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs
commentary: down the track and smacked over cover! Adjusts beautifully here, as the bowler drags it short seeing Miraz come down the track, but the batter is ready for it and just slaps it over the infield.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: Again down the track, but only manages an inside edge to this length ball

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run
commentary: Attempted yorker outside off, dug out towards short third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs
commentary: full on off, opens the face and guides this to the right of short third. Deep cover comes around to collect.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Shakib, 1 run
commentary: tossed up on middle, worked to square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 leg bye
commentary: Big appeal for leg before from Hasaranga, as Miraz is beaten by the googly! Given not out and SL review. Miraz goes for the forward defence and his struck on the front pad, only question is whether this is striking in line, there's no bat involved. And the impact is indeed outside the line, so Sri Lanka have lost a review.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Shakib, no run
commentary: short and wide, cut hard to cover. Missed opportunity for Shakib.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Shakib, 1 run
commentary: floated on off now, and this is driven in the air but long-off is in place to keep it to a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, OUT
commentary: And Hasaranga, as he so often does, strikes in his first over! This was a tossed up googly on a length, and Miraz goes across the line with the sweep. He gets nowhere near it though, and he hears that dreaded death rattle as the middle and leg is disturbed.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mushfiqur, 1 run
commentary: length outside off, googly. Mushfiqur goes back and cuts this to backward point for one.
leg cutter to start, which Mushfiqur guides down to third man with soft hands

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Shakib, no run
commentary: full on off, Shakib looks to lean back and hit this back down the ground but can't connect as he would like. Goes straight to Chamika on the bounce.
Short and top edged on the pull. Shakib is very lucky here as it falls agonisingly wide of short fine leg running around.
length on off, dabbed past point for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Mushfiqur, no run
commentary: full and strikes him on the pads. This is going down leg, but Mushfiqur knows he should be putting those away
Edged and gone! Back of a length and jagging away having pitched on middle, it has Mushfiqur defending on the back foot as the ball takes a healthy nick through to Mendis behind the stumps.
length on the stumps, looks to works this onside, but only gets an inside edge onto his pads
fuller and driven back to Theekshana
pushed through fuller once more, makes room and drives this down to sweeper cover
length on off, opens the face and guides this to backward point for a quick single
Finds the gap between long off and extra cover! Great shot, as this was a touch over pitched and he drives it beautifully in the gap.
Another fortunate escape for Shakib! He goes for a sweep, and ends up top edging this high and straight. Long-off runs in to take the catch but can't get there in time.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Shakib, FOUR runs
commentary: Scooped for four! Shuffles across and just uses the pace to run this down to fine leg. 6000 runs for Shakib as well!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Shakib, FOUR runs
commentary: And it's a carbon copy of the previous stroke! Great batting from Shakib,
full on off, driven to the right of extra cover for one
full on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
Full on off, and driven hard square. Sweeper cover collects

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Afif, FOUR runs
commentary: Short on the pads, and this pulled fine down to fine leg for four more! Great over for Bangladesh.
Gives himself just a bit of room to the flatter one on middle, taps to covers for a run
Quicker, on the pads, he gets across and works it towards midwicket where the fielder gives chase and intercepts

Cleans him with a ripper! Flights this one ever so slightly, Shakib as he has done all innings, gives himself room looking to loft over covers. Theekshana though keeps it wicket to wicket as the ball turns just that bit and beats Shakib all ends up. The middle stump takes a beating. Was the conventional off-break from Theekshana and had Shakib deceived. The batter is livid with himself as he walks off.
Flatter outside off, he cuts it to point off the backfoot.
Wrong'un on middle and leg, picked up well as he goes back and works it to deep midwicket
Off break angled into the batter, who watches closely and pushes to point. Excellent spell from Theekshana.
Short of a length rising around the hip area as Mahmudullah mistimes his pull close to the bowler
Another short of the length delivery outside off, he goes back, stands tall and dabs it to third man for a run
Good pace, banged in short outside off. He shapes up for the pull but is beaten by the pace. Does not connect.

Lovely yorker on middle stump, he digs it nicely to backward point where Gunathilaka flies to his right and intercepts. Oh, they are checking for a catch as well. Looked like a bump ball on first glance. The soft signal is not out. Yep, the batter had squeezed it into the ground with the ball flying to backward point.
Length on on middle and leg, 141.1 kph, he looks to chip it much squarer but can only miscue it to long on but had mistimed it so much that long on was not able to get to it.
Slower length ball around off, he gets across, taps it to midwicket and sets off looking for two. The bowler though does brilliantly to sprint across and prevent the batters.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: Flighted nicely on off, he can only mis-hit it back to the bolwer

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, 1 run
commentary: tossed up outside off, was the conventional legspinner, he pushes past point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Afif, FOUR runs
commentary: Smashes it straight back and gets a four! Loopy leggie outside off, he smokes it straight and the long off was very wide to intercept.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Afif, SIX runs
commentary: Googly outside leg stump, he spots it very early, gets the sweep out and absolutely pummels it over deep square leg . That was a top shot.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Afif, 1 run
commentary: Flighted on middle and leg, he turns it towards midwicket and sensibly takes a run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: Legspinner again on off, he gets a good stride out and defends it
Back of a length on off, he plays the short arm jab to long on.
Length on the pads, he flicks it nicely to the right of backward square leg for a brace. Got that in the gap nicely, did Mahmudullah
Back of a length on middle and leg, he works it to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Afif, no run
commentary: Sower short ball on middle, he works it to short fine leg who collects it on the bounce. They were looking for a run, but Afif was sent back and rightly so. Mahmudullah would not have made it.
Slower off-cutter on middle and leg, he works to deep midwicket. Timed it a bit too well to collect a couple.
Banged in short into the body of Mahmudullah who gets across and helps it to deep square leg for a run.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: Fuller on middle and leg, squeezes it to covers as he shimmies down the pitch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, SIX runs
commentary: Sound good and goes all the way! Picks the wrong'un, gets the slog sweep out and nails it in front of square. That is a timely six.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, FOUR runs
commentary: Fabulous! Flighted outside off, this time he gives himself room and goes inside out with the spin over extra cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, 2 runs
commentary: Googly on middle and leg, keeps a bit low as he adjusts and works it in the gap between long on and midwicket.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, no run
commentary: Flighted outside off, he pushes to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, 2 runs
commentary: Excellent running by the duo! Wrong'un, picked up well again. He just taps it to deep midwicket with soft hands and scampers back for two runs.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Afif, no run
commentary: Back of a length on leg stump, he shapes up for the scoop but gets hit on the pads instead as the ball rolls to the keeper.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Afif, SIX runs
commentary: SHOT, Sir! Slower short of a length delivery on middle, he gets inside the line of it and slams the pull over backward square leg. He did not have a lot of pace to work with but did well to juuust clear the leaping fielder.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Afif, FOUR runs
commentary: Oh, nicely done! Fuller, pacy delivery on middle, he gets across and this time nails the scoop over short fine leg. Afif is playing a gem.
Rolls his fingers on the length ball on the pads, he turns it with soft hands to deep square leg and some superb running gets them two
Length outside off, he laces the drive to mid-off and sets off for a quick run. The fielder has a shy at the stumps, misses but Afif would have made it.
Full toss on the pads, Mahmudullah does not capitalise fully and can just work it to the right of backward square leg for a brace
Ah, that was a poor delivery down leg. Length on the pads, easy pickings for Afif who just flicks it over short fine leg.
Slower back of a length delivery outside off, he cuts it to deep point
Excellent yorker on leg stump, he gets hit on his pads with the ball rolling to the on side. They scamper for a leg-bye.

Picks out the fielder to precision! Slower length ball on middle stump, Afif was looking to go much straighter but loses shape and ends up dragging it to cow corner where Hasaranga pouches a simple catch.
Banged in short leg stump, he gets across in a bid to pull it away. Instead, it catches his gloves as the ball rolls past short fine leg.
Length outside off, he turns it to deep square leg to retain strike.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahmudullah, OUT
commentary: Hasaranga returns and gets the big fish! Flighted gently on off, was the leg-spinner. Mahmudullah was looking for the slog sweep, but looks like was deceived by the slowness and was into his shot a bit early. Ends up getting a top edge with Chamika Karunaratne at deep midwicket taking a simple catch.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: Ah, good shot! Uses his feet to the leggie and tonks it straight over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mosaddek, 2 runs
commentary: Googly on off, he waits for and plays the late cut past short third man.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: Oh, yes! That's a shot and a half!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mosaddek, 1 run
commentary: Another late cut to the wrong'un, he cannot beat short third man this time around with the fielder putting in a dive to his left.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Mahedi Hasan, 1 run
commentary: shorter outside off, he goes back and punches to deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Mahedi Hasan, OUT
commentary: Slower length ball on middle and leg, he looks to work it to the on-side, misses and is caught plumb in front of the wicket. He reviews, but I am guessing more in hope. Yep, the ball-tracker confirms that would have smashed into leg stump.
Back of a length outside off, that was again a slower ball. Taskin lofts it over extra cover, three fielder gives chase and a boot is needed to rein it in. They take three.
Slower back of length on off, he gets across and works to deep midwicket for a run

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Taskin, no run
commentary: Slower short ball outside off, he is into the pull very early and misses
Slower bouncer again, Taskin is again into the shot early. Gets a thick inside edge to the right of short fine leg.

he is dealing slower deliveries here. Another one back of a length around middle, spotted early by the batter who clatters it wide of deep square leg. The fielder, though runs, dives and keeps them down to two.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Taskin, no run
commentary: Length outside off, he looks to flay it away but misses. The umpire deems that was inside the tramline.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Taskin, SIX runs
commentary: BANG! In the slot outside off, he stays deep in his crease, gives himself room and smokes it over wide long off for a half a dozen. This is Bangladesh's highest score in the UAE
Full outside off, he shuffles across and drills it to deep cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: A horror misfield and that goes for a four. Shanaka, the captain, the culprit. Back of a length outside off, he punches it hard to extra cover who lets it through.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Mosaddek, FOUR runs
commentary: Length outside leg, but he gives himself room and absolutely thumps it straight down the ground. What a hit that was! Did not move, did Mosaddek
Low full toss on leg stump, he works this to deep midwicket and they collect two runs to end the innings.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, 5 wide
commentary: inswinger starting on leg and keeps going down for five wides

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: on a length, just outside off, defended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: inswinger, headed towards off stump, hits the inner edge of the bat

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: another inswinger, this time ending up on middle, 144ks, defended back to him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: a bit of a swipe but not full enough, and goes off the inner half of the bat to square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: another inswinger, short of a length, another inside edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, 1 run
commentary: another inswinger, pushed wide of mid-on this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: starts off conventionally, looking for top of off, defended with an open face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Nizakat Khan, FOUR runs
commentary: gets the width, on a length, 140ks, and Nizakat is anyway looking to stay beside the line of the ball. Drives this over point for four
short of a length, just outside off, pushed with an open face between point and cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Nizakat Khan, no run
commentary: goes into the pitch, wicket to wicket, pushed to midwicket this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Nizakat Khan, 2 leg byes
commentary: Dahani slides down the leg side. Nizakat is beaten on the flick but gets two leg-byes to fine leg
short of a length, into the body, pushed wide of midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, 1 wide
commentary: wide down the leg side. This time Rizwan gets a hand to it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nizakat Khan, OUT
commentary: looks to drive this over square again, but this time he gets just the toe end. Looks like it has arrived before he is through the shot. This is full and at 143ks and outside off. He is trying to drive from deep inside the crease

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Babar Hayat, no run
commentary: wide length ball, left alone

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Babar Hayat, no run
commentary: this one seems to have nipped away. Short of a length, just outside off, moves against the angle and goes past the edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Babar Hayat, no run
commentary: short of a length, outside off, pushed into the covers

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Babar Hayat, OUT
commentary: four dots, a slog and timber. That's Hayat's innings. No foot movement. Deep in the crease and heaves at this length ball. It nips back in a little and kisses the top of off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: on a length, hits the pad first perhaps but it has pitched outside leg anyway
flat, on a length, worked past midwicket for one
fuller, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
flatter, short of a length, punched down to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: gets the length right, on off, Shah looks for turn but there isn't any. Inside edge back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: fired in, too quick for him, hits the pad

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: slows it down this time with the same result. A dot. Hits his pad again but no turn to draw an lbw appeal

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Yasim Murtaza, no run
commentary: on a length, outside off, pushed to mid-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Yasim Murtaza, no run
commentary: big slower ball, wide outside off, 111ks, goes under his drive

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Yasim Murtaza, no run
commentary: on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Yasim Murtaza, no run
commentary: HK batters are getting caught deep inside the crease to full balls. This is a long half-volley, but he is no position to drive it. Ends up pushing it to mid-on
late on the pull and he is caught. Dahani gets it head high, and Murtaza manages just a soft top edge. Khushdil charges in from mid-on and dives to take the low catch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Dahani to Aizaz Khan, no run
commentary: wicket-maiden. On a length, on off, defended with an open face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: quick, quick. Short of a length, 145ks, goes past the bat on the angle

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kinchit Shah, FOUR runs
commentary: lovely shot. Uses Rauf's pace against him. Arches back to guide this 147ks short-of-a-length delivery square of deep third with an open face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kinchit Shah, 1 run
commentary: short of a length, no room, worked to midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Aizaz Khan, no run
commentary: short of a length, 142ks, but sits in the surface. Played to cover-point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Aizaz Khan, no run
commentary: short of a length, 147ks, outside off, goes past the bat. It has skidded through and not carried to Rizwan

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Aizaz Khan, 1 run
commentary: on a length, headed for top of middle, worked to leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Aizaz Khan, no run
commentary: full, just outside off, pushed to point

doesn't pick the wrong'un. Is done in by length too. Goes back to look to late-cut this length ball, but it pitches on on off and turns back in. Too full to cut anyway, and then the turn in does him completely. Four down now
another wrong'un, but this is a wide down leg. Mind you, don't think McKechnie picked it
too full and wide, he opens the face, guides it past short third
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
stays back to defend this legbreak
sweeps it from outside off. Nails the timing, but can't beat long leg. Just the single
full down the leg side, but no pace to work with. Just the single to short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to Kinchit Shah, no run
commentary: stays back to try to punch this length ball to long-on. Can't beat the bowler

full enough for the lbw? The umpire thinks so, but the batter has reviewed it. Nawaz is bowling from round the wicket and bowls it full. Shah is beaten on the slog sweep and hit on the pad. But I don't see any turn back in. The only way he gets the lbw then is with a really full ball that doesn't have time to angle past the off stump. This is full enough. Just about. Clipping off, says the ball tracker. That makes it five down
full, middle and leg, goes off the inner half for one

bowled between the legs, I think. Yeah he is. Premeditates a sweep and this is really full. If he stretches forward a little, he can even take it on the full, but he has committed to the sweep. The ball squeezes between his legs to knock the stumps over
flat, quick, straight, worked into the leg side for one
taps a full toss back to Shadab. Just over him. Shadab loses his balance. That means he can't jump high enough
quicker, outside off, runs it to short third for one
wrong'un, goes back to work it past cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Zeeshan Ali, no run
commentary: full, just outside off, pushed to cover
legbreak, opens the face, gets it past point for one

they are not reading Shadab. Haroon looks to go down for a sweep, sees the length is not quite there, then tries to just guide it behind square on the leg side, and gets too far inside the line. The wrong'un does the rest

this is a procession. At least he is not out middle stump to a goggly. Steps out of the crease looking to hit a six, but is not quite to the pitch of it, and the turn away means he doesn't get enough into the shot. Caught at long-on
wide down the leg side as he tries to stay tight on the line
inside edge onto the pad and the ball lobs towards where silly point would have been
into the pads, a catch for leg slip, but this has gone off the pad
oh it could be pad first and pretty straight if it is. No review, though. He has pushed this to cover, but there might have been some pad before he hit it
pushed into the covers with an open face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to Ehsan Khan, no run
commentary: big back lift, doesn't get the length, so decide4s to defend it

gone, bowled him! Another clueless slog from a Hong Kong batter, and Shadab is on a hat-trick. This was tossed up, and was a wrong 'un. It spent a good few second wobbling in, and pitched full outside off, before turning in to strike off stump as Shukla missed his slog

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Mohammad Ghazanfar, no run
commentary: full and tossed up outside off. Defended down

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Mohammad Ghazanfar, no run
commentary: and the googly play its trick again. Full and loopy outside off, and he misses slog sweep

confident appeal for leg before, and given! But Ghazanfar reviews. Looked like there was bat first on real time, but we'll see. Nope, it is certainly pad first, as it flips the flap of the back pad off a good length on off, with the ball skidding on off the surface. There wasn't much of a turn there, as he got his front leg out of the way to try and tried to poke at it but missed. Replays show there is umpire's call on impact, and also umpire's call on clipping the off stump. Hong Kong cleaned up for 38, which is 31 fewer than their previous lowest score in T20Is

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rizwan, no run
commentary: no bounce. Short of a length, doesn't even get waist high, defended with an open face

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rizwan, no run
commentary: tries to drive this on the up but the low bounce and pace defeats his shot, taking an inside edge

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Rizwan, no run
commentary: straighter this time, punched down the ground, but straight to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: again the slow and low pitch in play. Babar looks to punch this through the covers, but ends up playing this back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: low bounce again, but this time Babar gets a single off the bottom edge towards cover
off-driven on the up. Again not timed well. Gets a single straight of mid-off
another inside edge. This time Shukla bowls the full outswinger, Rizwan looks to drive down the ground but gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
short of a length, angling in, punched to deep midwicket for one
finally a shot is timed well, but it is driven straight to extra cover. Not a half-volley but Rizwan gets it out of the screws
slower off the pitch, Rizwan runs this down to deep third for one
on a length, straight, turned to the right of midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: driven down to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: flat, into the pads, punched to short straight midwicket
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for another single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Babar Azam, FOUR runs
commentary: Babar picks his spot. Nicely done. stays back for a flat delivery, arches back, plays it late, and uses his wrists to guide it between square leg and short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Babar Azam, OUT
commentary: caught and bowled. Slower in the air, Babar goes down the ground, but fails to keep it down. A bit of an unforced error, but possibly it has dipped on him. Offers a return catch while looking for a single down the ground. Ehsan takes a good low catch to his right even as the ball swerves away
full, into the pads, worked to leg for a single to get off the mark

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Zaman, no run
commentary: full, outside off, driven hard with an open face but can't beat the man at cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Zaman, FOUR runs
commentary: slower ball, well outside off, by no means a half-volley, but Fakhar still reaches it and manages to place it between mid-off and extra cover
he is looking to keep it away from Fakhar and ends up conceding a wide outside off
another wide outside off as he tries to stay out of Fakhar's reach. Oh oh. It's a no-ball too

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Zaman, no run
commentary: slower offcutter, into the pitch, Fakhar beaten on the pull. Done in for the lack of pace

Fakhar is gone if he hits. Rizwan caught ball-watching. Fakhar drives straight to extra cover and sets off for a single. Rizwan is looking elsewhere, which is why Fakhar has to pause. Rizwan then goes. So Fakhar keeps going too. He is lucky the throw is off the mark
straight length ball, worked to leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haroon Arshad to Zaman, FOUR runs
commentary: short ball, but on pace, and Zaman pulls this to the right of short fine leg for four
Rizwan shuffles across to try to pull the ball square and this stays low to beat the pull
full, outside off, he shuffles across and ends up draggin to deep square for one
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to deep third for one
gets the width. Finally gets some placement. This is a hit-me ball. Cut away in front of point for four
short of a length, wide, Rizwan beaten on the attempt to run it down behind square
repeats the shot and manages to connect here. Opens the face on it, using the pace, and places it fine of deep third, who is square. The dive in the end is not enough to keep it in

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Zaman, no run
commentary: on a length, straight, no room, defended back to him
down the track, Ehsan goes wide, Fakhar pushes it between point and cover for two
arm ball, outside off, opens the face, gets a single to short third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: quick outside off, Rizwan opens the face and is beaten again
full, nearly a yorker, driven to deep midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Zaman, no run
commentary: tight line. No room. No pacer to work it to leg. Fakhar can only push it back to Ehsan
on a length, on off, no pace to work with, worked into the leg side for one
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single
wide length ball, driven on the up, but they have s weeper. This is bowled at 125ks
slower ball, into the pitch, Fakhar early into the pull, but sneaks in a leg-bye
on a length, just outside off, again no pace to work with, so he uses soft hands to place it into the leg side for a couple
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rizwan, no run
commentary: slow, wicket to wicket, played back to him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: Rizwan sees a spinner give it air for the first time and he goes down on a knee ton sweep it behind long leg for four
slow again, just outside off, Rizwan pushes it into the covers for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Zaman, no run
commentary: really slow, some turn, cramps him up, played back to him
lovely bowling. Fakhar is giving him the charge, but the ball dips on him, beating him in the air. Fakhar aborts the aggressive shot, and takes a single into the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rizwan, no run
commentary: dropped?. Or has he? they are going upstairs to see if he has taken it cleanly. This is again tesingly slow, Rizwan defends, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and the ball reaches McKechnie on the half-volley

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Zaman, no run
commentary: on a length, around off, no turn, defended with an open face
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
down on a knee, Ghazanfar bowls wide outside off, Rizwan opens the face to guide it fine of short third for two

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Rizwan, no run
commentary: on a length, on off, pushed to cover
down the wicket, gets a touch too close to the pitch of the ball and ends up drilling it straight to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Zaman, no run
commentary: given out lbw, and Fakhar reviews. I don't see turn back in so it is likely to have pitched outside leg. Yeah that is the case. Just waiting for the pitch mat to confirm it. Fakhar is beaten on the sweep and is hit in front of leg. Now when the ball is not turning it is very rare for the ball to pitch within the stumps and hit you in front. Finally confirmed it is pitched outside leg. Fakhar bats on
he is a lovely bowler. Bowl slow and gets dip. Rizwan tries to sweep but the ball is not where he expects it to be. Toe-ends it for one
down the wicket and beaten in the air again. Lovely dip on it. Fakhar pushes it to leg for one
swept to deep midwicket for one
slightly flatter, goes back to get a single to short third
another sweep from outside off, but just the single
goes back to work this length ball into the leg side for one
skips down first ball after drinks, and drills this full and flat ball on middle and to long-on
tossed up, and full outside off. Opens the bat face to slice to long-off
again gets down to swipe, and this time finds the gap between fine leg and deep square leg, as he sweeps this full and straight ball
down the pitch, and on the bounce to long-on, as he bowls fullish and around middle

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Rizwan, SIX runs
commentary: finally gets one away! Uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball, which is flighted and full on middle and off. He crashes that over the bowler's head
wanted two, but gets only a single, as he closes the bat face to turn this fullish ball on middle towards square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: good length ball, and around sixth stump. Rizwan tries to pull but misses, as the ball keeps low. There is an appeal for stumping, as it goes up to the third umpire. There is no bat involved as ball passes it. His back foot did move for a second, but eventually seems stable on the crease as the bails are whipped off. So not out
slower ball, and fuller and just outside off. Flicked to deep square leg
makes room, and takes a step down before nudging this good length ball on off to point for a hurried single
wide down the leg side. A fullish delivery angling into and ending outside leg, as Rizwan flicks but misses. He almost his balance for once, before they pinched an extra run
a hard pull to this short delivery at just 126kph, which was pretty wide of off to facilitate that shot. Single to deep square leg
another of those good length deliveries at minimal pace, and just outside off. Clipped to deep square leg
much fuller on off, and he drags that to long-on after getting his front leg out of the way
charges down, and swings this fullish ball on middle and off to deep midwicket. He wanted a second, but was sent back
takes a step down, as he gets a pretty full ball on middle and leg. Pushed to long-off
this is slower, and on a good length on middle. Turned late towards short fine leg
gets a bottom edge as the ball runs away behind the wicket. Went reaching out to this good length ball wide of off, and ended up mistiming it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: the googly, but Rizwan slaps that for four! Short outside off, and turning in to end close to off. Rizwan gets deep in the crease, before sending that crashing to deep point's left
fuller and slower on middle, and flicked towards deep midwicket. A bit of yes-no between the batters - like we have seen already today - before they settle for one
very slow, tossed up and on a shortish length outside off. Turns away, as he waits before cutting to deep point. And that is another fifty for Rizwan
slog sweeps in the gap between fine leg and deep midwicket, as this ball is fuller and slow again, while turning into him. Still no pace on the ball for them to hit
again makes room, before pushing this short ball turning into him to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: swept to deep midwicket! Went down on his back knee, and let that flighted and full ball outside off to come before slogging away for four more
good running. Tucks this fullish ball on middle towards deep midwicket, and they use the longer boundary to their advantage to pinch two
takes his bottom hand off, as he sweeps to fine leg off this full ball which is wide-ish of off. Almost had to reach out for it
short ball on middle, going on straight. Clipped to deep midwicket, and they run a hurried two again
pretty full on leg, and clipped to deep midwicket
again comes down the pitch, but doesn't get what he wanted. Full ball on off, and he can only drill that to long-on
good length ball a bit wide of off, and slashed to deep point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Ghazanfar to Zaman, SIX runs
commentary: ah, he gets one off the middle of the bat after hours of trying! Sweeps this across the line over deep midwicket, as this ball is full and quicker outside off. Went down on his knee, and sent that flying
this again holds up in the pitch. On a shortish length on middle and off, as he sees Fakhar making room and skipping down. Nudged to long-on in the end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Zaman, FOUR runs
commentary: slapped wide of long-off! Yet again makes room, and slams this short ball outside off through extra cover. That was hit forcefully
very slow here at 74kph. Tossed up on a good length on middle and leg, as he turned it around towards square leg after backing away
loopy and full on off. Swept to fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Zaman, SIX runs
commentary: this lands outside the stadium! Fakhar reaches fifty with a grand six. The left-arm spinner's slower ones and his angle helped there. Slow, fullish and wide of off, as he backed away and skipped down, before heaving it over deep midwicket miles away

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Yasim Murtaza to Zaman, no run
commentary: this is shorter and flatter on off. Slapped back to the bowler, who gets a hand to stop a single
gets a bottom edge to short fine leg, as he tries swinging across the line to this fullish ball coming into him

taken at backward point! Slices this to the man placed at the edge of the circle. The ball was a lowish full toss which was angling into him from the angle from around the wicket, as it was also tossed up. Fakhar made room early, and also skipped down. Ended up finding the fielder since he had to play at it once he was down the pitch. Just when he was looking dangerous, Hong Kong have got Fakhar

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Khushdil, no run
commentary: a yorker length ball on off, and jammed back
a low full toss on off, and pushed to long-on without any foot movement

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ehsan Khan to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: lapped just over short fine leg! Goes low to this full and quick ball outside off, and just uses the pace of the ball to lap that for four
expertly dabbed for a few more. Very full outside off, and he waited before jamming that with a flat bat towards deep third. It was pulled back last moment to prevent four
this is again pretty full and fast on middle and off. Flicked towards midwicket
starts with a wide. Slower ball on a good length, and angling down leg. Khushdil wanted to flick, but missed
and again. This is on a shortish length, but again darting down leg. He pulled but missed
launched over long-off! This one was full and in the slot outside off, as Khushdil hung deep in the crease and spotted mid-off inside the circle. Eight runs off one ball this over
good stop by the keeper tumbling to his right. Another slower ball, as he went back to the good length deliveries angling in. Khushdil tried to pull, but the ball took his pad
another wide. This isn't really working for Shukla, as he goes shorter with change of pace, with the ball bouncing high and ending outside leg
Shukla finally gets it near to what he wanted. Short and angling into leg, and pulled to fine leg off the higher side of the bat
a yorker length ball tailing in to end on middle and leg. A gentle nudge towards long-on, and while the bowler gave the chase, Rizwan called for two and got it after a bit of confusion
short of a length outside off, and pulled tp deep midwicket
wide number four, and this time the keeper lets it through. Slower ball on a good length, and angling into leg yet again. Five wides to continue to procession this over
this is much better. Yorker length ball darting in to end outside leg, as it takes his pad to dribble back while he misses his flick. Pakistan get 18 off the over still
low full toss on of, and he closes the bat face to flick to deep midwicket
very well stopped by long-on running and tumbling to his right. Full and in the slot on middle and off, and that was hoicked hard
charges down, but this ball is on a shortish length on middle and off. Clipped aerially to deep midwicket
slow, and a near yorker on middle. Jammed to long-off after making room
again takes a step down, but this ball is flat and full on middle. A rapid two pinched again
and again, but this is placed in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. Full ball on middle, and flicked forcefully

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, no run
commentary: swing and a miss! Slower ball on a fullish length, and ending on fifth stump. He went across the line, but missed
