bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, no run
commentary: woah, that is a clever change of length. Bangs it in short on middle and off, as Khushdil tried to swat but missed again, with the pace of the ball getting to him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, SIX runs
commentary: this is flung over long-on! Another cutter came bang on to the pitch, but this time he seemed ready. Made room, and swiped that across the line with a flat bat
five wides again, and Hong Kong are making it very easy for Pakistan. A cutter pitching on tenth stump outside leg, and far beyond the diving keeper to his right

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, SIX runs
commentary: fired over deep midwicket! Khushdil's third six. Gets a shortish ball just outside off, and hammers that pull far and wide to keep the momentum going

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, SIX runs
commentary: another six! Pakistan on their way to 190-plus now. This was full - and not far from the slot - on middle and off, as he hung deep in the crease and got his front leg out of the way before pumping it down the ground

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Aizaz Khan to Khushdil, SIX runs
commentary: but it doesn't make a difference! That is 29 off the final over. This was a high full toss on leg, as he swivelled to swing that through the line and over fine leg. Looked like it could be an above-waist full toss, but no. Hong Kong will be heaving a sigh of relief that it wasn't

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: so close to the stumps! Full ball outside off. Tries to drive away from his body, and takes an inside edge. Races away to fine-leg for four
full on off. Presses forward to fend. Takes the outside edge and rolls along the carpet to deep third
good length, just outside leg. Clipped off his hips to deep backward square leg
good length, quite wide outside leg. Top work from Gurbaz to dive to his left with the glove and avoid any further extra runs
good length ball angling across. Sticks the bat out to poke. Thick outside edge past the first-slip fielder to deep third
fullish on middle and off. Nurdled off his pads to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, no run
commentary: slower ball, full on middle. Bit of swing into him. Nissanka picks the pace early, and drives well, but only to mid on
full just outside off. Drifting into him. Driven uppishly over the non-striker but falls a few feet short of long on
good length ball on middle. Flicked off the back foot to deep square leg
fullish, outside off stump. Slices a driving shot to cover point

fullish outside off and turning in. Mendis plays a late cut to short third and takes off for one. Is Nissanka in trouble? Throw is flat and on top of the stumps, but the side-on umpire is confident that the batter was in.
good length just outside off. Backs away and tries to cut this googly, but misses. Nice bounce to Gurbaz
full ball drifting into middle and leg. Worked off his toes past short fine leg, and the fielder gives it a mighty chase
back of a length on middle, and pulled to deep square leg. Mistimed shot, in all honesty

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, no run
commentary: full and wide outside off. Creams a drive away from his body, but can't beat the infield

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, no run
commentary: full on off stump. Pace off. Nissanka taps it back towards Mendis, and the bowler tracks to his left to intercept

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, no run
commentary: yorker length, almost perfect. Lands just outside off, and dug back to Farooqi

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: back of a length on middle. Nissanka not in control while trying to pull. Top edge over the keeper and that that has four written all over it once it landed beyond Gurbaz

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: much better from Pathum! Absolutely mows this full ball outside off by swinging across the line and smacking it to the cow corner fence
fullish outside off. Bit of turn into Mendis. Slaps a cut to point, but no single on offer
Sri Lanka getting a move on! And this time it is Mendis joining the party. A touch short from Mujeeb, and Mendis gets down on one knee before slog sweeping over deep square leg!
fullish just outside off. Pushed with the turn to cover
ball stays low as he tries the cut from quite close to his body. Backward point runs in to keep it down to one
fullish ball just outside off. Turning into Pathum. Wants to cut, but ends up uncomfortably working it to the leg side
good length ball on middle. Nissanka backs away and nurdles a clip off his pads to deep square leg

back of a length ball originating outside off but angling into leg stump. Nissanka raises his front leg and tries to play a hook of sorts behind square. Comes off his body and rolls away to the leg side

length ball outside off. Guides the cut beautifully, piercing the small gap between point and short third. But top commitment from the fielder who cranks up his speed while chasing the ball and manages to pull it back. Fazalhaq the man
good length just outside off. Mendis looks to slog across the line with that incoming angle. But mistimed to midwicket

is he the bowler SL will try to take on? Surely looks like the way the strokes are being offered. Full on middle, and he flicks off his toes with the bat's closed face, and uses the angle successfully to get the shot past short fine leg!
good length ball just outside off. Opens the bat's face and plays a punch off the back foot. Shinwari gets a hand to it at point, and Mujeeb covers him up by cleaning the effort up.
fullish just outside off stump. Worked off his pads to deep square leg for a single
full on middle. Flicked to deep midwicket with soft hands, allowing them a comfortable two runs
full ball on off. Turning into middle and leg. Worked off the back foot to midwicket
fullish on leg stump. The googly is worked off his pads off the back foot to square leg. Early call for one
flatter, releasing this googly more from over his head this time. Lands full on off and turning in. Worked to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mendis, SIX runs
commentary: no you didn't, Mendis! Taking on the opponent's best bowler early. What a way to get to fifty. He has seen enough. Gets low early, centre of gravity quite low thus, and thereafter plays a slog sweep uppishly on purpose. Beyond deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Mendis, SIX runs
commentary: even better from BKG! Fullish on middle, and Mendis uses the googly to his advantage by clearing the front leg, swiveling slightly while getting down on one knee, and finishing it off by hammering a slog sweep over deep square leg.
full on off. Walks into a gentle push to wide long on, and they are off for one

he is flying! Carrying on from that Bangladesh game. Full and slightly wide outside off. A bit slow too. Mendis gets low and plays the drive over the infield, on purpose, and Afghanistan are lucky that did not go for six!

Massive wicket! Momentum broken. Mendis wants to continue hitting but Naveen has cramped him with a short ball angling into his chest. Attempts the pull but doesn't really have the opportunity to have a full followthrough of the shot. Down deep midwicket's throat.
full ball outside off. Stays a tad low while angling across. Poked to the off side
full and wide outside off. Too wide, according to the umpire. Through to Gurbaz
full outside off stump. Pushed along the carpet to deep extra cover
fullish ball skidding into his pads from outside off. But Nissanka brings the bat down, and the ball gets an inside edge onto his pads. Ball rolls away to short third
around the stumps. Full on off stump. Worked to deep square leg off the front foot
over the stumps. Good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Cut to deep backward point, and Mujeeb is a tad slow to get to the ball. Keeper sounds frustrated at the effort.
good length on middle and leg. Offbreak worked to deep backward square leg
around the stumps again. Good length outside off. Sharp turn away. Cut in front of square to the sweeper fielder in the deep
over the stumps. Good length just outside off. Slaps it to deep point, where Mujeeb is there.
around the stumps. Good length ball angling into his pads. Smothered off his pads to deep midwicket
length ball angling into him from around the stumps. Clipped to deep midwicket
that may have gone onto the road! Full ball, a bit flatter, just outside off. Nissanka gets low and creams a slog sweep in front of square. Flies across the night sky.
full outside off. Driven along the ground to wide long off for a single
good length, on off. Worked behind square off the back foot for a single
fullish outside off. Bit of turn into him. Cut off the back foot to backward point

wicket off the wide ball! Nissanka gets back to cut off this wide ball outside off, but perhaps the extra bounce does the trick. Big edge, but swiftly into Gurbaz's gloves, so credit to him for grabbing onto it. No turn this time, looks like the carrom ball.
around the stumps. Full on middle, and pushed to towards midwicket. Nabi gives the ball a chase

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: fullish ball on off and skidding into middle and leg. Fended off the back foot to the bowler
flatter delivery. Full on middle, and angling into leg. Clipped towards square leg for a comfortable single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Asalanka, no run
commentary: bit of extra bounce off this length ball outside off. Tapped back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Asalanka, no run
commentary: Full on middle stump. Worked off his pads to midwicket. Fielder charges in to ensure they don't consider the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Asalanka, no run
commentary: fullish outside off stump. Punched off the back foot to cover
length on off, back foot punch through the cover for a couple
pushed through on the pads, stays back and worked towards midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Asalanka, no run
commentary: good length, flat through the air. Nudged back to Rashid.
length ball, skids through and Asalanka just about gets bat to this as he looks to cut this in front of the stumps. Dicey cricket!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: Goes for the slog sweep, but this keeps low and goes under the bat through to the keeper.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Gunathilaka, 1 leg bye
commentary: Huuuge appeal for lbw! But the umpire is having none of it. This was another attempted slog sweep, and Gunathilaka misses again, struck flush on the back pad. It's pitching outside leg though.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Gunathilaka, SIX runs
commentary: Inside out cover drive all the way! What a shot by Gunathilaka.
Nabi responds with flatter ball, that's clipped in front of square for one.
Inside edge on to the stumps! Goes for the big slog sweep, but only manages to deflect it onto the stumps.
Forward defence square on the offside and they scamper an almost suicidal single, as Gurbaz picks it up and shies at the stumps. If he hit, that would have been gone.
length outside off, slashed hard into the covers. Sweeper is in place.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs
commentary: Dropped!! What a let off for Sri Lanka and Gunathilaka! Is he having a case of the Mendis's today? This was a top edge on another sweep, and it goes over the keeper's head but straight to fine leg coming in. But he gets nowhere near it, as the ball goes straight through his hands on to his chest, and then deflects to the ropes to add salt in the wounds.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Shanaka, no run
commentary: Rashid traps Shanaka in front! But the Sri Lankan skipper has reviewed. His only hope is that this is hitting outside the line. And it indeed is hitting outside, quality review. This was the googly, pitching outside off and striking the batter on the front pad as he looks to flick it.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Shanaka, FOUR runs
commentary: Swept to deep backward square leg for four! Great shot taking this from outside off.
length on the stumps, nudged in front of square on the onside
length ball, looks to drive this but gets an inside edge to short fine leg for one
length on the stumps, worked to long on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: length on the stumps, looks to stay back and dab this square on the offside, but can't beat the infield
length on the stumps, worked towards square leg off the back foot
Makes room early, as the bowler looks to follow him. Still manages to smack this off the back foot towards long off, who makes ground to his right to collect
length ball on the stumps, clipped towards square leg. They think about two but decide against.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Gunathilaka, SIX runs
commentary: Short boundaries! This was pitched shorter and quicker, and Gunathilaka is able to get under it with his pull and safely clear the square leg boundary.
fuller on off, driven down to long off
attempted yorker, taken on the full and driven to long off

Brilliance on the boundary from Najeeb! This is a full toss that's absolutely creamed down the ground by Shanaka. It's hit flat and hard, but Najeeb balances himself on the line and takes it, with his back foot agonisingly close to the ropes. He's then about to go over so he pops it up, and takes it once coming back inside. And yes, the third umpire has given the all clear!
comes down the track and flicks this in the air towards deep midwicket. On the bounce to the man.
fired down leg, clear wide.
full toss driven down to long on
full on off, driven into the covers but the man is in place to stop the single
down the track and finds the gap with this cover drive! Great batting.
drifts on to the pads, clipped to deep backward square for one
full angling away, and this is beautifully placed past point
full outside off stump and absolutely muscled over deep extra cover! How about that!

uppppp and overrrr! Fullish ball just outside off. He nonchalantly skips down the ground and absolutely muscles a six over Naveen's head. The around-the-wicket angle works for Rajapaksa, hitting it through the line.
full and wide outside off. Square drive races away to deep extra cover
good length, on middle and leg. Slower one, and worked to deep square leg

caught! dropped! caught again! DROPPED! Is that the match? Full ball wide outside off, and he hammers this away from his body. In the air, deep cover is there for the catch, but the ball pops in and out!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs
commentary: Reverse sweep for four more! Short third and backward point were in the ring and he pierces them both!
Length ball, pushed through flat. Looks to cut but gets an outside edge towards short third for one.
Short ball on the pads, but he can't get the pull away. Only manages to get it as far as short fine leg.

Gunathilaka goes for one sweep too many, and he's castled! Rashid gets his man in the end, as Gunathilaka goes across the line and misses completely. The off peg is disturbed. Is this yet another twist in this game?

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: Deftly played! Extra bounce on this googly, but Hasaranga goes back and waits for it before guiding it past short third man.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: length on the stumps, nudged to deep midwicket for one. And that's the end of Rashid's spell.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: slower ball on a length, keeps low. Nudged towards cover for a quick single.
slower short ball, dabbed down to short third man for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: Opens the face, finds the gap! This was over pitched outside, and Hasaranga gets low and drives this square to beat the man at sweeper cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: Slower short ball, and Hasaranga is early on the stroke. Unable to get the uppercut away.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: Top edge for four! It's all going Sri Lanka's way! This was another short slow bouncer, and Hasaranga looks to flat bat this down the ground but gets a top edge high past the keeper and short third.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hasaranga de Silva, 2 runs
commentary: Full outside off, and it's two more. Driven nicely between deep extra cover and deep cover point.
Smashed past deep cover! Geez that was timed sweetly! This was full outside off, and Bhanuka just spanks this drive. The fielder only has to move a few yards to his right but he has no chance.
full again, worked towards deep midwicket for another couple

Slower ball cleans him up! And Rajapaksa can't see it through. Goes across the line, looking to win this in style, but he's way early on the stroke, as his off stump is rattled. But what a cameo this has been!
Misfield for one. And the scores are level! This was driven straight to short extra cover, who can't hold on. The throw might have been close at the non-striker's end had it hit.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: short and wide, but cut straight to point. No run!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naveen-ul-Haq to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: Another run out chance! Direct hit and he would have been miles gone. Hasaranga digs out this attempted yorker to extra cover and wants to steal the single. Chamika sends him back, and the throw is at the striker's end. Hit and he was gone!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to C Karunaratne, FOUR runs
commentary: Wide full toss, driven high over mid-off! And Sri Lanka complete an impressive chase!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: mystery spinner coming around the stumps, with one slip. Half-tracker on off and skidding into middle. Clipped a bit uncomfortably to the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: here we go! Width offered, a bit full outside off. Turning away and Zazai leans forward and creams a drive over mid off's right! Not much footwork, but when you time it like that, you don't need to do much.
length ball, just outside off. Zazai again offers minimal footwork in his cut, and gets it to the left of point. Dive ensures it is just one. Nissanka the fielder
off the mark. Over the stumps outside off and caressed to cover for a quick single. Direct hit could've been trouble though!
fullish ball on off stump. Tapped to long on for a jogging single off the back foot. This one skid into his pads
even stevens after the first over. Neither side would be too disappointed. A fullish ball just outside off and turning into off. Punched back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs
commentary: outside edge! Keeper dives! But just past him! Short of length on middle, and angling slightly across Zazai. He looks to poke at it, and that would've been gobbled up by first slip, had one been there.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: full on off stump. Brings the bat down to fend a shot to the off side off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: good length ball originating around leg stump but angling across to off. Pushed square to point off the back foot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: it has been a tidy over so far. Good length on leg and middle, and Zazai is losing his patience. Tries to swipe it across the line but the delivery goes under his bat and flies just past off stump

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: fullish on off, and stays low while angling away. Zazai looks to cut, but he plays it with the expectation that it would bounce more. Through to the keeper on the half volley

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: now that's a solid over from Fernando. Five dots after a four that on another day could've been a wicket. Length ball on off, and cut to point. No chance of a run.
one slip. Full outside leg with Gurbaz backing away to make some room. Bowler follows him, and therefore he taps it down to mid on
around the stumps. Good length ball on off and coming into him. Worked off his waist to square leg for a single
makes room before the ball is delivered. Theekshana ends up delivering a length ball on leg and angling into the batter. Punched back
the crowd's on its feet! And what a shot to get the Afghan fans roaring. Full just outside off. Gurbaz gets low, down on one knee, and plays the slog sweep over the cow-corner region!

Theekshana has the last laugh! Or does he? Gurbaz tries to repeat it, but he can only get the height. Theekshana bowls a carrom ball just outside off, and Gurbaz tries to loft him over his head. But he's through the shot too early, it has come off the toe-end too, and Gunathilaka runs to his left from long off to take a reverse-cup catch. But wait, drama time! Gurbaz is waiting near the boundary line because it appears like the fielder's foot may be touching the boundary skirting here. Suspense.... And oooooo, Gurbaz gets a massive reprieve! Gunathilaka stepped on the skirting while trying to settle for the catch, and the umpire says that's half a dozen more!
full on off. Presses forward, pushes to cover's left and takes off for a single.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rahmanullah, SIX runs
commentary: Gurbaz-ball! Asitha bowls short around off. Gurbaz swivels and deposits a pull over deep square leg! Got inside the line with a swift shuffle that took him across the stumps.
full on middle, and clipped smartly off his toes to deep midwicket. Long on has to run to his right and cut it off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rahmanullah, FOUR runs
commentary: takes pace off, but ends up bowling it quite wide. Gurbaz is seeing these balls like watermelons and ends up scything a cut through cover point after moving towards the ball.
Fullish just outside off. Forward defense to cover for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: fullish on off stump. Punchy shot to cover's right for a single. Diving effort ensures the ball doesn't clear the infield

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 run
commentary: drops just short of the keeper! Length ball on a fourth-stump line and too close to Zazai for the cut. But he attempts it anyway and it takes an inside edge but falls in front of the keeper diving to his right. Hits the glove and rolls away to short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: another edge - off the bat's bottom and falls just short of the keeper again! Looks to clip this length ball angling in, but the ball stays a bit low, takes the edge, and the keeper dives to his right to ensure he can stop it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 leg bye
commentary: Zazai quite scratchy. Another length ball on off and Zazai looks to clip it leg-side. Off the bat's face, goes over leg stump, and towards short fine

pierced! Good length ball on off. Bit of angle across the right-hand batter. Gurbaz stays on the back foot, pokes at it with the bat's open face, and sends it through the gap between short third and the diving backward point fielder
full ball just outside off. Mows a mistimed shot to mid-on, and they scurry across for one

off stump pegged back! You felt like something was gonna give - either a boundary or a wicket, and it is the latter. Back of a length outside off and angling into off stump. Ball stays a shade low with Zazai trying to slog across the line. He misses, Madushanka hits.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: one slip for the new man. Full outside off, plays the square drive, and wants the single. Hasaranga at cover point collects, has a shy at the batter's end after Zadran is turned down by Gurbaz, and he was gone had it been a direct-hit.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: googly to start off. Half-tracker outside off but sharp turn into middle stump. Gurbaz makes room and swipes it to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 2 runs
commentary: good length on off, and the googly is punched off the back foot to deep cover for a couple. Goes deep in his crease before playing the shot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full on off stump. Pushed to the bowler's left, and he scurries across the side pitches to slide and stop the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: another googly. Length ball, just outside off and turning in. Punched to cover, where another tidy fielding effort stops the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: fullish outside off. Skidding through. Punched to cover, the fielder throws it back to the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: stays low Length ball just outside off. Zadran makes room to cut, but it goes under the blade, and the keeper fluffs it too. Collective groan from Hasaranga and the other infielders.

Team fifty in style! Off just 6.1 overs. Full ball on off. Gurbaz offers a compact defensive shot but ensured the bat's face is open. That allows him to make use of the left-hander's angle going across him, and that's too good for even short third to intercept!
fullish on off. Guided to deep third for another single by keeping the bat's face open
full outside off. Driven uppishly, not in control, but over the infield. Protection in the deep.
good length ball on off stump. Tap-and-run after sending the ball to point. Fielder runs in and tries an underhand throw to attempt a direct hit, but Zadran would've been safe.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: deft shot! Madushanka goes short, aimed at his body. Zadran sways away but brings the bat up, and plays a ramp over the keeper's head! Nabi clapping from the pavillion.
full on middle stump. Driven past the bowler to long on. Madushanka couldn't get low in time to stop it.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full ball just outside off. Googly stays low, and carefully punched off the back foot to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, no run
commentary: fullish, outside off. Turning away. Cut to cover, who moves to his right to stop the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, SIX runs
commentary: takes the trump card on! Fullish on off. Gurbaz stretches forward, puts his back knee on the ground, and then hammers a slog sweep over deep midwicket.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: fullish just outside off and sharp turn into middle stump. Flicked off the back foot to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tossed up, outside off. Caresses a drive to cover before the ball could turn

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: overpitched, wider outside off. Googly cut to point and Zadran is slow to get off the blocks. Fielder at point has an aim at the bowler's end, but again no direct hit

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: length ball just outside off and angling into off stump. Punched to deep midwicket, and Gurbaz wants two, but Zadran raises his hand to say 'no'
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Tries to pull, mistimed in front of square, but the lack of pace off the bat actually helps Gurbaz. Scurries back for the second
full on middle and leg. Clipped to deep square let and just like that.... he's got to fifty! Gets there in 22 balls. Gunathilaka must be hurting with every run that Gurbaz scores.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: length ball just outside off. Pulled to deep square leg for a single
full ball, just outside leg stump. Gurbaz gets low to try and sweep behind square but misses. No problem, Afghanistan get an extra run and the extra ball anyway.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rahmanullah, no run
commentary: back of a length outside off. Ball jags in sharply with Gurbaz attempting the pull. Ball goes under the blade to the keeper. Karunaratne is thinking there may be an under-edge. Shanaka checks with someone, and they review for caught behind after the appeal was turned down. Is this a desperate review because of the batter in question? Or was there some sound? The bottom-edge of the bat is awfully close to the ball, but UltraEdge shows a flat line. Review burned.
back of a length ball on middle and leg. Looks to pull behind square, hits his arm, and rolls past short fine leg. Fielder Bhanuka gives it a chase, and pulls it back.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: good length ball on off. Googly is punched rather uppishly to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: tossed up, a bit wide outside off. The googly is slogged to deep square leg. But Gurbaz wasn't in control.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full just outside off. Full face of the bat in his drive to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: full on off and the googly is driven to wide long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full on off. Legbreak turns slightly across. Mistimed punch back to Hasaranga

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: flatter ball, full on off. Punchy shot to wide long off. Hasaranga completes his third over and the umpires call for drinks
length on off, dabbed down to third man off the back foot for one
fuller and quite wide of off, square drive into the covers
full length on the pads, worked towards deep midwicket for another easy single
full outside off, and he shuffles across and goes for an audacious premeditated sweep. Doesn't connect how he would like though as the ball ends up near mid-off
full again, this time driven more conventionally to mid-off for one
length on the stumps, nudged softly towards midwicket, but with the men in the deep right on the boundary line the batters are able to scamper two comfortably
back of a length on the pads, nudged in front of square on the onside for a couple
slower ball, but he can't control it. Slides down leg.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: beaten on the outside edge! First false shot in a while. This is back of a length, angling away outside off, and he looks to punch this through the covers but is beaten by some subtle movement
gets the back foot punch away this time in front of square on the offside
slower ball attempted, full outside leg. Dribbles away to the keeper
change of pace. Full outside off, stays low, Gurbaz tries to drag a slog across the line. On the bounce to the keeper
full ball outside off stump, and he plays the square drive to deep extra cover
full on his toes, and clipped to deep midwicket.
full ball on middle, and he works it off his pads to deep midwicket. Fielder charges in to ensure that the batters don't consider a second run
thick edge and teases short third before landing beyond him and running away for four. Full and wide this cutter, and Gurbaz loses his shape trying to loft it over the off side.
fullish, wider outside off and angling further away. No shot offered, wide run collected
full ball just outside off. Gurbaz gives Shanaka a charge and tries to hammer a shot over mid on. But toe-ended to the bowler's left
lands in no man's land as he swivels to slog this full ball over the square-leg umpire. Nobody at deep backward square, and the square-leg fielder runs near the boundary to pull the ball back
mistimed, but remember, Sharjah is tiny! Full ball, a bit wide outside off. Toe-ends the lofted drive, but he is arms are powerful enough to comfortably clear deep extra cover
short ball, outside off. Drags a pull to midwicket after the ball went high up into the night sky. But with the fielders on the boundary, he is very safe.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ibrahim Zadran, SIX runs
commentary: spanked down the ground! Zadran getting in on the act here, as he picks this up from a length and launches over a leaping long-on!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: slower ball back of length, nurdled towards midwicket for one
Another slower ball, wide outside off, back of a length, but it's pulled towards deep midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: takes the pace off once more, loopy on a length, driven hard towards cover, where Theekshana seems to have hurt himself fielding
Oh dear, attempted yorker gone all wrong. This is beyond the blue line down leg, keeper and batter have no chance as this runs down to fine leg for four.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rahmanullah, SIX runs
commentary: Disdainful! Gurbaz just walks down down the ground, stands tall and flat bats this straight down the ground for six!
slower ball on a length, dabbed towards deep midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: leg spinner, flat through the air on off. Back foot drive to long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: tossed up on a length, driven towards long-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, no run
commentary: goes for the sweep and misses. Appeal for lbw, but even though this strikes the back pad it's well outside off.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 1 run
commentary: back of a length googly outside off, back foot punch into the covers

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: slightly fuller, another googly. This keeps low but Zadran negotiates it well. Stays back and punches this through the covers.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rahmanullah, 2 runs
commentary: Great running! Pushed through flat on the stumps, this is worked to deep midwicket with soft hands and they steal two as the man in the deep is right on the ropes.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Shuffles around in the crease, as Zadran looks to premeditate the scoop. Asitha spots him and bowls this full outside off, and it ends up going through the batter's legs.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full outside off, gets low and drives this towards sweeper cover

And Gurbaz's fantastic innings comes to an end! This was full outside off, and Gurbaz looks to heave this across the line. Ends up getting a top edge that goes high towards Hasaranga at deep midwicket, who does well to keep his eyes on the ball and take a pressure-filled catch.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: Slower leg cutter outside off, driven hard into the covers but the sweeper is in place
full toss outside off, carved to point, who misfields and allows a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Inside edge down to fine leg! Fortune favouring Afghanistan, as this cover drive gets a thick inside edge, leaving Mendis behind the stumps with no chance.
Dragged short on the stumps, nudged towards square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Appeal for a stumping, as Ibrahim goes for a big heave-ho and only ends up getting an inside edge on to his pads, through to the keeper. Mendis picks up the ball and breaks the stumps. They're having a look to see if Ibrahim had his foot briefly in there air, but he's safe.
darted in towards the pads, dug out towards midwicket
pushed through flat from around the wicket, back of a length, worked in front of square on the onside
full on the stumps, makes room and carves this hard inside out straight to a wide mid-off. But a misfield allows for a single.
length on the stumps, nudged in front of square on the offside for one
Full shaping in a touch, driven hard down to long-on

Scooped but straight to short fine leg! This was premeditated as Ibrahim goes across the crease early. Madushanka spots the move and slows it right up. Ibrahim goes through with the stroke, but he only manages height without distance. Simple catch at fine leg.
Pulled for a maximum! Madushanka lost all control of this slower ball, and it ends up almost waist high. Walloped high over deep midwicket!
And now on the offside! This is another full toss on off, and he just opens the face and slices this down to third man for four more!
length on the stumps, attempted pull, but he doesn't connect. Dribbles to square leg.
Short slower ball, attempted pull, inside edge into the body. Oh! But it's a no ball! Free hit incoming...

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to M Nabi, no run
commentary: short and quick, top edges this high on the bat and it doesn't really go anywhere. Keeper picks it up to prevent the single.
Tossed up on off, tries to hit this hard towards extra cover, but gets the timing all wrong as it goes down to long on
full on the pads, swept hard but straight to deep backwards square leg
attempted sweep, strikes the front pad as the batter misses. Theekshana appeals, but it's going well down leg.

Takes a good return catch! Carrom ball outside off, and Nabi tries to flat bat this down the ground, it's straight back at Theekshana who uses every inch of his tall frame to leap over head and take the catch.

And is this another one!? Yes, yes it is! This is driven hard to mid-off and they look to steal a single. But the throw is a good one to the striker's end and Kusal picking up the ball in front of the stumps catches him short.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Karim Janat, no run
commentary: good length on off, cut into the offside but straight to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Short, well directed. Rashid takes his eye off the ball, and is struck on the body. Ball ricochets to Kusal behind the stumps who does well to stop the single.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Short ball, and it's a swing and a miss

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Another short one, another swing and a miss. This is great stuff from Asitha.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, 2 runs
commentary: Short again, and this time Rashid connects with the pull. No timing but he gets it towards midwicket and they scamper two.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
commentary: After four poor shots in a row, Rashid absolutely leathers this! Another short ball, and Rashid is waiting for this, as he pulls this high over deep midwicket!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rashid Khan, 1 run, OUT
commentary: Full, attempted yorker wide of off stump, it's dug out towards Nissanka sweeping in the deep. Who puts in an accurate throw that finds Rashid, who dropped his bat half way through the run, short of his crease as he attempts to complete a second run.
short and wide, and Rizwan slashes it past point for four. Poor delivery, and Rizwan gave it what it deserved
driven to mid-off, where Hardik is on his toes
a prod to Pandya again and this time Rizwan takes him on. Puts in a dive, as you'd imagine, and gets there in time. Actually, a direct hit would have seen him out

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: beautiful bowling. Seams away off a length leaving him beaten all ends up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, FOUR runs
commentary: going down leg stump, and Babar pounces on it, whipping it through midwicket for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: punched to mid-off off the back foot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: angling aay from off stump. Rizwan's drive finds the cover fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: driven back to the bowler
banged in short, which Rizwan steers to fine leg and the pair exchange ends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: half-volley, was there to be crunched but KL Rahul puts in a dive at mid-off and stops what would have been a boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: chipped to mid-off on the bounce. Seemed to stop in the pitch slightly

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, no run
commentary: tried to run it through backward point and short third, but finds the fielder. Just two off that over
length delivery, clipped through midwicket for a single
tried to slash through the offside and misses
angled to backward point, but no run. The pressure mounting on Pakistan already
prodded into the offside and the pair exchange ends
this one is a touch too straight, and it's squeezed past short fine leg for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Babar Azam, FOUR runs
commentary: short ball with little pace on it. Babar read that one early and crunched that in front of square for a boundary. First shot of real authority from the Pakistan skipper
worked into the onside for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Babar Azam, 2 runs
commentary: low full toss, he opens the face and steers past extra cover. Rahul has a long chase and he manages to cut it off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: defended to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Babar Azam, OUT
commentary: Bishnoi strikes to remove Babar in his first over! Tried to jab it thorugh midwicket, but ends up chipping it straight to the man! The crowd explodes. But - wait - the no-ball is being checked. Babar is told to wait. Think it's juuust about fine personally. It is! India have thier breakthrough

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Zaman, no run
commentary: defended into the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Zaman, no run
commentary: yorker length, Fakhar defends. Excellent over from Bishnoi
length ball on the body, which is an area Rizwan excels. Smacks it off the ribs to a vacant fine leg for four.
another swipe through the onside, but this one isn't timed all that well
tucks him up, giving him no room to free his arms. He defends
same length but this time Fakhar was anticipating it. Steps away and carves it through backward point. Did very well to create his own room and find that gap through the offside
slower ball, pushed out to mid-off for a quick single
wow, what a shot that was! Short ball, Rizwan gets down, bat over his head, and still manages to find the gap between backward point and short third! Phenomenally clever shot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zaman, no run
commentary: length ball, Fakhar defends
short ball, Fakhar swings his arms, has a good-old heave-ho and manages it to get it to square leg for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rizwan, SIX runs
commentary: that is a Rizwan special! Gets across and whips it over square leg for a huge six. That passliyon waali shot, as its known in Pakistan, is always such a sight to behold
eased through the onside for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zaman, no run
commentary: comes down the ground but ends up yorking himself. Perhaps a late adjustment from the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Zaman, no run
commentary: slower ball that deceived Fakhar completely. Went through his shot too early, got an outside edge but it drops short of the keeper.
eased down the ground for a single
defended into the onside
worked through the leg side for a single
good footwork to get to the pitch, before opening the face and carving it through wide mid-off. Kohli there should have cut it off but a misfield gets Pakistan four
nudged through the offside for one
another wrong'un, which Fakhar doesn't quite look comfortable against. He blocks it
eased down long-on for a single
little dab into the onside for a single
carved through the covers for another single. Quiet start to this over
caught that out of the middle as he swiped it to cow corner, but a fielder's stationed there to keep it to one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Rizwan, 1 leg bye
commentary: sliding down leg, and they set off for a risky single. Just about get away with it
sliced to long-off, and it's another remarkably useful over from Bishnoi
dances down the ground, doesn't get close to teh pitch and is fortunate to get an edge to the onside. Or he would have been stumped
smited though square leg, where the fielder collects on the bounce
opens up the offside by stepping away and carving over extra cover for four. Created his own room and length once more
tried to take him on down the ground, and holes out straight to long-on. Slowed the pace of the ball down, and Fakhar just couldn't get the power and elevation to beat Kohli's safe pair of hands
spinning back into his pads
opens the face and runs it past short third man to get himself a boundary
opens the face and gets a single through the offside
length ball that Nawaz crunches over long-off for a big six. He caught that clean out of the middle, and followed through the line nicely. Fairly clear what his role is here
Pandya responds with a bouncer and a glare
another short ball, one that Nawaz pulls away to midwicket for a single
goes for the bouncer again. Looked a touch high, but the umpires deem it not to be a wide
eased into the onside for a single to keep the strike. India in control at the halfway mark, and Hemant is raring to go.
starts the over with a juicy full toss around off. Rizwan moves across, bends his back leg and smashes it over deep midwicket
length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up hitting it towards point
length outside off, chopped towards covers for one
length ball on the stumps, spinning back a touch to cramp the batter. Backs away slightly and punches it behind point
full around off, moves across and flicks it towards deep midwicket. The call is for two and Nawaz sprints back to make it comfortably
length outside off, chopped towards point
length outside off, sliding away. Cuts it towards sweeper cover
dragged short, down the leg side but Rizwan misses out. Mistimes the pulls towards short fine leg. Only a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Nawaz, SIX runs
commentary: a length ball around off, was sliding away but Nawaz goes for the slog sweep and clears the deep midwicket fielder for a 76-metre six
length ball around off, steers it towards point and sets off. Rizwan puts in the dive at the keeper's end to beat the throw

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: a slider, hurries onto the batter. Rizwan was first looking to come forward and then decides to flick it but misses and gets hit on the pads. Was heading down
slightly fuller than good length. Drags the sweep towards deep square leg

goes for the yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps. Rizwan was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge to the right of Rohit at extra cover. Kohli from mid-off cuts it off but cannot stop the second run
fifty for Rizwan, 100 up for Pakistan. Full around off, hits it over extra cover for a couple
a full toss around off, Rizwan flicks it towards deep midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Nawaz, FOUR runs
commentary: Arshdeep once again misses his yorker. This time ends up landing it on the slot, around off. Nawaz smashes it between the non-striker and stumps for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Nawaz, 1 leg bye
commentary: finally nails the yorker. Was tailing in towards the leg stump. Nawaz looks to dig it out towards the leg side but misses and is hit on the back leg. An appeal for lbw but not given. The ball-tracking shows it was going down

another almost yorker. Rizwan digs it out towards short midwicket and sets off. Arshdeep fields the ball himself and nails the direct hit at the non-striker's end. Rizwan puts in the dive and is well in. Despite all the issue with his knee/leg, he was up in a jiffy and was looking for an overthrow. Not here though
121kph, a slower length ball following the batter who was moving towards the leg side. Rizwan places it towards midwicket and sprints back for the second
length ball on the stumps, backs away and pulls it towards deep square leg
full outside off and Nawaz is hurting India here. Smashes it over covers for four. Moves to 28 off just 12 balls
a slower length ball in the channel, Nawaz fails to spot it and ends up playing early. Was looking to smash it over extra cover but doesn't connect
Pandya goes for the yorker but it's all going Pakistan's way at the moment. Nawaz goes for the pull, is slightly late on it but the top edge sails over Pant for four more
a length ball around off, 129kph. Nawaz flat-bats it towards long-off where Hooda fumbles. It doesn't result in an extra run though
tosses it up on the stumps, Nawaz goes for the slog sweep and hits it to the right of the deep square leg fielder
another tossed up delivery but this is down the leg side. Nawaz sweeps it fine on this occasions, all along the ground to the fine leg boundary. This one was a googly
74kph. A length ball on the stumps. A reverse sweep in almost slow motion to pick up a single to short third
length outside off. Plenty of room. Rizwan rocks back and cuts it to the right of the backward point fielder, who can only watch it go to the boundary
length ball outside off, 75kph. Rizwan pulls it towards wide long-on and sprints back for the second
length outside off, Rizwan goes down on one knee and drags it towards deep midwicket
length, wide outside off. Cuts it towards sweeper cover
a slower ball banged into the wicket, and angling across. 121kph. Nawaz was early into the pull and misses
Bhuvi strikes. Short of length around off, rolled his fingers over it. Nawaz looks to go over long-off but it bounces a little extra and Hooda pouches it calmly at the boundary
length outside off, pushed towards point to get off the mark
length ball around off, was looking to work it towards leg side but ends up pushing it back towards the bowler
length outside off, a superb short arm jab towards deep midwicket. Hooda runs to his right from long-on, puts in the dive and flicks it back. Axar from deep midwicket tidies it up
length ball around off, a slower one. Steered towards cover
short of length outside off, moves across and smashes it in front of square leg for four
full outside off, moves across but mistimes it towards wide long-on, off the inner half. But that allows him to come back for the second
length ball Rizwan moves across early. Hardik bowls it wide outside off and Rizwan fails to connect the drag-pull
length and Hardik goes even wider this time but Rizwan didn't move across much on this occasion. Leaves it alone and picks up a wide
full, well outside off. Rizwan lofts it towards long-off but Hardik rolled his fingers over it, 129kph. That meant he didn't get the required distance on it despite middling it. Surya gobbles it up
length ball around off, pushes it to the right of short midwicket and sets off. Bishnoi charges in and underarms it towards the stumps. He misses; Khushdil was not even in the frame
dragged short and sliding wide outside off, goes for the cut but misses. It's a wide though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Khushdil, no run
commentary: length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
length outside off, steered to the right of backward point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Asif Ali, 1 wide
commentary: dragged short but down sliding down the leg side. Misses the pull but misses. It's been called a wide but India want to review this. There's a slight murmur as the ball passes the bat/glove but don't think it's enough to overturn the on-field decision. The third umpire is taking his time, looking at it from all angles. Split screen now. He is checking visuals as well as UltraEdge. And he asks the on-field umpire to stay with his not-out call

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Asif Ali, no run
commentary: dropped. Full outside off, Asif Ali goes for the slog sweep but ends up top-edging it towards short third. It's a dolly but think Arshdeep took a touch casually and grassed it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Asif Ali, 1 wide
commentary: slider, dragged down. Asif Ali misses the pull but it's another wide

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ravi Bishnoi to Asif Ali, 1 run
commentary: length ball around off, goes back and opens the face of the bat to steer it behind point
full around off, flicked towards midwicket and they come back for the second
full on the stumps, clears his front leg and hits it towards deep midwicket, along the ground. Hardik charges in and throws it to the keeper to restrict it to one
starts with a bouncer but it's way down the leg side. Khushdil was moving towards the off side and lets it go
full outside off, in the blockhole. Digs it out towards long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Asif Ali, SIX runs
commentary: Asif Ali! A length ball around off, was a legcutter. Asif Ali goes deep and towards the off side and smashes it 92 metres over long-on
another slower one. Asif Ali moves across again and looks to smash it through the off side. Misses but this has been called a wide. A touch harsh and Bhuvi isn't happy
another slower one. A legcutter. Length outside off, Asif Ali looks to hit it towards extra cover but toe-ends it towards short third. Chahal is very fine there and stops it
a bouncer and Khushdil goes for the pull. Gets a top edge and gets it to behind deep square square leg, just to the left of the fielder. One bounce and over the boundary line
a yorker outside off, digs it out towards long-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Asif Ali, FOUR runs
commentary: length outside off, Asif Ali goes over extra cover. And it just dribbles between Surya, the long-off, and Axar, the sweeper cover, for four
nails the yorker. Khushdil inside edges it onto his toes as he looks to dig it out. The ball rolls towards covers for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Asif Ali, FOUR runs
commentary: a yorker gone wrong. A low full toss around off, Asif had already moved towards the off side and hits it straight over the bowler's head, bisecting long-off and long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Asif Ali, no run
commentary: full around off, hits it towards extra cover. A dot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Asif Ali, OUT
commentary: given lbw, Pakistan surely have to review this. And they do. Was a yorker on the middle stump. Asif was moving across and looks to flick. Misses it and is hit on the front shoe. And he is so deep in his crease. No bat involved and the rest is just a formality. Was hitting middle and off

Iftikhar seals it for Pakistan. Arshdeep misses his yorker again and ends up bowling a full toss around off. Iftikhar hits it down the ground. Hooda cuts it off from long-on but slips as he is about to throw it. A weak throw means Khushdil makes it back comfortably

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rahul, no run
commentary: length ball just outside off, defended into the offside
short and wide, slashed away to third man. No sign of movement yet

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: well, there comes the movement. Landed outside off, comes back in. Smart leave from Rohit, though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: charges down the wicket like an aggravated rhino, and tonks that over cover for four! Didn't get all of it, mind you, but it was enough to clear the infield, and landed safely around a vacant deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: fuller, defended into the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: absolutely glorious shot. Sharma at his effortless best. Rocks back and gently lifts Naseem over midwicket, and the easy power his timing generates makes the ball fly into the stands. Rollicking first over for India
length ball at 145 kph, eased to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: extra pace and bounce - at 146kph. Reared up, and it barely beat the edge of Rohit's bat. Was a whisker away

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: that's lifted over mid-off elegantly. Not much wrong with the length but Rohit drives on the up, and times it perfectly once more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: targets the stumps this time, and it's nudged into the onside for a quick single
sliced over the covers. Not timed as well as Rohit but they come back for a couple
nudged to mid-on and it's another quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rahul, SIX runs
commentary: slower delivery, but KL Rahul sees it coming a mile away. Leans into a sensational off drive - no more than that, really - that sails over wide long-off. India have Pakistan's bowlers on the ropes here
nudged into the onside for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: Fuller length, driven to the midwicket fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: thick edge, possibly a genuine edge. But there was no slip there. Rauf cleans up at third man to keep it to one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rahul, no run
commentary: defended to the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rahul, SIX runs
commentary: whoa, that was almost a helicopter shot. Has he really played many shots like that? Absolutely absurd shot that sails over the straight boundary for six!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: a length ball outside off, Rohit lofts it over extra cover for a crunching four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: the carnage continues. Short ball, which Sharma picks up early, and dispatches over the cow corner boundary for a huge six! He's in absolute command right now

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: tickled into the onside for a single
sliced to third man for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full delivery, defended to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: slower delivery, tried to place it between the two fielders behind square on the offside
length ball from him, cut to point
slapped down the ground for four more. Charged down the track and whacked it back over the bowler's head
tried to make room, and Nawaz followed him. Forced to defend
nurdled past mid-on for a single
angling into the stumps, nudged into the onside for a single
charges down the ground again. Doesn't get to the pitch but has what it takes to clear mid-on and pick up a couple more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rohit Sharma, OUT
commentary: Rohit finally top edges one and holes out. It was up in the air for an eon and Fakhar Zaman and Khushdil Shah bumped into each other and nearly made a hash of it. Khushdil just about clings on - very good catch, really. Sharma's blitz comes to a close
length ball at pace, tucked into the onside for a single
rush of blood to the head, banged into the pitch. Soars above Kohli and the diminutive Rizwan for five bonus runs
crisp punch to wide mid-off for a single that gets him off the mark

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rahul, no run
commentary: tailing back into him, driven to the covers

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rahul, no run
commentary: off stump line, defended to the offside
slower ball, prodded into the offside. An overthrow allows Rahul to keep the strike
charges down the ground, and holes to long-on. Shadab strikes off the first ball. Got to the pitch but got neither the power nor the elevation, and Mohammad Nawaz takes a smart catch
SKY doesn't hand around. Sees there's a bit of length and it's short, and immediately crunches it past backward point for four
played and missed. Close to the edge, and Rizwan, of course, is animated
once more! This was a googly, and Yadav tried to play the same cut shot, and ends up beaten
eases this one down the ground for a single
too short, and Kohli punishes it. Picks it up early and pulls it wide of long-on to help himself to four
plays to parts of the ground simply not available to other players. Opens the face to an impossible degree and whips it over extra cover for four
worked towards the offside for a single
arm ball, went on with the angle. Kohli gets a stride out and defends
driven to short extra cover. Consecutive sdot balls
slapped past the same fielder, who puts a dive in but can't stop it. India come back for two
eased into the onside for a single
dances down the ground and slaps it to long-off
driven to short cover where the fielder does brilliantly to keep it to one
poor fielding gives India a boundary. Thick outside edge from Kohli leapt up and dropped just short of Naseem, who went for a catch that was never on and watches the ball go away for four
lobbed to long-on for a single
works it to long-on for another single
clipped around the corner and they initially wanted to, but decided against it in the end. It was on, though
drops this short, and Kohli drives it to long-off
smeared to square leg for another single
slashed to long on after coming down the wicket
holes out to square leg this time. Yadav made no attempt to keep that down, and the top edge meant it was straight down Asif Ali's throat. Promising little flutter of an innings comes to an end
prodded to short third to get off the mark
pushed into the onside, and the halfway mark arrives. India are 93 for three. Drinks are on the field, and Hemant's taking up the commentary from hereon.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Kohli, no run
commentary: a length ball on the stumps and coming in. Kohli places it towards short midwicket and sets off. Pant takes a couple of steps down as well before sending Kohli back. The fielder has a shy at the keeper's end but misses. Kohli, though, would have been home

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: Hasnain goes short and Kohli takes him on. Swivels him to the deep square leg boundary for four
down the track and hits this length ball on the stumps aerially towards long-on. Didn't get the timing right though. One bounce to the fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Pant, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards short midwicket
length again but down the leg side this time. Needs to be bowled again
slower one, full but once again down the leg side. 100 comes up for India with that wide
a slower length ball, 127kph, on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Kohli, no run
commentary: length outside off, drops it towards backward point and sets off. Pant wisely sends him back
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards short fine leg
full on stumps, flicked towards midwicket for a walking single
walks at the bowler but Nawaz shortens his length. Flicked towards short midwicket
dances down the track but fails to middle this whipped attempt towards long-on. Ends up dragging it towards deep square leg
99kph. Pant goes down the track again but it's short of length on the stumps from Nawaz. Flicked towards short fine leg
another quicker one, 97kph. On a length on the stumps, Pant flicks it towards short midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: starts with a length ball outside off. Kohli skips down the track, slightly towards the leg side and creams it past the diving extra cover fielder on the up. To the left of the fielder
a slower bouncer. Kohli was looking to pull it but delays the shot and drags it towards midwicket. Comes back for the second
down the track but Naseem has bowled this on a hard length at the stumps. Kohli dabs it towards cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Pant, FOUR runs
commentary: length ball around off, pulls it to the deep square leg boundary, second boundary of the over. The deep-backward square leg ran to his right but couldn't reach there in time
much shorter this time, a bit wider as well. Drags the pull towards deep square leg. The deep-backward square leg cuts it off this time
down the track but it's hard length at the stumps. Kohli pushes it towards long-on
length but well outside off and spinning away a bit. Left alone to pocket a wide
length outside off, goes back and punches it towards wide long-off
dances down but Shadab has bowled it full on the leg stump. Pant almost gets yorker. Digs it out towards long-on
full around off, goes for the slog sweep but gets it from the inner half of the bat. Ends up dragging it towards deep midwicket
down the track and looks to smash this over the bowler's head but it was a googly from Shadab. Gets an outside edge and it races to the right of short third for four
taken at backward point. Another googly from Shadab but this time he bowled it on a length outside leg. Pant went for the reverse sweep but ended up mistiming it straight to the fielder
full around off, comes forward and defends it back towards the bowler
length outside off, Kohli skipped out of his crease and slashed at it. Got it over the point fielder off the outer half of the bat. A wayward throw means Kohli comes back for the second
use of feet once again. Hasnain has bowled it on the stumps this time. Flicked towards deep midwicket for another couple
short of length around off, Kohli gives him a wee bit of room by moving towards the leg side. Pulls it down towards deep midwicket

excellent catch by Nawaz! Was a cross-seam delivery around off. Pandya moved slightly towards the off side and it appeared he was a bit cramped as he punched it. Ended up hitting it towards short midwicket where Nawaz dives forward and to his left to take it with both hands

a bouncer to welcome the new batter. Hooda looks to ramp it over the keeper's head but misses. Rizwan leaps to collect it but it flies over him. But he lands awkwardly on his right leg and is in some pain. He is flat on his back. The physio is out to have a look. Rizwan is up on his feet but is limping... And he is ready to keep again after a bit of stretching

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hooda, no run
commentary: length ball around off, dabs it towards point
length but width outside off, Kohli cuts it towards deep point for a couple
length outside off, goes deep and pulls it towards deep midwicket
too full around off, flicked towards long-on
full around off, turning away slightly. Kohli pushes it to the right of the cover fielder
tossed up outside off. Too full and Hooda had to dig it out. Ends up miscuing it towards short third but lands well short of the fielder
a googly from well outside off, turning big and extracting extra bounce as well. Hooda went for the sweep but got beaten
length ball around off, holds its line. Kohli was looking to work it on the leg side but gets it towards mid-off off the outer half of the bat

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hooda, no run
commentary: length ball around off, goes back and flicks it towards short midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hooda, FOUR runs
commentary: superb shot. Full on the stumps, Hooda steps towards the leg side and hits it inside out through extra cover for four
length outside off, once again gives himself some room and steers it towards deep point. The sweeper cuts it off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: 151kph. That hard length around middle and off. Hurries onto the batter and Kohli can only defend it back
a slower one at 133kph!. 18kph slower than the previous ball. Full around off. Kohli flicks it towards wide long-on and sprints back for the second
length but angling down the leg side. Hooda looks to help it fine but misses
length ball around off, Hooda clears his front leg and looks to go over mid-off. Didn't middle it but got enough to clear the mid-off fielder. 150kph this one was. India go past 150
full outside off, slices it inside out over point. Naseem slips while stopping it but ensures his foot wasn't touching the boundary line

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hooda, FOUR runs
commentary: Hasnain goes short, Hooda arches back and plays a falling ramp over the keeper. Gets appreciation from Kohli
full outside off, Hooda scythes it over point for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Kohli, no run
commentary: length outside off, a casual waft from Kohli. Gets beaten

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: Kohli gets to his fifty in style. 149kph but it's full around off. Kohli moves towards the off side and whips it over deep midwicket for six
short outside off, Hooda leaps up and looks to upper cut it but it's bowled 117kph. That means Hooda fails to middle it. A single to deep third

another slower one. Banged into the middle of the pitch, on middle and leg. Kohli was down the ground and towards the leg side. Ends up dragging it behind square leg. Kohli is really sprinting back for the second even though Hooda is saying no. Hooda had to relent in the end as Kohli was already three-fourth of the way down
length outside off, smashes it inside out towards deep cover. Only a single

back-of-the-hand slower one. A length ball around off, Hooda looks to smash it over long-on but gets more height than distance and Nawaz settles under it near wide long-on area. Falls back as he completes the catch
here's the yorker but just misses his mark. Kohli moves across and works it towards midwicket. He wants two and gets two
full on the stumps, 144kph. Kohli nudges it towards long-on for one. Think he wanted to keep strike
goes for the yorker but ends up bowling it way down the leg side. Rizwan collects it but he is hobbling a bit here

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: a slower length ball, well outside off. Kohli looks to pull it from there but gets an under edge that bounces towards the keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: a length ball outside off, Kohli goes for the pull but ends up playing early. Mistimes it towards deep midwicket but refuses the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, no run
commentary: an excellent yorker. Right in the blockhole. Kohli gets his bat down in time but can only dig it out onto his foot. Was bowled at 150kph

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Kohli, 1 run, OUT
commentary: Rauf goes for the another yorker but misses his mark this time. Ends up bowling a low full toss that Kohli flicks it towards deep square leg. He is charging back for the second, even puts in the dive but cannot beat the direct hit from Asif Ali

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR runs
commentary: Rauf goes for another yorker but it's a low full toss outside off. Bishnoi slices it through point. Fakhar charges in from deep but the ball spins at him and goes for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR runs
commentary: almost an action replay of the last ball. Rauf goes for the yorker. Ends up bowling a low full toss around off. Bishnoi slices. Fakhar charges in, this time for a catch. But he overruns and had to hop to take it overhead. But he ends up palming it over for another four. That makes it a ten-run over
A hint of swing outside off. Length ball defended to point.
A tad back of a length outside off, patted to point
Booming in-swinger, he misses the flick and is rapped on the pads. But that was sliding down leg.
Another in-dipper that hits the batter around the thigh pad. That was a bit short of a length. The ball rolls to point
back of a length outside off, coming in again. The batter punches it back to the bowler off the backfoot.
He's getting the inswingers on point today. Short of a good length around middle, he stays rooted to the crease and works it to midwicket.
Yep, he does. Back of a length tailing into Mendis, he gets an inside edge to point. A wayward throw get them an extra run.
He gives himself room to the length ball on leg stump. Looks to hoick it away, gets it off the inside half of the bat to square leg.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Mendis, no run
commentary: Back of a length on off, takes it away this time around. The batter has a poke at it, does not connect.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Mendis, no run
commentary: Ah, lovely! Comes back into the batter now. Good length ball met around the middle stump by the batter who can meekly push it back to the bowler

Searches for the glory ball now and is close to getting it. Yorker length on middle, shaping into the batter. He digs it to mid-on and sets off. The fielder has a shy at the stumps and Mendis was gone for all money had that hit.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: Ah, ruins a good over. Banged in short but down leg, Nissanka helps it past the keeper.
In-swinger on off, he looks to flay it away over the on side. Miscues it to the right of mid-on
Out-swinging knuckle ball, another wild hack from the batter, but he gets a thick outside edge. Thankfully for the batter, it falls short of deep third man
Another knuckle ball, another mistimed hoick, another top edge and once again the ball falls just short of Chahal at dep third man. Could he have come in a little quicker though?
BANG! Length outside off, he dances down the track and smacks it straight down the ground.
Length, shaping into the batter, who falls over trying to work it away. Gets rapped on the pads, but that was going down leg.
Full-length delivery, was the knuckle ball again. Nissanka spots it this time and works it to deep midwicket, who was sent back just before this ball.
Finds the hard length right away. Nissanka looks to scoop it away first ball, but Hardik rolled his fingers well on the ball. The ball goes just over the stumps
Follows Nissanka with an on-pace delivery as the batter gives himself room. But Nissanka is up to the task and lofts him straight through the line over mid-on and over the ropes
Back of a length on middle and leg, he turns it in front of square and some good running gives them two
Back of a length again on middle and leg, he tucks it to deep square leg
He's hitting the hard lengths here. Cramps him for room this time as Mendis can only fend it back to the bowler
Looks for the scoop by shuffling across his stumps, does not get any bat on it. Can only glove it to the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Mendis, FOUR runs
commentary: LOVELY SHOT! Length outside off, he maintains his shape and smears it over covers. He hit it on the up and did it exquisitely.
Rolls his fingers over the ball outside off, slapped to deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: In the slot outside off and Nissanka pummels it over mid-off. Was a slower ball again but there was a lot of width for Nissanka to free his arms
Back of a length outside off, he cuts it to the right of Chahal at short third man, who puts in a dive

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Mendis, SIX runs
commentary: Oh, that is a shot and a half! Slower short ball that sat up to be hit and Mendis obliged by smoking it over deep midwicket and way into the stands
Yorker on off stump, he digs it out, opens the face of the bat and guides it past point for two.
Short, wide, and was there to be hit. Nissanka does not miss out. Goes back and smashes it through covers
The fifty comes up in the sixth over. Flatter outside off, he opens the face of the blade to short third man
Slightly shorter outside off, was a bit flighted. He gives himself room and cuts it to point.
WHAT A SHOT! Tossed up outside off, he dances down the track and picks the bones out of it thumping it through the line over the long off fence.
short and wide, he goes back and pats to point

Ah, beats him in the flight completely but Mendis adjusts in the end. Tossed up gently outside off, 75 kph. Mendis is down the track, and beaten completely. But somehow finds and edge to short third man. End of a top powerplay.
Length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket.
On a length outside off, he shuffles across a touch and works to deep square leg.
Slower back of a length ball outside off, he waits for it and slaps it to deep cover
Pacy length ball outside off, he taps it in the gap between point and short third man but a diving stop by Chahal saves a few runs
Length outside off, goes wide of a crease does Pandya. Mendis stands tall and flays it to deep point
Length outside off, patted to backward point
Tossed up outside off but that was a tad short. He goes back and cuts it to sweeper cover
Oh, what a shot! That is some hit. Flighted outside off, he shimmies down and goes inside out over covers and the ball travels all the way
a tad short outside off, he goes back and tickles to short third man for a quick run
tossed up spinning into the batter, who pushes to long on
carrom ball on off, he taps it to the right of the bowler. A bit of a hesitation but Ashwin is unable to reach the ball and they complete a run
Another carrom ball, picked up well as he sweeps it behind square for a run
Keeps it up outside off, he laces the drive to long off
Flighted outside off, he bends low and drags it to long on

They are just finding the gaps! Flighted on middle stumps, he gets down on one knee and slams it powerfully in the gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg. That goes flat and hard over the ropes.
Slider outside off, he taps it to short third man and they scamper for a run. The umpire is called in but the batter was in. Would have been out with a direct hit.

He is beaten on the flight as he skips down the track and taps it to short third man. Another quick run attempted. This is tighter though with Nissanka having to put in the dive. The third umpire called again but the throw being wide helped the batter get in
Flighted around off, gets forward and drives to long off
Carrom ball on off, bunted to the right of short midwicket for a run
Another carrom ball outside off, he pushes it to the left of the bowler. A dive is put in but he can't rein it in
