Fifty up for Nissanka. What a knock this has been. Length on off, pushed to long on for a run
quicker off-break on the pads, he can't work it away. The ball rolls to the on side.
Carrom ball on the stumps, he stays back in his crease and flicks it to deep square leg.
Flatter outside off, but was slightly short too. He goes back and pats to short third man
Top-edge straight over the bowler's head. And another four. Short of a length, he looks for the pull, and gets it over the keeper
Back of a length on middle he flays it to deep square leg
Slower length ball outside off, he slices it towards the incoming deep cover fielder. Even the miscues are falling in the gap
hurries the batter with a back of a length delivery but Mendis still manages to fend it to cover and collect a run
length on off, goes for the slog, gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket
Banged in short around leg stump, he goes for the pull, does not connect with Pant collecting it to his left.

There's the first wicket! Flighted ball outside leg, he goes for the reverse sweep looking to clear the in-field. But he cannot keep it down or find the gap and finds Rohit Sharma at backward point. But what a knock this was by Nissanka. Has set the chase up brilliantly.
Fuller on middle and leg, he clips it to the left of Ashwin at short midwicket who puts in a dive to his right and intercepts.
flighted outside off, defended to cover

In the aiiiir and a second wicket in the over! Is there a way back for India? Flighted gently on middle. He goes for the hard sweep, gets a top edge and Suryakumar at deep backward square completes a simple catch. Chahal is pumped.
Leg-spinner first up outside off, he goes back and punches to sweeper cover
Slider on leg stump, he fails to flick it away and is hit on the pads. But that was turning down leg.
Back of a length on off, he times the pull to deep midwicket
Length on the leg stump, he gets across and taps it back to the bowler.
Length outside off, he stays legside of it and taps it down to third man with an open face of the bat
Mendis is doing this so well! Slower bouncer outside off, but that once again just sits up. Mendis ramps it past short third man for a four. Brings up his fifty with that
Length outside off, but he gets well across to turn it away to square leg
Banged in short outside off this time. He sways outside the line of that. Probably wasn't expecting it.
Incredible the way he is playing with the field. Not at all a bad ball. Length outside off, he gets well across and helps it to the right of short fine leg
Flighted on middle, he gets a top edge on the sweep but the ball falls short of Chahal running in from square leg,
Flatter on the pads, he is hit on the pads and missed the sweep.
Flighted on middle and leg, he taps it to the on side and sets off. But Pant is onto it in a flash and Gunathilaka has to dive in to make it back.

Flighted gently outside off and he lofts it straight into the hands of long off. What are SL doing? Mendis is batting beautifully but is not getting any support. Was looking to go much squarer but hits it straight to Rahul.
Flighted off-break outside off, he defends to cover

Another one for Chahal? Yes, the umpire's finger goes up and it is the big wicket of Mendis. Slider on middle stump, he goes back but is beaten by the pace of it. Is struck right in front of the stumps. Mendis reviews but more in hope than anything. He is walking off even before the third umpire's decision. Impact in line and the ball would have clattered into leg stump.
Flighted down leg, he overbalances but Pant fails to connect
Flighted full ball on middle stump, he pushes to long on
Was shaping for the sweep to a very full ball, but adjusts at the last moment. Somehow gets his bat down to turn it behind square.
Full on off, he digs it to long on
ALL THE WAY! There was risk involved but he gets his reward. Spinning into the batter, but he is up for it and slams it over the deep midwicket fence. Was the longer part of the ground too.
Flatter on leg stump, he defends it to the on side.
Tossed up outside off, he gets forward and taps to cover point. They take a quick run

Goes up and goes all the way! That went miles in the air but he had enough power to clear the fence. Dances down the track to the quicker ball. He swings through the line and gets a lot of height and just clears deep midwicket.
Flighted nicely outside off, he taps to short third man and they scamper through
Carrom ball outside off, he gets across and sweeps it hard to deep square leg.
Just evades a leaping Kohli at point. Flighted outside off, beats him in the flight completely. Rajapaksa looks to loft it over covers, can only slice it but the ball beats the fielder.
Quicker on the pads, worked away to deep square leg
Full length on middle stump, he is deep in his crease and squeezes it powerfully to deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Shanaka, FOUR runs
commentary: Sliced away for a four. That is a timely boundary. Full outside off. He has enough space to free his arms and he flays it to the wide third man fence. The fielder runs across from deep point, gets the dive in but can't save the boundary.
Full outside off, he slaps it to deep cover.
Banged in short on the body, he mistimes the pull, but there is no midwicket in place.

Very full outside off, he digs it to Rohit at extra cover, where a misfield allows the batters an extra run. He lifted his head a tad bit early did Rohit, possibly searching for a runout. Instead lets the ball through his legs. The pressure getting to the best.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Shanaka, no run
commentary: Excellent yorker to finish things off. On the toes goes Arshdeep, that swung a bit as well. Nothing that the batter can do. There is a slight appeal as well but that was going down leg.
Slower back of a length ball outside off, he looks to cut it hard and misses it completely. Did not get enough room there. Hardik asks Pant whether he heard a sound. Nothing from Pant, though.
Full length on leg stump, 140kph. He is beaten for pace as he looks to flick it away. Is hit on the pads with the ball rolling to the on side
Unlucky Hardik! Slower back of a length ball outside off, he looks to force it away through covers, gets a thick outside edge that just goes past a diving Pant to his right.
142 kph, so Hardik is steaming in alright. Length on leg, Shanaka goes for a wild slog, misses and the balls squeaks past the stumps
145 kph now but on leg stump. All Shanka has to do it is get some bat on it and he does that with panache! Gets across and helps it over the fine leg fence for a 69m six.
slower length ball on the pads. He does not get any bat on it this time though. The ball goes to fine leg.
Low full toss outside off, he shuffles well across but scoops it straight to short fine leg. How he would have loved to find the gap there
Low full toss again on the pads, he flicks it away but straight to deep backward square leg. Hmm, wasn't the best of deliveries .
Wide yorker but that was well past the tramline. Called a wide.
Another wide past the tramline again. Ah, why he is trying so hard. Get the yorkers closer to the stump.
Full toss outside off, and this time Shanaka gets enough bat on it and thumps it to the deep cover fence. The 50 partnership comes up in 29 balls.
Edged and four! Is that the game? Very full outside off, he gets a thick outside edge and with the third man up that was a four for the taking. Too predictable there Bhuvi.
Yorker outside off, he digs it to extra cover. But Shanaka has done his job.
Length ball on leg stump, patted to backward point sensibly and they take a run.
Inch-perfect yorker on middle stump. He can only jam it to the onside. They take a quick run.
Full length outside off, he gets a thick outside edge to backward point. 142kph.
Another yorker on middle and leg, he digs it to deep midwicket. Surya runs in quickly but a wayward throw means they get back for two.
Very full on the leg stump again, he gets an inside edge as the ball lobs to backward point on the bounce

All over! Sri Lanka win with one ball to spare. They hold their nerves at a clutch stage, India...don't. Back of a length outside off, he shapes up for the cut but makes no connection with the ball going to Pant. He had all three stumps to aim at with the batter nowhere in the frame. He misses. The ball rolls to Arshdeep who has a chance to run Shanka out at the non-striker's end. He misses too, and they run back for two. Shanaka lost his bat while taking the first run but he scampers back, no bat in hand, puts in the dive and makes it. Arms aloft, he is all smiles. SL win by six wickets and have a foot in the final.
oh it swings right up but perhaps the 139ks means he gets his bat down in time. And this is swing away from around leg. Rahul gets a single off the outside edge. Can he swing it in?
yes he can swing it in, but it is down the leg side. Called a wide

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: no swing here, Rohit shimmies a little and defends to cover
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man for one
gets swing back in, but again it is a wide down the leg side
half an appeal for lbw but this has not swung back in, which means it has pitched outside leg
gets a bottom edge as he tries to cut a short-of-a-length ball. Gets a bottom edge
fuller, but no swing, Rahul defends outside off
offbreak first up, Rohit clips it to deep midwicket for one
looks like a carrom ball but it hasn't turned. Punched down to long-on for one
offbreak to Rohit, worked to deep midwicket for one
lovely shot. He is down the wicket, close to the pitch of the ball, and he has gone against the turn of the offbreak and chipped it over extra cover. Late flick of the wrists

massive swing back in and given lbw even though he has skipped down the wicket. They have reviewed it. It is drifting in just like an arm ball but in the opposite direction. Rahul is completely flummoxed. It looks like it has beaten the inside edge and laned on the toe. Has it swung too much? Hang on, there is a sound signature as the ball passes the bat, but it looks like it is the bat hitting the boot. The third umpire says the same. And the ball tracker shows it is clipping leg. Rahul has to walk back
again the reverse arm ball, swinging in as opposed to out. Kohli defends it back to him
on a length, wide, opens the face on it, gets a single to third man
on a length, around off, inside edge onto the toe
the ball is stopping here. Kohli shapes up for a punch, but the ball holds in the pitch and bounces extra. Hit uppishly towards mid-off

appeal for lbw, not given, but Kohli is confounded it is not called a wide. The umpire waits for the 15 seconds for the review to end and then calls it a wide. That is a strange one. This is a yorker, barely missing leg. Called wide

no need to wait for the 15 seconds here. His stumps are flattened. Kohli is playing according to the team plan, looking to capitalise on the field restrictions. Looking to slog a length ball over midwicket but it seams back in a touch and both his off and middle stumps are on the ground
full, nearly a yorker, whipped to deep square leg for two
drive on the up, but can't find the timing. Fielded at cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: is it an offcutter? No it is not. But it has skipped off like a cutter from short of a length. Rohit defends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: Rohit stays positive. Delays his backswing to adjust to the slow pitch and slogs him over wide mid-on. He is not looking for a six. Just to clear mid-on, which he does with ease

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: short of a length, wide, nicely punched away, but gets just the single to deep square third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Yadav, no run
commentary: nice off-drive on the up, but hits it straight to mid-off
on a length, no room, Surya opens the face and takes a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: the slip has moved to a short third, and this edge nearly carries all the way to him. Would have been wide of slip anyway. Again it is proving difficult to time the ball here

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full, just outside off, again inside half of the bat. The ball rolls along to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: down the wicket, Asitha sees it and digs the ball in, but Rohit still hooks from there. There is a deep square leg there for the catch but it just clears the man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: lovely shot. Short of a length, wide, Rohit rocks back to punch this between point and cover-point. Much-neede runs for India before the powerplay ends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
commentary: this time he gets inside the line of a short-of-a-length ball and tucks it square of short fine leg for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: and he misses out on a full toss. Flicks it to leg, along the ground, and finds midwicket. They take one off the fumble
short of a length, straight, tucked away to deep square leg
on a length, on the pads, worked away for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: Rohit is in a mood. Gets down on a knee early and sweeps a length ball deliberately in the air and over square leg. It is a carrom ball but it doesn't matter. He has timed it superbly
full and straight, pushed down to long-on for one
offbreak, just short of a length, punched down to mid-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: flights this one, nearly a yorker, Rohit opens the face, but can't beat cover
this one swings back in, the reverse arm ball, and it is nearly a yorker. Dug out to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: on a length, just outside off, defended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: legbreak, just outside off, pushed to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Yadav, 1 run
commentary: full legbreak, punched to long-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: slows it down, stays with legbreaks, pushed straight to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
commentary: down the wicket, soft hands, places this to the right of long-on, comes back for two

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: legbreak, just short of a length, punched to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
commentary: on a length, into the pads, placed wide of deep midwicket for two

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: length ball down the leg side, but no pace to work with. Gets just the single to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Yadav, no run
commentary: on a length, on top of off, pushed to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Yadav, no run
commentary: low bounce. Surya looks to pull this into the leg side but it stays low and goes under his bat. ucky it has still sailed over the stumps
slower ball, wide outside off, slashed away to deep third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: Rohit shimmies down and pulls the consequent short ball to deep midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
commentary: short of a length, punched wide of long-off and comes back for two. Rohit knows it is not easy to hit boundaries on this pitch. He is picking twos

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: pushed down to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Yadav, 1 run
commentary: sweeps off a length, deliberately in the air, but can't beat deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: dropped at extra cover. Rohit sees a shortish ball and wants to hit it hard over extra. The ball stops on him, Rohit's bottom hand comes off, and Shanaka dives to his left but can only get a hand on it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Yadav, FOUR runs
commentary: first boundary since the fifth over. This wrong'un is a touch too short, and Surya hits it through midwicket for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Yadav, 2 runs
commentary: shapes up for the slog sweep, but gets just a bottom edge on it, which ends up in the hole between deep midwicket and long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: and Rohit unleashes a whip. This ball is asking to be hit. On a length, on the pads, he clears the front leg a little, and sends it sailing over deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: down the wicket, Asitha pulls the length back, and he punches it to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, stays leg side of it and punches it to deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: and now the ramp. Brings up a timely fifty. Gets the front foot across, inside the line of a length ball, and sends it over short fine. The whole team rises in applause

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Asitha Fernando to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: he is picking his spots here. Makes room and goes over extra cover, but the timing is not great and allows deep cover to get around
on a length, outside off, driven with an open face to deep point for one
short of a length, just outside off, punched to deep cover for one
down the wicket, Madushanka goes wide, and Rohit still slashes at it. In the air it goes, but lands short of the advancing deep point
slower ball, on a length, whipped to long-on for one
shuffles across looking for a slog but he is early into it, and gets an inside edge onto the pad for one

incredible shot. Surya's wrists are incredible. He is shimmying, and Madushanka goes short. There is no room available, but he upper-cuts it. Deep third is taken aback after charging in for the catch. He tracks back, but it still goes over him
pulled wide of deep midwicket for two. Rohit is not at his quickest, and might even have got out had the throw hit the stumps direct

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: Rohit steps down, the wrong'un makes him abort an attacking shot. Punched to extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: high and handsome. Down the wicket again, this time Hasaranga flights it, and he has lofted him clean over long-on. This is proving to be a superb innings from hi

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
commentary: wrong'un, worked into the leg side for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Yadav, 1 run
commentary: he has shanked this helicopter shot completely, which is just as well because it doesn't carry to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: lovely shot. A Rohit special. Makes room, gets under it, gores inside-out, and clears extra cover with ease. This is with the turn, and almost carries for a six

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
commentary: looks like he might have mistimed this, but this is a bigger six than the earlier one. He skips down the wicket, Hasaranga looks to go wide outside off, but that only gives him room to swing his arms through it. Well over long-off
slower ball, on a length, punched to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rohit Sharma, OUT
commentary: oh he is gone. Slower short ball, has some room available, but Rohit doesn't get much power into it because of the slowness. And he has picked out deep point with the upper-cut. A superb innings comes to an end

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Hardik, no run
commentary: on a length, around off, pushed back to him
direct hit from mid-on but he has made it. Nicely placed to the right of the fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Yadav, no run
commentary: slower ball, 111ks, just outside off, and Surya bottom-edges it to the keeper
full, outside off, driven with an open face to deep point
on a length, on off, pushed to long-off for one
on a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

full, outside off, to the right of point, Hasaranga hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. Third umpire has to check this. He makes it by a frame, and also takes an overthrow off the deflection from the stumps
short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
full, on off, pushed to long-off for one
carrom ball, quick too, beats his attempt to back-cut it
slower ball first up, nearly a yorker, punched down to long-on for one

looks for his favourite ramp but the slowness of the pitch gets him. Also he is cramped for room. He is looking to somehow get enough on this bouncer to clear short third, but he has nothing to work with. Easy catch for short third. This is not a slower ball, mind you
slower b all, short of a length, no room to time it. Hit straight to short cover
pace on, short, outside off, an d he has bludgeoned this between deep midwicket and long-on for four
on a length, no room, pushed back to Shanaka
doesn't look Pant is struggling, though. Gets the width and the pace on a short-of-length delivery, and cuts it through point for four
overpitched, but no room, driven to long-off for one
wide down the leg side. Pant looks to help it over short fine but gets no touch on it
fires this in short, and Pant pulls him through to deep square leg for his third boundary in five balls. All three off the back foot
slows this one down, and Pant bunts the length ball into the leg side for one
carrom ball, punched down to long-off for one
wide short ball, he doesn't get all of it, playing it straight to point
on a length, at the off stump, Rishabh looks to open the face for a single but can't send it far enough of the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hardik, 1 run
commentary: big back lift, Hasaranga keeps it away from him, Pandya pushes him to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Pant, 1 run
commentary: down on a knee to manage to pull this to deep square leg for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hardik, 1 run
commentary: nice delivery, not giving him the full length to go downtown. Pandya pushes him to long-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Pant, no run
commentary: down on a knee, looking to go behind square with a pull, but can't beat short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Pant, 1 run
commentary: into the surface, pulled away, but no pace to work with. Just the single to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Hardik, 1 run
commentary: front of the hand, not full, Pandya can get just the single to long-on. Superb comeback fo0r Hasaranga after Rohit went after him in his third

Pandya is waiting for the slower ball it would seem. But it is the length that has done the damage. It is full enough for Pandya to loft it from inside the crease. And he sends it for a massive six over long-off
bouncer, too high, also down leg. Called a wide
low full toss, on the pads, flicked wide of deep square for two
oh he has caught out deep midwicket. This is not a great delivery. In the slot, on the pads, Pandya looks to go over deep midwicket, but doesn't get all of it. Caught at deep midwicket
wide down the leg side as he attempts a yorker

the ramp is probably not the smartest shot on this pitch. Shanaka digs one in, Hooda plays his favourite shot, and is caught at short third. But now that he has been caught, they can check it for a no-ball on height. Remember the wide ball earlier in the over was one bouncer for the over. If this is above his shoulder, this will be a no-ball. And it is above Hooda's shoulder even when he is off his feet. What looks like a wicket is a no-ball. Had this cleared short third, they wouldn't have been able to check if this is a no-ball. Remember readers, don't outrage over this. They checked the no-ball because there was a dismissal. These are the rules. Don't go by emotional commentators on TV
pulls it away, wide of deep square, gets two
yorker, opens the face on it, gets a single to deep point
goes for the wide yorker, goes too wide, and is called wide
nearly a yorker, drilled straight of long-on for two

Hooda shuffles across early to look to go over short fine, giving Madushanka a full view of the stumps. Madushanka bowls a length ball, and Hooda is early into the shot. The middle stumps goes for a walk
short of a length, outside off, steers it to deep third to hand over the strike to Pant

big big wicket. This could be worth 10 runs. Slower short ball, Pant still goes hard trying to pull it for a six, but he has found deep midwicket, one of only four fielders outside the circle. Superb delivery. Legcutter slower bouncer. really difficult ball to execute
yorker, Ashwin digs it out wide of deep midwicket, comes back for two. That extra fielder inside the circle has got them the extra run
yorker again, jams under Ashwin's bat. Just the single to point
lovely slower yorker, dipping on him, Bhuvneshwar can't even get bat on it
slower ball, no room, but Ashwin makes room and somehow finds the gap between point and cover-point. Gets two
on-pace, short ball, into the body, cramps him up, Ashwin can get just the single to long-on
slower ball, Bhuvneshwar delays the downswing but not enough. It is still too slow for his slog, and the middle stump is pegged back and leg stump flattened

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Arshdeep Singh, 1 run
commentary: length ball, looking to angle it across him, punched straight to mid-on. Ashwin sets off for one, Arsh responds, but he is gone for all money if the fielder hits. He doesn't

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Ashwin, SIX runs
commentary: wow Ashwin. Ashsix. He has cleared the biggest boundary of the ground. Karunaratne gets greedy and bowls an on-pace length ball. Ashwin takes on the boundary that Pandya failed to clear. And he has timed this beautifully
slower ball now, and he gets the wicket. Oh hang on he doesn't. Hasaranga drops a sitter running in from long-on. It costs them two runs
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Babar Azam, OUT
commentary: A first-ball duck for Babar. A length ball, pitching around middle and just straightening to beat the inside edge and hit on the front pad. There's no doubt in the umpire's mind. Celebrations in the Afghanistan camp

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Zaman, no run
commentary: length ball but well outside off, left alone

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Zaman, FOUR runs
commentary: length outside off, shaping away a touch. Fakhar pushes at it, gets an outside edge to the left of the slip fielder. Too fine for deep third to cut off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Zaman, no run
commentary: full around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
length ball coming in with the angle this time. Defended towards mid-on for a quick single
starts with a length ball around off, defended towards short midwicket
full around off, defended on the leg side once again
length around off, comes forward and defends again, 101kph that was
106kph, length ball on the pads, looks to flick it but is beaten. The ball hits the pad and rolls to the left of short midwicket. Rizwan spots a leg bye and sprints to the other end
102kph, length ball around off, coming in for the right-hander. Defended on the front foot
90kph, full on the stumps, flicked towards square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: length ball around middle and off. Pushed towards mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: back of length around off, goes back and dabs it towards point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, SIX runs
commentary: length ball on the stumps, Rizwan picks it up and sends it over long leg for the first six of the Pakistan innings

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: a low full toss outside off, Rizwan mistimes it towards mid-off as he attempts a drive

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: length outside off, looked like a slower one. Sliced towards cover-point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: attempts a slower one but it ends up as a low full toss around off. Rizwan waits for it before flicking it through square leg for four

full length around off, drops it towards extra cover and sets off. Najibullah charges at the ball, swoops low, picks it up with his right, turns around and nails a direct hit at the bowler's end... and Fakhar is short of his ground. Pakistan 18 for 2
length ball on the stumps, defended on the leg side
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
length ball around off, pushed towards covers
length ball around off, spinning back in sharply to cramp the batter. Flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flicked but straight towards short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: Full around off, drives it to the left of the point fielder who dives full length to make the stop

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Iftikhar, FOUR runs
commentary: a length ball outside off and angling in. Iftikhar pushes at it, gets an inside edge past the stumps. Lucky to get four there
length outside off, pushed through covers, the fielder puts in the chase and flicks it back but the batter collect three

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Rizwan, no run
commentary: length, angling towards middle stump. Flicked towards short fine leg
length ball around off, punched to the left of mid-on. The fielder let go of the ball quickly. A dive from Rizwan to make the ground. No direct hit though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Iftikhar, FOUR runs
commentary: that should release some pressure. Short of length around off, Iftikhar transfers the weight back and pulls it through midwicket for four
length ball around off and middle, defended
length but down the leg side. Rizwan looks to sweep it fine but misses. A leg bye to short fine leg
a carrom ball. Starting just outside off and spinning just away to beat the forward push
length ball on the stumps, pushed to long-on
97kph, a googly around off. Comes forward and nudges it towards square leg
101kph. This one turns in from a length around off, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball around off, flicked towards deep midwicket off the back foot
a googly. Full around off, Iftikhar pushes at it, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: a huge appeal for lbw but not given. Afghanistan, though, want to review it. It was a googly from Rashid, pitching well outside off. Rizwan came forward to defend, got beaten on the inside edge but I feel the impact was outside off. And the ball-tracking confirms as much
full around off, comes forward and flicks it towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: full outside off, pushes it towards point
98kph, another googly. Full around off, comes forward to defend but the ball hits the inside half of the bat and rolls towards square leg
length ball around off, gets a leading edge towards backward point as he looks to work it on the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Rizwan, no run
commentary: length ball outside off, punched to the left of short midwicket where Zazai makes a tumbling stop
length outside off, steered towards short third

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket where Najib makes a diving stop
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, goes back and punches it towards long-on
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
a googly, 100kph. A length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Rizwan, no run
commentary: another googly but much slower through the air this time, 89kph. Defended on the front foot

given lbw but Rizwan wants to review this. Another googly from Rashid, pitching outside off and hurrying the batter. Rizwan was on the back foot, looking to flick it but missed and was struck in front of middle. The ball-tracking shows it would have gone on to hit the leg stump. That's a huge wicket
full outside off, sweeps it fine from there and picks up two. Nabi isn't happy with his fielder in the deep
full around off, flicked towards long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Shadab, no run
commentary: length ball on the stumps, pushed back

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Shadab, no run
commentary: length outside off, kept a touch low. Shadab goes for the cut but misses
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to work it towards cover-point for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: full on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
full on the stumps, digs it out towards long-off. Fifty comes up for Pakistan
length ball around off, goes back and cuts it to the right of sweeper cover and they sprint back for the second
Back of a length on off, carved behind point for a couple
short and pulled towards deep midwicket. There's a man in the deep, so probably a good thing for the batter that he didn't really time this
length on off, gets forward and pushes this through the covers for one. Sweeper collects in the deep.
length ball nipping in, back foot punch straight to cover
slower ball outside off, back of a length. Cut into the ground towards point for one
Nips back in from outside off, off a length. Catches the inside half of the bat on the drive towards midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, swept in the air briefly towards deep midwicket
fired in on the stumps, driven down the ground to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Shadab, SIX runs
commentary: Out of the ground! What a hit from Shadab. This was the quicker ball, back of a length and Shadab gets right under this with the slog sweep. 97 meters!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Shadab, no run
commentary: In the blockhole, all he can do is dig this back out towards Nabi

bowler_to_batsman, runs: M Nabi to Shadab, FOUR runs
commentary: Low full toss, swatted over midwicket! Another clean hit from Shadab, as Nabi once more misses his length.
Around the wicket now, and Shadab brings out the conventional sweep now. It's wide of square leg too, and they hare for a couple
length on the stumps, worked towards midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, gets back and defends
good length wider of off, goes for the cut and is beaten on the outside edge
Wow, another huuuuge strike from Shadab! This is in the slot, and Shadab just clears the front foot and swings right through, launching it over long on
good length driven to extra cover
slightly shorter, and Shadab looks to pull this behind square, but there's sharp turn and it ends up hitting the batter on the body
length on off, opens the face and punches this past point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Shadab, no run
commentary: nipping in from around the wicket, keeps low too as the batter looks to dab this square on the offside. Swing and a miss.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Shadab, no run
commentary: back of a length on off, looks to guide this down to third man but can't beat backward point
good length on off, pushed square on the offside for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: good length, nipping back in towards the stumps, defended back to the bowler
Slower bouncer wide outside off, gets over this well and cuts this in front of point, but there's a man in the deep
googly off a length, worked behind square on the onside off the back foot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Shadab, no run
commentary: leg spinner now, pitching on a length on off, defended on the back foot
googly on off on a good length, stays back and works this square on the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: leg spinner now, back of a length on off. Back foot punch, but Rashid gets down well to his right to save the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: pitching on middle and straightening, defended from within the crease
length on off, back foot punch past a diving Rashid. Just 3 off the over.
angled in towards off, back of a length. Looks to pull this hard, but doesn't connect properly. Goes down to deep midwicket
length outside off, makes room and drives this hard off the back foot straight to extra cover. They steal a run, but a direct hit might have had him.
Short and pulled straight into gleeful hands of deep midwicket! This was the slower ball, and it sounded clean off Iftikhar's bat, but he just couldn't get the distance

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Nawaz, FOUR runs
commentary: Edged past the keeper! Did he mean this, think I'll give him the benefit of the doubt. Yes, he stays back to this short ball and just plays it soft hands, guiding fine past the keeper.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Nawaz, no run
commentary: back of a length on off, defended towards point, who rushes in to prevent the single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Nawaz, no run
commentary: Short and goes for the pull but misses. There seems to be some excitement from behind the wicket for a caught behind, but it's only Gurbaz that seems to be feeling it. No review taken.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Shadab, SIX runs
commentary: slog sweep over square leg! This is not quite on a good length and Shadab gets right under it.

But Rashid has the last laugh! This is again tossed up outside off - brave from Rashid considering the result last ball - but this time it's the leg spinner. Shadab looks to smash this down towards long-off, but only manages a thick looping outside edge to short third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Asif Ali, SIX runs
commentary: Slog sweep for ANOTHER six! What a shot first ball. This was a little quicker, in the slot and he's in position early to absolutely clobber this

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Asif Ali, 1 run
commentary: pushed through on a length, gets back and nudges this to the right of Rashid, who can't field it clearly

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Nawaz, 1 leg bye
commentary: good length on leg, deflects off the front pad square on the onside for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Asif Ali, no run
commentary: length on off, opens the face and looks to guide this past short third but only finds the man

Traps him lbw! It's a gorgeous slower ball, it's the off cutter. Pitches on off, and nips in. The batter looks to work this onside and looks to have been struck in front of off on the back foot. Pakistan review, but this looks dead on. Yes, that is a wasted review, as this is shown to be crashing into middle.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Khushdil, 1 leg bye
commentary: Quicker ball now, 138kph, again raps the batter on the pads. But this is going down leg.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Asif Ali, 1 run
commentary: Yorker from wide of the crease, 141kph, from around the wicket. Dug out past the outstretched right hand of the bowler for one
Another attempted yorker, 141kph, on the pads. Clipped towards square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Asif Ali, 1 run
commentary: Around the wicket, another great yorker, 140kph. Makes room but can only drag this towards long-on

Chopped on! Game on! Another fuller length ball outside off, not quite a yorker and Khushdil goes for the drive. But a little deviation off the pitch catches the inside edge on the way to the base of the stumps! What an over from Farooqi

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Asif Ali, 1 run
commentary: short from around the wicket, angled in to the batter. Pulled towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Haris Rauf, OUT
commentary: And it's another one! Chopped on again! This is wide outside off, almost sixth stump line, back of a length. Rauf just looks to swing at this and only ends up getting a thick inside edge on to the stumps.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Naseem Shah, 1 wide
commentary: back of a length, but it's down leg. There's an appeal from Gurbaz, but I sense it's to avoid the wide. Although, wait, they seem to have spent their final review on this. And yeah, this was nowhere near the bat.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Naseem Shah, 1 run
commentary: Full outside off, goes for the drive and gets a thick outside edge to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Asif Ali, SIX runs
commentary: And boy does he deliver! A half volley in the slot on off, angling in and Asif just swings right through this. High over cow corner.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Asif Ali, OUT
commentary: And Ali is gone! Is this the game!? This was the slower bouncer, and Asif goes for a hook he was never really set for. He can only manage a top edge to short fine leg, who runs backwards and takes the catch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Naseem Shah, 1 run
commentary: length on off, swings hard and gets this down to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Naseem Shah, SIX runs
commentary: Six down the ground! Misses the yorker, it's a low full toss and Naseem, sends this back where it came from! High over long off!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Naseem Shah, SIX runs
commentary: And he's done it! Another missed yorker, another smack over long off! Wild scenes as Naseem Shah is beside himself! Afghanistan are absolutely shattered! What a game of cricket, what a tournament, as Pakistan join Sri Lanka in the finals of the Asia Cup 2022!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: good length on the stumps, nudged towards deep midwicket for one
short of a length on the pads, glanced down to deep backward square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length on off, makes room but can only punch this as far as short extra cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: Short outside off, guided deftly down to third man. It's in the air momentarily, but well wide of point
back of a length, defended square on the offside for a quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length on off, looks to stay back and work this square but can't beat the man at point
googly, spinning away from off, cuts this towards sweeper cover and they scamper two. Well run.
Whipped over deep midwicket! That's the first six off Shadab's bowling this tournament, and what a hit it is. Clears the front leg, and whips this over the man in the deep.
sharp turn away beats Zadran, who's looking to work this on the offside square
goes for the revers scoop now, and his beaten again by the googly
it's the traditional leg spinner now, and Zadran misses as he looks for a big swipe across

And now Shadab gets his man! The pressure being imparted by Pakistan has meant Afghanistan were forced to target Shadab, and the spinner responds to that early six with all his variations. This is the pick of the punch as it's quicker, seam up, and Zadran is unable to get the distance on this loft over long-on. It goes high, but straight down the gullet of the man in the deep!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to M Nabi, OUT
commentary: And strikes immediately! This is chopped on, as Nabi just hangs his bat out to this back of a length delivery in the channel. The ball crashes into the base of the stumps off the inside edge.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Azmatullah, no run
commentary: Full on off, shaping in. Driven but only as far as mid-off
length outside off, opens the face and guides this down to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: back of a length, defended towards point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: short ball, pace-off, and the batter is early on this as he looks to cut this. Only manages to dig it into the turf back to Naseem

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: back of a length, nudged gently down towards long-on
tossed up on leg, driven down to long-on
length ball, googly, Azmat stays back and works this towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Ibrahim Zadran, SIX runs
commentary: Launched over the covers for a maximum! Shadab tosses this up outside off, inviting Ibrahim to go for the big shot, and he certainly obliges with this sumptuous aerial drive.
good length, punched down towards the vacant midwicket
pushed through again, on the stumps. Nudged towards square leg
pushed through outside off now, gets back and slaps this down to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Short slower ball, catches the batter early on the stroke. Ibrahim is unable to get the uppercut away

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Quicker now, on the pads off a length. Beats him for pace, as the ball strike the thigh pad.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Ibrahim Zadran, OUT
commentary: Edged and yet another bowling change does the trick! This is back of a length, quick and rushes Ibrahim who is looking to punch this down the ground off the back foot. The extra bounce surprises him though, and he can only manage a thick edge through to Rizwan.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Fuller on the stumps, 150kph! Rapid stuff from Rauf, as this is defended on the front foot.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Short ball, 142kph, but this keeps low, and goes just past Rashid's head despite him ducking

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: Top fielding down at third man! This is short and wide, and Rashid just helps it on it's way down to third man, but it's Naseem in the deep who sprints full pelt to his left and gets a strong hand on this to stop the boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
commentary: Short arm jab over midwicket! Picks the length early, which is in the slot, stays back and picks this up over the infielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Comes down the ground and looks to flat bat this straight, but it's a slower ball and Rashid is early on the stroke. Gets the toe-end of the bat back to Hasnain

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: Wild slash high behind point on the offside! The man runs back and dives, but is unable to get anywhere near it.
Short again, pulled towards midwicket for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: fuller and slower on the stumps, worked around the corner but straight to short fine leg. Just the one.
Length outside off, looks for the big drive through the covers but ends up with thick bottom edge down to third man for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Azmatullah, no run
commentary: Slower bouncer, Omarzai goes early on the pull and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Azmatullah, FOUR runs
commentary: Sliced past point! Attempted yorker but he misses the length, and it ends up a low full toss. Still needed to be dispatched though.
Another slower ball, on a length. Once more early on the pull as this hits the batter on the pad. You can hear his frustration at missing out on the stump mic

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Another slower short ball, 107kph, swing and a miss from Rashid.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: Another slower ball, 105kph, this time from the back of the hand. Swept/pulled towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Azmatullah, no run
commentary: A rapid yorker on leg stump, 141kph, to finish! Strikes him on the boot but it's going down leg. Great over from Naseem.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Slower ball to start, 126kph, outside off. Swing and a miss and Rashid looks to heave this over midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Slower length ball, and it's another swing and a miss! Just misses the off peg too. Rashid looking to throw the kitchen sink at this.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
commentary: Pace-on, and it's outta here! This is on a length on off, 141kph, Rashid makes room and just uppercuts this over sweeper cover. Cracking shot!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
commentary: Short arm jab down the ground now! Another quicker ball on a length, Rashid skips down the ground and flat bats this hard and straight.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Pace-on again, 138kph, on a length. Rashid charges again, but this time he gets an inside edge through to the keeper on the bounce

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Short ball, 141kph, Rashid swings and misses. And that's that, as Afghanistan have to settle for their lowest total at Sharjah batting first, having faced their full allotment of 20 overs.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: Distinct swing away from a length, moving past the off stump. Left alone.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: length, angling and shaping away again from the left hander from over the wicket. Dabbed to point.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Hazratullah Zazai, no run
commentary: attempted yorker, tries to bring this one back in. Doesn't quite hit the length he wants, dug out back to the bowler.

This time he's on the money! Full and shaping in, raps him on the back pad having pitched on middle and leg, and straightened. Zazai reviews after a brief consultation with Gurbaz, but this looked pretty plumb. And yes, it's three reds. Afghanistan lose a review.
Swings in sharply to the right hander from a length, clipped behind square leg off the pads

That's a corker! Bowls him through the gate! This is on a good length, draws the batter forward on a tentative front foot push, and then it seams through the gap inbetween bat and pad to knock back off stump.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full, swinging away. Driven to cover.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: length and on off, again shaping and nipping away. Left alone

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: fuller and a little wider of off, swinging away. Swings a tentative bat at this, but doesn't get the connection he wants
length outside off, swinging in now. Stays back and punches this past point

good length in the channel outside off, shaping away. The batter is unsure on the shot, looks to play at first and then chooses to leave, ends up deflecting off the toe-end of the bat down to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: back of a length outside off, cuts this uppishly just past a diving point for the Afghanistan's first boundary of the day

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Karim Janat, no run
commentary: short of a length outside off, cut but straight to cover
length, shaping in towards middle and leg, stays back and nudges this to mid-on for a quick single
good length, swinging in towards off, back foot punch to the left of mid-off
Outswinger induces the edge and Kohli gobbles it up at first slip! Janat guilty of following the ball there a bit as he hangs a lazy bat out. Bhuvi though is on fire!
good length shaping in on the stumps, knocked towards mid-on

Another in swinger and another lbw! This is given but Zadran reviews. It looked dead though and the replays prove it. This was full on the stumps, and swinging in towards middle and leg. Afghanistan are folding fast here.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Full on off, defended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Shaping away off a length, hangs a bat at this and misses
full on off, driven well but not timed. Mid-off dives to his left to stop the boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to M Nabi, FOUR runs
commentary: Crunched through the covers! This was certified half-volley and Nabi was on it in a flash with a sweet drive.
Strays on the pads, now and this is clipped past square leg. It's the long boundary through so doesn't quite have the legs to get to the ropes
back of a length on off, stays back and guides this past point for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on the stumps, no swing this time. Defended.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: full on off, driven but straight to cover
length on the stumps, nudged to mid-on for a quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to M Nabi, no run
commentary: length ball, wicket to wicket. Defended on the back foot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to M Nabi, no run
commentary: good length a touch outside off, pushed towards cover on the front foot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to M Nabi, no run
commentary: Slower ball, it's the off cutter and there's a huge appeal for LBW after this beats the inside edge and hits the front pad on the forward defence. Given not out and India waste no time in reviewing. It's very close, but the impact is umpire's call even though the ball is going on to strike the stumps. Stays not out but India retain their review.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Over the wicket shaping away from the right hander, defended towards cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: How has that missed?! This goes right through Ibrahim, who looks to whip this onside, but is beaten by the seam movement. Beats the outside edge and the top of off.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: good length on off, shaping in a touch now. Nudged down to third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to M Nabi, no run
commentary: good length, nipping away, catches a leading edge past point as the batter looks to work this onside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to M Nabi, OUT
commentary: Another lbw shout and this time it's given! But Afghanistan don't have a review. So the batter has to go, this looked like it might have been on the edge in terms of pitching in line with leg, but no matter now.
strays on the pads, and this is whipped down to deep backward square leg
Good length on the stumps, pushed to mid-off.
good length on off, opens the face and pushes this to point
full on off, attempted drive but straight into the turf back to the bowler
goes for the big booming drive, but this swings away sharply and beats the outside edge
Chipped to cover! And that's a five-for for Bhuvneshwar. This was a slower knuckle ball, that catches the batter early on the drive. It's one of the easiest catches Dinesh Karthik will ever take.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Bhuvneshwar to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: nipping in from outside off, and the batter just about keeps this out. End of a cracking spell from Bhuvneshwar.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: good length, shaping in, but it's on the pads. Glanced down to the fine leg boundary!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Outswinger, starting outside leg and towards middle, almost catches the leading edge back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: Short on middle, pulled unconvincingly towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: good length on leg, defended back towards the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: length, wide of off, goes hard on the cut but can't connect

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Arshdeep Singh to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: short ball, 132kph, ducked under

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full on off, driven towards long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: Comes down the track now, and drives this hard but there's a man at long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, stays back and cuts this to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: gets back and defends this off a length

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: gets a good stride in and defends this off a good length

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: pushed through on off, driven down the ground to the left of a diving Axar

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on the stumps, pushed back to Ashwin
length on off, gets forward and pushes this past point
back foot punch into the covers off a length for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: good length off break on the stumps, gets forward and defends
comes down the track, Ashwin seeing this bowls it a touch slower and wider. The batter manages to stretch and drive this down to long off
gets back to this length ball outside off and cuts it towards sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: pushed through short of a length on middle and leg, back foot punch into the covers

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
commentary: Powerful drive into the extra cover boundary! This was tossed up outside off, and Rashid gives it his all to beat the man in the deep.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Good length on off, goes for the pull and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: Quicker ball outside off, beaten on the attempted cut this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: good length on off, defensive push square on the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
commentary: Swept cleanly to deep backward square leg! Picks the length early and gets in position well, does Rashid.
short and wide, cut hard but there's a man at deep cover point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: length on off, back foot push to extra cover
flat on the stumps, gets down early and sweeps this towards deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: tossed up on middle and leg, whipped but straight to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on middle and leg, deceived by the wrong'un as he looks to work this onside
gets back and punches this into the vacant space in the covers for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: skips down the track and chips this towards long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: Almost beaten on the inside edge off this attempted drive, as this goes on with the arm. Catches the inside half of the bat to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, no run
commentary: short and wide, and cut but straight to backward point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Rashid Khan, 1 run
commentary: wide on off, cut again but this time towards deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length, driven back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Timing! Short outside off, Rashid rocks back and cuts this sweetly in front of square

And he strikes straight away! Sees Rashid coming down the track and drags this shorter, Rashid adjusts and looks to whip this to the square leg fence, but he can only manage to find the man at deep midwicket, who comes in to take an easy catch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hooda to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Fielded! Back foot punch down the ground and Hooda dives full length to his right to save the run.
strays on the pads, worked towards deep backward square leg
good length on the stumps, nudged square on the onside
Again on the pads, gets better contact this time down towards deep square leg
back of a length on the stumps, back foot punch down the ground

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: Back of a length on off, defended on the back foot
back of length outside off, keeps low and the batter gets a under edge on the back foot drive, down to third man
Length on off, watches this on to the bat, and guides it down to third man
Full on middle and leg, stays in the crease and works this down towards deep backward square leg
good length on off, dabbed down to third man
Full on off, driven square opening the face towards deep cover point
good length on middle and leg, reverse sweep over short third!
good length on off, defended towards short third
bit of sharp turn and bounce, beats the batter on the inside edge onto the thigh guard
length on off, pushed square on the off side
Launched over long-on! Down the ground, gets to the pitch and hits right through the line. There's a man on the boundary, but he has no chance
good length on off, opens the face and looks to guide this past first slip, who is equal to it and stops the run with a dive down to his right

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: back of a length on off, back foot punch towards extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, FOUR runs
commentary: Flat batted over mid-off! This was back of a length, and it's dispatched cleanly by Ibrahim.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Chahar to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: swing and a miss. Looks to cut this shorter one, but is beaten for pace.
Short arm jab straight back over the bowler. Doesn't time this though as long-on comes forward to collect.
short outside off, pulls this straight, down towards long-on
good length on off, driven between point and cover for one
slides down leg, wide given

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, stays in the crease and punches this to wide mid-off
full on the stumps, driven down to long off
quicker ball, 98kph, slides down leg
What a shot! Telegraphs this, and Ashwin slides it down leg, but Mujeeb goes for the reverse hit anyway and connects, into space over extra cover!
Carrom ball castles him! Comes down the track and yorks himself, ends up missing the on drive and gets his middle peg disturbed

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Fareed Ahmad, no run
commentary: around the wicket, defended on the stumps
good length, but slides too far down leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Ashwin to Fareed Ahmad, no run
commentary: good length on the pads, deflects up off the pad - looks like - and Pant dives forward to take the catch. Half-hearted appeal but there's no bat there.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 2 runs
commentary: short of a length on the stumps, back foot punch past extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: length on off, cut this time towards deep cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Fareed Ahmad, 1 run
commentary: length on the stumps, flicked towards square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Ibrahim Zadran, 1 run
commentary: full outside off, gets on one knee and drives this towards sweeper cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Fareed Ahmad, no run
commentary: short of a length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Axar Patel to Fareed Ahmad, no run
commentary: fuller on the stumps, big heave towards deep midwicket, doesn't time it as he would like though
short of a length on the stumps, pulled towards deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Karthik to Ibrahim Zadran, SIX runs
commentary: tossed up and hoicked over deep midwicket! That's the fifty for Ibrahim and the 100 up for Afghanistan!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Karthik to Ibrahim Zadran, SIX runs
commentary: Leans back and pulls this straight down the ground over long on!
tossed up again, again the batter goes back and big. This time it's not to the boundary but in between long on and deep midwicket
tossed up on off, driven high over cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Karthik to Ibrahim Zadran, no run
commentary: good length on off, driven hard to extra cover. And that's that! India secure their second-biggest T20I win, as they win by 101 runs.
carrom ball, down the wicket, not to its pitch, defended
gets width and shortness of length, but his punch goes straight to extra cover
looks to slog this over leg, but gets a bit of an inside edge for one. Lucky it doesn't carry to the fielder in the deep
offbreak, flicked to deep midwicket for one
inner half of the bat on the slog, gets a single to deep midwicket
leading edge as he looks to work this to leg, gets a single towards long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
commentary: down the wicket, Rashid pulls back the length, pushes this to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed straight of point for one
down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the ball, doesn't quite get the elevation, and gets a single to long-off
short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Rashid Khan to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: that is not easy. To hit Rashid for a six after giving him the charge. Rashid does shorten the length as he sees him coming, but he manages to send this over wide long-on for a six
worked past short fine, comes back for two. Kohli needs 32 in four overs for a hundred
short of a length, into the body, punched into the leg side for one
yorker, outside off, dug out towards long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Pant, FOUR runs
commentary: Mujeeb is too far in. Pant completely mistimes the hook of a slower bouncer, but Mujeeb is caught running back, and gets only a hand to it at fine leg
wide low full toss, drilled to long-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: lovely improvisation. Shuffles across the wicket and drags a low full toss wide of short fine leg for four. No. 71 is on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: he is racing towards it. His numbers are great at the death once he got his eye in. Walks down at him, flicks a length ball over square leg for four more
tries the wide yorker, but overcooks it
yorker, can't do much with it but take a single to long-on
slower short ball, walks at it, pulls this down, between deep midwicket and long-on, comes back for two

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: wide yorker. Perhaps just short of it. That's all Kohli needs to steer it past point for four. He is at his best when he has had his eye in by the time the death overs arrive
slower bouncer, pulled down, and straight of deep midwicket, comes back for two more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: it's all going Kohli's way. Walks at him again, Farooqi digs it in, Kohli looks to go over mid-off still, but gets a thick edge over short third
slower ball, on a length, punched down to long-off for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: wide length ball, and he has smashed it between long-off and long-on. Can't do anything wrong. That's his best in T20Is

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: there is No. 71. Who would have thought it would come in this format? Short of a length, lovely pull shot. Flat and over deep midwicket. Big smile on his face. Looks up at the skies. Kisses his wedding ring. The drought has ended
digs this out to extra cover, runs for one, gives it up because he can't make it, but there is no direct hit. He gets an overthrow too
full and wide, misses the yorker, lovely drive over extra cover, gets back for two
walks down, hits a full toss down the ground for one. Just got too close to it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fareed Ahmad to Pant, FOUR runs
commentary: another drop. Afghanistan having a shocker in the field. Slower bouncer, Pant gets a massive top edge, Mujeeb runs in from long leg, but it goes through his hands

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: now he is just showing off. This is vintage Kohli at the death. Dances down the track, gets under a slower length ball and sends it sailing over long-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, SIX runs
commentary: no-look six. Slower short ball, sits up to be hit, and he sends it smack over deep square. What fun Kohli is having

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, FOUR runs
commentary: What can Afghanistan do to stop him? He goes for the yorker on off, misses his length a little, and Kohli makes room to cover-drive this wide of extra cover and hard
slower ball, on the pads, he flicks this, but because of the lack of pace it goes towards deep square and not fine leg
yorker, outside off, drilled to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Kohli, no run
commentary: Kohli is looking for the wide, but he is down the track so this bouncer is allowed to stay
fullish ball on middle, and angling into leg stump. Worked to the leg side off his pads to the vacant square-leg region for a single

the slip cordon is in play! And pretty much the near-perfect start for Pakistan. The aggressive Kusal Mendis pokes at a short-ish ball that was seaming away from him. Played away from his body, takes the edge, and it floats into the hands of first slip.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: short of length on middle, keeping him on the back foot. Fended with soft hands to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 1 leg bye
commentary: short of a length on leg stump. Seaming down leg slightly. Tries to clip it off his hips, but hits his body. They scurry across for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Nissanka, no run
commentary: good length ball, fourth-stump line. Nissanka taps it from near his chest to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Nissanka, no run
commentary: just two off the over - what Pakistan would've wanted from the young Hasnain. Another length ball around off stump. Decent bounce, rising near his chest region. Fended to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: full ball, on off. Full face of the bat in his checked drive. To mid off

Rizwan snaps this up! And he's displayed some mega air time diving to his left and taking it from where first slip was. Rauf bowls a nothing delivery. Short and wide, and angling away. Gunathilaka tried to set the tone by hitting a cut square, but the extra bounce induces the edge, and if there was any doubts over Rizwan's mobility, those doubts are buried!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: defended away
two slips now. Length ball, a bit wide outside off. Poked away past point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Nissanka, no run
commentary: good length ball just outside off. Angling in slightly. Punched off the back foot past the bowler's left

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Nissanka, no run
commentary: rising delivery just outside off, and he punches it square, but can't beat point. Another winning over for Pakistan

drops a tricky chance! Bowler on his followthrough can't grab it by sticking his left hand out. Short-ish ball just outside off. Rising delivery and he tries to flay it straight past. But the extra bounce makes it hit the top half of the bat, and the ball goes back to Hasnain in a slow-mo manner. He can't grab it
worked off his hips to the leg side where Asif dives to ensure it is just a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: marginally fuller. Just outside off. Tries to play a drive, but the ball jags away off the deck. Past the outside edge.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: good length ball just outside off stump. Fended away from his body off the back foot. Extra bounce once more
fullish just outside off stump. Pushed towards cover while staying on the back foot

no boundaries yet in three overs as Hasnain produces another tidy over. Yorker that was nearly perfect, bowled at 147kph, aimed at the base of middle, but Nissanka is up to task. Dug away to the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: over the slip cordon! Not convincing, but four important runs while going at a small target. Full and slightly wide outside off. Swinging away. Throws his bat at this for the drive, and gets the edge that takes it over the slips

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, 1 leg bye
commentary: full ball on leg. Tries the flick. Hits his pad, rolls away to square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Dhananjaya, 1 leg bye
commentary: fullish ball on off but angling into leg. He tries to flick, misses, hits the pad. Appeal for lbw but not given, and they pinch a leg bye. Ball definitely going down leg. Impact, too, might've been outside leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: counter-attacking! Full ball swinging into his pads, and Nissanka offers a flourish of his wrists to hammer a flicked shot behind square for four.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: the incoming player into the XI is not having a good start as Nissanka deposits another four, this time in front of square on the leg side. Short-ish ball, but not having the bounce of the other two bowlers. Nissanka swivels and pulls along the ground through midwicket
fullish on off. Nurdled with soft hands to short cover and off they go for a single
fullish, just outside off. Flayed away from his body to backward point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: full ball just outside off. Bit of swing away. Driven well, but straight to mid off
short ball, bit wide outside off. Drags a pull, albeit mistimed, to deep midwicket. Hasnain puts in a diving effort to drag the ball back into play

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs
commentary: deposited! He couldn't in the previous delivery, but does it this time. Another short-ish ball just outside off, and DDS plays an exquisite dragged pull to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: stump to stump line. Fullish on off. Full face of the bat in his defensive shot back to Rauf

done in by the extra pace! Good length ball angling into middle stump and de Silva has to offer a shot before he expected it. Tries to punch it leg side but the ball hits the face of the bat and goes high up in the air for mid off to run in and take the catch. 147kph, de Silva was definitely surprised by how quickly it got to him

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: full ball on middle, and driven to mid on's right. Bit of swing into the batter.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: good length ball, just outside off. Well cut, but only to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: gets in position early! Short ball, on off, Nissanka pirouettes on his toes and pulls it to the region behind square on the leg side. Again rolling his wrists to ensure it goes over the square-leg umpire

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: good length ball just outside off. Pace off this time. Slapped to the packed off-side region

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: swiped across the line and gets this shot into the gap at deep midwicket. But Rauf runs towards the boundary line and parries the ball back in. However, he can't stop the inertia of the ball, and it keeps rolling towards the boundary. Rauf dives back into the field of play and tries to flick it in once more, but the umpire says that's four since the boundary skirting had moved after hitting Rauf, and if it hadn't, then the ball would've hit the line for sure.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: fullish on middle stump. Tapped towards the non-striker
full ball outside off, from over the stumps. Batter gets low, and plays a paddle past the keeper's right to fine leg
around the stumps to the right-hander. Full just outside off. Caresses a drive to long off

good length ball, just outside off but turning in. Bhanuka doesn't commit to a shot early, waits for it to get to him, and then plays a late dab past short third. Fielder runs to intercept the boundary

rotating the strike well in this over, these two. Full ball just outside off. Flays a drive behind square, although he tried to play it towards cover. Rauf at deep point delivers a flat throw at the top of the stumps at the batter's end, but Rajapaksa is in
another late dab to short third for a quick run
length ball on off. Punched to long on for a jogging single. Eight off the over with zero risk
full ball on off. Nice dip after offering some loop. Minimal turn away. Fended to the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: good length ball on off. Googly going away. Rajapaksa tries to cut and very nearly chops it onto his stumps!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: full ball on middle. Googly takes it across the batter. Pulls out of offering any shot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Rajapaksa, SIX runs
commentary: high-risk, high-reward! Tosses it up a bit more. Full, and a bit wide outside off. Rajapaksa gets low, down on one knee, and slogs it to deep midwicket for half a dozen. Clattered it even before we could see which direction the ball was turning.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: full ball on middle. Googly turns away slightly with Rajapaksa trying to poke at it. Whizzing past the edge but no impact. Caught behind appeal turned down
flatter. Length ball on middle and off. Cut to point, hurried into that shot
