Rajapaksa gets a life! Full ball on off and middle. Batter comes down the track to drive. Ball goes past the edge with the arm, and Rizzy can't grab it on his first attempt! Would've definitely been stumped out had Rizwan's grab been better
full ball on middle stump. Defended off the front foot
full on middle stump. Continuing around the stumps. Driven to mid on
full on off stump. Takes a step down and works it gently to the right of long on for a single
full ball on middle and off. Sticks the bat out after putting a stride in to defend. Tapped to the off side
full ball on off stump. Defended but with the bat's face slightly closed. Nudged to the leg side
full and wide outside off stump. Legbreak drive to wide long off for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Rajapaksa, SIX runs
commentary: easy, peasy, Japan-easy! Half-tracker on middle, and the googly turning away actually helps the batter free his arms the way he wants to. Pulls it as if he was hitting a medium-pacer, and this has gone into the second tier at wide long on
in the air but falls a few metres short of deep square leg. Tosses it up, ends up as a dipping full toss on leg. The sweep takes the edge but he survives
length ball on middle. The legbreak is worked off his back foot to midwicket with soft hands. The lack of pace off the bat allows them to take the second

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Nissanka, no run
commentary: length ball on off. Backs away and slaps a cut in front of square
works this length ball from near his hips behind square past short fine for a single. Drinks
good length, just outside off stump. Flicked off the back foot to deep midwicket
full on middle and off. Tapped with gentle hands to midwicket. Can't get the gap though
length ball on middle and leg. Comes down the ground and taps it to the leg side
fullish on off. Backs away and swipes across the line. To deep midwicket, where there is protection
full ball on middle. Goes deep in his crease and clips it off his pads to deep square leg
fullish on off. Backs away while playing a late cut. Gets it to the left of short third for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Nissanka, SIX runs
commentary: dances down the track! And smacks it over the fielder trying to take a catch at deep midwicket. Tosses it up, and since Nissanka charged him, it ends up being a full toss. Hammered!
Qadir gets away with this poor ball. Full toss, quite wide. Nissanka flat-bats it to long on, mistimed.

wickettttttttttt! And the wristspinner breaks the 51-run partnership. Tosses it up, just outside off. Rajapaksa tries the slog sweep against the googly, but he's only got the elevation. Deep midwicket runs in, keeps his eyes on the ball, and that's SL four down!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Nissanka, no run
commentary: top legspinner's ball! Full on middle. Just a bit of turn away. Nissanka gets forward to fend, but the ball goes past the edge, and just over off stump! Nissanka falls over after being bamboozled, and Rizwan takes the bails off. Is he stumped? They want to check..... Nissanka is safe.
good length ball on off. Bit of turn away. Flicked to square leg, where nobody is there. Fielder in the deep has to run in, and that allows them to pinch a second run.

tosses it up, quite wide outside off. Ends up as a wide full toss that is clobbered past the non-striker. Four written all over it, but long on - Fakhar - makes good ground running to his left to slide and stop
good length ball on middle. Skidding into leg. Wants to clip it leg side but a leading edge takes it to short cover instead
full on middle. Driven with hard hands to wide long on for a single
full ball on middle. Gets low and fends it towards cover point
moves to 49 with that single. Fullish on off. Moves to the off side and plays a mistimed flick to mid on
full on off stump. Firmly driven along the carpet to long off
Nawaz bowls out and finishes his spell conceding only 21. Fullish on off. Bit of extra bounce with Nissanka trying to get forward to meet it. Hits him, rolls away to short third
full ball on off stump. Moves across to the off side to sweep. Hits him on his arm, and rolls away to the leg side. One run. LBW appeal turned down, because impact is probably outside off.
a confident fifty by flat-batting this length ball down to wide long on for a single. Has held the innings together despite the three early blows in the powerplay. #Back2Back50s

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Shanaka, no run
commentary: fullish on off stump. Mistimed drive to mid on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Shanaka, no run
commentary: top legspinner's ball as this full ball on middle and off turns away from him, past his bat's edge as he tries to defend
full ball on middle stump. Worked off his toes square on the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Nissanka, (no ball) 1 run
commentary: full just outside off. Driven to long off. Is that the end of the over? No! Overstepped

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Usman Qadir to Shanaka, no run
commentary: full ball on off. Mistimed back to Qadir
starts off with an attempted yorker. On middle stump. Clipped off his toes to fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Shanaka, no run
commentary: full ball just outside off stump. Smacks a drive to cover. Crowd thinks it is a catch but the roar dies down rather swiftly.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Shanaka, no run
commentary: good length ball just outside off. Nissanka sticks the bat out to reach at it, but it goes past the edge. Wobbly delivery, especially after hitting the deck

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Shanaka, FOUR runs
commentary: full on off. Nissanka moves across to the off side slightly and plays across the line too. The swipe has enough bat to beat the fine-leg fielder!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Shanaka, SIX runs
commentary: yorker doesn't come off, and Shanaka gets a big one! Full ball on off stump. Pretty much #InTheSlot for Shanaka, and he clobbers a six over wide long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Shanaka, no run
commentary: good length ball outside off stump. Tries to swing across the line. Misses.
length ball on off. Nissanka backs away and mows a flat-batted shot to Fakhar at long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Shanaka, no run
commentary: back of a length, outside off stump. Tries the ramp eyeing third-man region, but misses. To the keeper. Rizwan appeals for caught behind but not given. However, Pakistan have nothing to lose, and since Rizwan is quite excited, Babar goes up for a review. However, false alarm. Umpire Anil got it spot on and the review has been wasted.
full on off stup. Slower ball this time. Pushed to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: fullish ball on off stump. Punched back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasan Ali to Nissanka, no run
commentary: yorker length on middle and leg. Dug away to cover
fullish ball on off. Swings across the line and gets it to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Shanaka, SIX runs
commentary: short ball on middle and leg. Looks to pull it behind square, but it is top edged behind Rizwan for six! Hasnain's pace causing his downfall on this occasion.

slower ball does the trick and once again two Pakistan fielders nearly collide while taking a catch. Takes the pace off, full ball just outside off. Shanaka looks to tee off over Hasnain's head, but can only sky this shot. Hasan and Iftikhar are both running in from long on and long off to take the catch, and neither are looking at the other. They both take a tumble, but we see that Hasan has the ball safely in his grasp.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Nissanka, 1 leg bye
commentary: full ball on leg stump. Misses the flick down the leg side. Hits his pad and rolls away to the leg side for a single. LBW appeal turned down

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: target under five! And insult to injury is that it is a dropped catch that goes for four. Short ball on off. Hasaranga backs away to flay a cut behind square. Flies off the bat's face, and Nawaz at deep third gets low to take a catch, but he drops it and the ball dribbles away.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, 2 runs
commentary: full ball on middle stump. Backs away and clubs a drive to deep extra cover for two more

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: Sri Lanka make it four wins in a row and this is as convincing as it gets before the Asia Cup final. Fullish on off. Backs away and guides a late-ish cut behind square for a boundary. Sri Lanka win by five wickets, and surely they are favourites when the two teams meet in the final in roughly 36 hours!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Zaman, 1 run
commentary: wrong'un, Fakhar goes deep into the crease and opens the face for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: wrong'un again, good in-between length, defended to short cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: pushes at a flighted delivery, Hasaranga dives to his right to deny them a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: low full toss, hit towards long-on, but the timing is so bad short midwicket comes around and keeps them to a dot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: quick length ball, Babar wants a single down the ground, but can't beat Hasaranga

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: cuts this one way for one. Hasaranga closes out the over well

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: starts off with the offcutter, again just the single to leg

Fakhar seems to have picked out the biggest part of the ground. This is on-pace, Fakhar stays leg side of it and upper-cuts it. Seems like a decent hit, and perhaps would have been six from the other end. Here he finds deep this, Hasaranga, who times his leap to perfection

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
slower legcutter, short of a length, runs it past point for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: slower offcutter, punches this down to long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: superb delivery. Extra bounce from just short of a length, beats his attempt to play it into the off side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: flighted legbreak, pushed to short cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, 1 run
commentary: shuffles across, drives a half-volley to deep cover for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: wrong'un, he goes back to punch this down to wide long-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Babar Azam, OUT
commentary: first sign of intent in the last half an hour, and he is bowled. Babar sees the legbreak all right, goes down the track, swings across the line, but the ball just goes straight on to get him bowled

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Khushdil, 5 wide
commentary: down on a knee early for the paddle sweep, Hasaranga fires it down leg, and concedes five wides

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Khushdil, 1 run
commentary: nicer dip on this, really full, pushed to long-on for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: short of a length, just outside off, played back to the bowler
low full toss, into the leg side, pushed to deep midwicket
looks to turn this to leg, gets a leading edge towards short cover
pushed between deep midwicket and long-on, but Hasaranga is really quick and denies them the second
offbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
stays back for this length ball, but ends up playing it back to him
offbreak, goes back to punches it to long-off
carrom ball, middle and leg, looks to paddle it, fails to connect
flatter, a bit of a bottom edge on the pull for a single to deep midwicket
this one keeps coming in, and he is beaten on the inside edge and hit on the pad
short of a length, slight turn away, pushed to short straight midwicket
looks for the reverse sweep, Theekshana keeps attacking the stumps, gets extra bounce too, concedes just one leg-bye
lovely carrom ball. Tries the slog sweep, and is beaten on the outside edge
leading edge when looking to work it to leg. Gets a single, though
full outside off, hit hard, but straight to long-off
another show of intent, and another wicket. Skips down the wicket, but not quite to its pitch, and the ball turns too. Gets the toe end and skies it to long-on
looks to cut this flat delivery, can't get it past point
nice dip on this, middle and leg, only the single to deep midwicket
again doesn't give him the length, just the single to long-off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Nawaz, no run
commentary: down for the sweep early, Hasaranga pulls the length bak, straight to short fine leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Nawaz, 1 run
commentary: on a length, outside off, opens the face for a single past point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: stays back to this length-ball legbreak, straight to cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, SIX runs
commentary: nails this. Slog-sweeps, and gets just the right length. Huge six. Finally some timing on a difficult pitch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, OUT
commentary: Hasaranga strikes right back. He shortens the length this time, Iftikhar still tries the slog-sweep, and might have connected still, but the ball stays low and deflects off his pad onto the wicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Asif Ali, OUT
commentary: Hasaranga would have been on a hat-trick had this not been the last ball of his spell. Asif is a touch unlucky. He has picked the wrong'un, looks to play Hasaranga out, but the ball doesn't turn as much and beats his outside edge to hit the off stumps
offbreak, on off, defended back to him
carrom ball, wide outside off, beats him on the sweep
short of a length, wide, offbreak, toe-ends the cut but places it straight of deep cover
short of a length, goes back to punch it to deep cover
wrong'un. Starts around leg and goes for a wide down leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Theekshana to Hasan Ali, no run
commentary: plays the reverse sweep now, but straight to point
No. 7. Hasan shuffles across to try the big sweep, but is nowhere near the pitch, gets a massive top edge to be caught at deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Usman Qadir, no run
commentary: on a length, on off, no room defended back to him
nearly run out. Pushed just to the right of short midwicket, and he is gone if Rajapaksa hits. But Rajapaksa misses. He is quick to get to it, though
dug in short, low bounce, bottom-edged on the pull for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Usman Qadir, no run
commentary: bouncer, middle and leg, Qadir ducks under it
yorker, on leg, dug out for one to mid-on
lovely shot. Picks the slower ball, clears the front leg, and also clears mid-off who is inside the circle
on a length, angling in, pushed down to long-on for one
superb shot. Wide offbreak, and he plays an inside-out drive over extra cover. Flat six
short of a length, cut away, but straight to point
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
Qadir tries the big slog sweep here but this is an offbreak that turns away from him outside off, and he gets a massive top edge to deep midwicket
looks to work to leg for a singer to keep strike but is cramped
on a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
on a length, into the pads, there to be hit, but misses it and is hit on the pad. It is a no-ball
smart bowling. Dug in and wide outside off, away from Nawaz's reach. Good comeback
he backs away, Madushanka follows him with a yorker, but Nawaz has managed to put it in a hole deep on the leg side
this is right in the slot, he clears the front leg and drives this clean over long-off. Nawaz is giving himself something to bowl at
goes back and across, pulls this to deep midwicket, and risks a second. Nawaz dives in, but he falls short. Lovely throw on the top of the stumps

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Mohammad Hasnain, no run
commentary: yorker, he digs it out, back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Haris Rauf, OUT
commentary: and he ends up with two. Bowls a wide slower ball, back of the hand, Rauf doesn't have too many options. He just goes hard at it, and finds long-on to perfection
starts with a no-ball, and Pakistan have a free hit
this one's too high, and it's called wide
this one's wide down legside, and there's no getting away from the free hit, which carries over to the next ball
oh, this goes from bad to worse for Sri Lanka. This one's well down legside and it races away for five wides. And the free hit is still to come
goes down legside again. This is another wide. And the free hit is still to follow
finally, we have the first legitimate ball. It's swiped towards the onside and Rizwan gets a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: loose shot, with the ball moving away from off stump. Babar hangs his bat out and misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Madushanka to Babar Azam, no run
commentary: angling in and struck Babar on the pads. Half-hearted appeal for lbw, but it was tailing down
angles the bat towards third man and runs it there to get off the mark
leans into a cover drive, but sharp fielding means there's no run on offer
driven to mid-on, and Pakistan took on the fielder, who doesn't collect cleanly. Not the worst over given the start, but even so, 12 off it
slides this one through, and it's defended to midwicket
dragged down legside
tailing into the right hander, who steers it into the onside
this held its line, and Rizwan defends
slashed through the offside without timing it. Good over so far
gets down on one knee and pulls it towards midwicket for a single
nurdled into the onside and calls two immediately. Rizwan needed an almighty dive to get there, but that's what he excels at
wide yorker at 142kph. He tried to crunch it through the offside but played down the wrong line
silky drive back past the bowler. Leant into it, using the bowler's pace to caress it back down the ground
plays outside the line off the ball, and ends up beaten. Went searching for that one outside off
prodded into the offside into the field
classy looking drive, but it's placed directly where mid-off is stationed
another sensational drive to cover, but the fielder puts in a great dive and ensures no runs are possible. Pakistan 10 off the first ball, and a further ten off the next 2.5

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Babar Azam, 2 runs
commentary: clipped over midwicket, not by much, mind, but he gets away with it and Pakistan get a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Babar Azam, OUT
commentary: poor ball, but poorer shot, and a fantastic catch at short fine! Babar Azam's wretched Asia Cup comes to an end with a shot that encapsulates his tournament. It was tailing down leg, and Babar looked to help it towards the fine leg boundary, but directed it straight at fine leg, who jumped to hang on to a good catch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Zaman, OUT
commentary: two in two, and Fakhar's on his way! He's dragged on to his stumps, and there's bedlam in the Sri Lankan supporters' contingent. Madushanka has two in two, while the look on Fakhar's face reflects Pakistan's feelings. Sri Lanka on top, and how!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: guides it into the midwicket region to get off the mark

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, no run
commentary: prodded towards midwicket, and the pressure continues to build. Sri Lanka are surging right now

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: hits him high on the bat, but get gets it to mid-on to keep the strike anyway
short ball on the body. Rizwan pulls it aerially through midwicket for a couple. Didn't get all of it, mind
no timing on the drive. Gets the inner half of the bat to mid-off
play and a miss - or is it a miss? Shanaka ponders reviewing, and decides against, though I heard a sound
doesn't quite get on top of the short ball that he muscles into the onside
hit low on the blade and it's defended to mid-off
punched through cover-point and this one pierces the cover region and races away for four. Beautifully carved away

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: length ball, defended to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, 2 runs
commentary: mistimed slightly, the pick-up shot through the onside. But it lands in a gap and they come back for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: slapped towards mid-off, where a brilliant bit of fielding with an outstretched right hand saves a certain four runs

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: yorkerm dug out towards long-on for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: slower bouncer, steered towards midwicket for another single. Sri Lanka strangling fairly effectively through this Powerplay

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: leading edge through the offside, where a little misfield allows him to keep the strike. Sri Lanka all over Pakistan in that Powerplay

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: bowls a wrong'un that's defended into the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, FOUR runs
commentary: slapped over cover, and this one's in the gap in the offside. A much needed boundary from Iftikhar

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: defended back to the bowler

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: steered into a vacant cover region as the pair exchange ends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: miscued a sweep towards short fine leg, but SL briefly thought he'd got pad on it. The umpire didn't

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: gives this plenty of flight, and it's eased towards the offside

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rizwan, FOUR runs
commentary: slower delivery to start, but he saw it coming,and pulled it to square leg for a boundary
slower delivery again, guided into the offside and they scurry through for a quick single
short ball, he had to pick it up from well over his head to guide it through the onside for a single
slightly back of a length. It's nudged into the onside towards long-on. Rizwan briefly believed two was on, but Sri Lanka made sure that was never an option
takes the pace off again, and it's eased into the onside for a single. Sreshth will take you through to the end, so here he goes!
good length on off from Theekshana. Punched off the back foot to long on
good length ball just outside off. Rizwan hangs on the back foot and pokes at the ball very late, getting a late dab past short third for a boundary!
full outside off. Gets low, stretches out, and drives to deep point
good length on off. Swiped off the back foot, off his waist, to deep square leg

good length ball on middle. Gets onto the back foot and clips it to deep midwicket. They have to hurry for the second since Hasaranga has a strong arm, but the batters are safe because the bowler can't collect cleanly.
full ball on middle. Drifting into his pads. Worked to deep midwicket for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: full and wide outside off. Googly swept to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: fullish on off. Googly turning into middle. Worked off his pads to midwicket with soft hands

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: appeal for lbw off this googly. Full ball outside off and turning in with the batter looking to defend off the front foot. Hits the front leg and the ball rolls away to short third. Shanaka reviews this not-out decision. Prima facie looks like impact is probably outside off stump. But first, UltraEdge since the ball is close to the bat's inside edge. UltraEdge taking time to load....giving Rizwan enough time to take a breather. He's been scurrying between the wickets all innings, and Dubai is warm. Been over two minutes, still waiting for the UltraEdge. And Ultra_edge says the ball hit the bat! We won't need to ball-tracking at all. Sri Lanka lose a review.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: full ball on off. Legbreak this time. Pushed to cover with soft hands

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: full on off. Swept to deep backward square leg for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: full outside off. Googly pushed to cover. Pakistan need 103 off 10 overs with the drinks break now taken

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rizwan, no run
commentary: good length ball just outside off. Angling into off. Fended back to the bowler
full just outside off. Flourishing drive to wide long on for a single
slower ball, full on middle stump. Pushed to deep midwicket
back of a length just outside off. Doesn't bounce as much as Rizwan expected it. Jabbed down to deep third
short ball angling into his helmet. Pulled along the carpet to deep midwicket
back of the hand slower ball. Full just outside leg. Worked with soft hands into the big gap at midwicket, and with the outfielders running in, there is enough time to take the second

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, no run
commentary: full on off. Googly defended to cover. Compact shot

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, SIX runs
commentary: out of syllabus! Iftikhar seemed to be the accumulator for so long, but he he has now taken on Sri Lanka's trump card. Full outside off, and the googly ends up coming in his arc. Swings across the line and the slog sweep is deposited at deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, FOUR runs
commentary: one-bounce four! Full on off. Iftikhar clears the front leg and hits an inside-out lofted shot over Hasaranga's head. Long off running to his right to cut it off, but alas for Sri Lanka, he can't get there!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 2 runs
commentary: flatter. Good length outside off. Tries the cut, gets a thick edge. Ball racing away to the deep third boundary but the infielder runs to intercept

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Iftikhar, 1 run
commentary: ball stays low! Full outside off. Sliding through and also not bouncing much. Worked to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: full outside off. Gets outside off and sweeps to deep backward square leg. 14 off the over
good length just outside off. Gets back deep in his crease and swipes across the line to deep midwicket
yorker length, just outside off stump. Dug out towards cover point
full on off stump. Drifting into his pads. Tucked off his toes to deep midwicket
quicker one. Fullish just outside off. Sticks the bat low to ensure the low bounce doesn't dismiss him. Takes the outside edge and rolls away to backward point
full on off. Full face of the bat in his front-foot block
short and wide. Tries to cut but misses. Keeper fluffs it too, but doesn't seem to be any edge, or was there? We'll never quite find out. A tidy over from Theekshana.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Worked off his pads to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, 1 wide
commentary: back of a length on middle and leg. Loopy bouncer going down the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Iftikhar, OUT
commentary: mowed into the night sky! However, it doesn't have the legs for six. A 127kph delivery, full on off. Iftikhar clears the front leg and tries to hammer it for half a dozen, but he's sliced the shot. Fielder at deep backward square leg got under it, then waited nervously for the ball to come down, and then took a catch before taking a tumble onto the ground. Third scalp for Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: length ball on middle stump, and worked off his waist to midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Nawaz, 1 run
commentary: full just outside off. Smears a drive through the covers but there's someone at the deep

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Rizwan, 1 run
commentary: full on middle, and he flicks it well behind square. But that region is protected on the leg side

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Nawaz, 1 run
commentary: good length on middle. Punchy shot standing tall to deep extra cover

around the stumps. Full outside off. Flayed over the bowler's head, and has four written all over it, but long off dives to his left and sticks one hand out to stop the four! Gunathilaka the fielder putting in the hard yards.
tosses it up, ends up as a knee-high full toss outside off. Slapped to deep backward point for a couple more. Team hundred
flat delivery. Length ball on off and angling into leg. Misses the flick, hits his pad
another dot! Yorker length, at the base of off. Dug back to DDS
hat-trick of dots! Full on leg. Nawaz clears the front leg to slog into the leg side. Misses, past his edge, past leg stump too!

fourth dot in a row, and very nearly a wicket too! Slower through the air. Length ball on off, and gets a bit late to Nawaz as he tries to punch off the back foot. Hits the top-half of the bat, and the ball pops back for DDS to perhaps take a catch, but the ball falls just in front! #Tantalising
takes pace off. Length ball on off. Pulled to deep square leg

short ball, on leg stump. Nawaz tries to pull but the ball gets somewhat big on him. Nonetheless, he's got some connection, but clearly not good enough! Gobbled up by deep backward square well inside the boundary line.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Khushdil, no run
commentary: good length ball on off and angling slightly away from Shah. Tries to poke at it, but past the outside edge.
short ball, aimed at his helmet in front of middle stump. Pulled to deep midwicket

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Rizwan, SIX runs
commentary: Rizzy unshackled? Just what Pakistan needed, and Rizwan gets to fifty too in style. Full ball, bit wide outside off. Steps onto the off side and slog sweeps into the stands behind cow corner
slower ball again, just outside off. Rizwan comes down the ground to create some momentum but ends up toe-ending his attempted drive to square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Rizwan, OUT
commentary: key player gets key player! Rizwan had no choice at this point except to go for a big shot when he could've. Hasaranga tossed this up outside off and Rizwan attempted the slog sweep, but he couldn't hit it well enough to clear the fielder at deep midwicket.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Khushdil, 1 run
commentary: full ball on middle. Skidding through. Fended off the back foot towards cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Asif Ali, OUT
commentary: King Hasaranga! Takes out Pakistan's finisher with googly that crashes into middle stump. Second game in a row where Hasaranga has dismissed Asif for a duck. Full ball tossed up on off. In Asif's area for him to try the slog sweep, but the bat is nowhere near the ball. Hasaranga took his chance by tossing this one up against a new batter, and has earned his reward for his bravery.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Shadab, 1 run
commentary: one slip for Shadab. Full on off. Googly pushed to wide long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Khushdil, OUT
commentary: Hasaranga has the midas touch! Full ball on middle stump. Googly going away from Khushdil and he tries to slog against the spin. Sliced high up, short third man gets under it, and that's a third scalp in the over for #WOWindu

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Hasaranga de Silva to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: fullish, a bit too wide outside off. Googly turning in. Nudged to point. Hasranga finishes with a potentially POTM performance. Don't forget his batting cameo either.
full outside off. Swings across the line but takes the outside edge and flies past the keeper's right.
yorker length almost. Lands in front of off stump. Dug out, back to the bowler
overpitched on off. Mistimed past the bowler to long off
overpitched quite wide outside off. Trying to keep it out of the batters' arc. Ends up as a low full toss. Slapped to long on

full ball on middle. Down on one knee and swiped to deep backward square leg. Could've been run out at the non-striker's, but the bowler Theekshana cannot collect the ball cleanly. Otherwise, Rauf was gone. Nonetheless, the umpires are going upstairs to see what happened. Yes, confirmed, Rauf survives because of the bowler's error.

Theekshana finishes his spell with a wicket and this is Shadab. Full and wide, Shadab tries to club a six over extra cover but he's sliced it. Gunathilaka runs in, grabs the catch, and slides to reduce his momentum

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Naseem Shah, 1 wide
commentary: overpitched, pitching outside leg stump. Wide given

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Naseem Shah, FOUR runs
commentary: full ball just outside off. Naseem loses his shape as he tries to hit it over cover. But takes an outside edge and flies over short third man

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Naseem Shah, OUT
commentary: slower ball just outside off. Naseem looks for a big shot over long off, but can't get his bat under the ball well enough. Toe-ended shot, and flat to long off for some catching practice. Fourth wicket for Madushan!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Mohammad Hasnain, no run
commentary: slower ball again. Full and a bit wide outside off. Misses the attempted cut

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Mohammad Hasnain, 1 run
commentary: full ball on off. Slapped down the ground to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Haris Rauf, (no ball) FOUR runs
commentary: is that the trophy! Noooo! Just short of the diving de Silva at wide long off running in to try and take a catch. Full ball on off and he chipped it off his toes, and it's gone for four thereafter. No ball too!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Haris Rauf, 1 wide
commentary: back of a length, a bit wide outside off. Wide given.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Haris Rauf, 1 run
commentary: full ball on off stump. Drilled to long off, but just for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Pramod Madushan Liyanagamage to Mohammad Hasnain, SIX runs
commentary: 32 needed off the final over! Hasnain gets a maximum to end this innings. Slower ball on middle, and clubbed over deep midwicket! Nearly hit the sponsor's car there. Madushan finishes on 4/34

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: back of a length just outside off. Swivels to pull but misses.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Haris Rauf, 1 run
commentary: in the bag for Sri Lanka you'd have to think with that ball. Full and wide outside off. Drags a sloggy shot to wide long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Mohammad Hasnain, 1 run
commentary: slower ball, full on off. Drilled to long on for a jogging single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Haris Rauf, no run
commentary: back of a length outside off stump. Tries to pull, but misses. On the bounce to keeper

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Haris Rauf, SIX runs
commentary: slower ball again. In the slot just outside off, and hammered over the long-off fielder!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: C Karunaratne to Haris Rauf, OUT
commentary: Sri Lanka win their sixth Asia Cup trophy! Just one behind India's tally of seven. And that too with a wicket to seal it. Yorker on middle. Rauf misses, CK hits, the Sri Lanka squad runs into the ground and the players are celebrating already!
sends the first one well down legside, and Rizwan's diving already

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nissanka, no run
commentary: angling in, nudged into the onside
more prodigious inswing, and it takes a thick inside edge down to fine leg. First runs off the bat for Sri Lanka

what an absolute belter of a delivery that is. My goodness, that is filthy. Tailing in at 142 kph, seaming in, clips the pads and uproots off stump. Enthralling start from Pakistan, and Mendis is gone for a golden duck

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: starts it a bit too far wide outside off, allowing de Silva to leave without apprehension

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: back of a length, defended back to the bowler
clipped into a vacant midwicket region from de Silva, and Hasnain cuts it off for a couple

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Nissanka, no run
commentary: length ball, nipping away at 142 kph, Nissanka defends
has a little prod at it as it shapes away. He's grinding through the gears now, at 144kph this time

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs
commentary: this one's in the slot, even if it is at 145kph. But it's a half-volley outside off, and de Silva just leans into a glorious cover drive that brings Sri Lanka's first boundary

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: short and slightly wide. de Silva a little annoyed he couldn't middle that cut shot away past point
clips the pad, but the umpire calls it wide. Think that's a poor decision

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs
commentary: this one's creamed over cover, de Silva at his majestic best. Hasnain's not found his line yet, it's another full-ish half-volley, and it's an area de Silva is so comfortable in
clipped towards fine leg and they come back for a couple. Excellent over for Sri Lanka

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nissanka, no run
commentary: generous sideways movement, and that one kept low, too, as it whizzed past the outside edge and towards Rizwan on the bounce

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nissanka, no run
commentary: rapped on the pads, huge appeal from Pakistan. It looked as if the batter came across, so it might be clipping leg stump. But Rizwan said it might be going down. On replay, to be fair, it does seem that way

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Nissanka, FOUR runs
commentary: and Naseem lands it on the length Hasnain did the previous over, and Nissanka shows he's just as prolific at putting those kinds of balls away through cover
a little dab into the ground, and it nearly dragged onto the stumps. They scuttle through for one, while Rizwan dives as he throws it at the stumps in an effort to inflict a run-out
opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
a finer outsdie edge this time, and third man has to move across to his left to keep it to one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Nissanka, no run
commentary: length delivery, defended down the ground

tried to swpie it back down the ground, but it ends up flying up towards mid-off, where Babar Azam takes a good catch running backwards. Miscued the shot, getting it out of the outer half of the bat, which meant it never got the distance on it he intended

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: half-volley length shaping away. Batter was lured into the drive again, but it's tailing away too much for him to get anything on it

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, no run
commentary: length delivery outside off at 150kph, defended to cover-point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs
commentary: glorious shot. A bit of a split-step as he stepped across and manoeuvred it past cover-point. The timing was sensational, and with the ball over 150kph, it flew to the boundary
defended into the onside to round off the over
landed just short of a length and grew big on him as he fended it away to mid-on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, 1 leg bye
commentary: back of a length on leg stump, clipped towards the onside off the pads

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs
commentary: absolutely regal. Back of a length, scooped over extra cover for four, with the purity of the timing seeing it race away
clipped into the onside as the pair exchange ends

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Gunathilaka, no run
commentary: opens the face and tried to run it past backward point
punched towards cover, and a bit of sloppiness with the throw allows an overthrow

but as soon as we say that, Haris Rauf knocks back middle and off stump to send Gunathilaka packing. 151 kph, that ball, and Haris reels away in celebration. Pakistan have struck another vital blow to Sri Lanka within the Powerplay

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs
commentary: thick outside edge, and because the ball was bowled at 153 kph, it races away to third man for four

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: lovely delivery, seaming back in at near-yorker length. He did well to dig it out towards point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: angling back into the stumps, Haris is troubling the left handers big-time this over. Enthralling bowling

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: It's hit him on the toes. Might have struck him outside leg stump, and Pakistan review. Wow, that is the closest not-out I've seen in ages. It pitched in line, hit him in line, but was deemed to be swinging away and it's umpire's call on impact. Rajapaksa survives by the skin of his teeth
this one's moving away. Full yorker on fifth stump, angled down to third man for a single
starts with a wrong'un, and it's cut away to deep cover
little dab into the onside and the pair exchange ends
another googly. Steps bacl and chips it over cover for a single
eased towards long-off for a single
a touch short, and another googly, carved to backward point
slapped down to long-on for a single
a half-tracker, pulled to deep midwicket
opens the face of the bat and runs it past short third, just using the pace of the bowler
nudged to short third for a single

another wicket! This was a rare ugly shot from de Silva, who opened up his body and tried to slap it over the bowler's head. But he never found the elevation, and Iftikhar takes a splendid reflex catch to send de Silva packing
clipped to midwicket, where Shadab misfields and allows a single
another little drop and run, and Iftikhar's bowled an extremely valuable over for his captain here
a flatter wrong'un that skidded through. Nudged to short third and the pair exchange ends
low full toss. He leans forward and sweeps it to square leg for a single
clipped on the pads as he looked to sweep it. But it landed outside leg stump
fuller, and flighted. Guided to long-off
ahhh that's another really poor shot. Tried to sweep it across the line, and the ball was much too full to be pulled. Ends up missing it by a long, long way and it cleans him up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: Wrong-un that was honing in on the top of middle. Opens the face and guides it past Naseem Shah at short third, and it goes all the way for four
nurdled to short third for another quick single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: eased down the ground for a single to long-on
sliced to deep point for a couple. That was played through the air, and he wasn't in full control, but it was in a vacant region
much quicker. Full ball that has skidded through and it was nearly scooped back to the bowler's right for a prospective catch
drop and run from the batter. Tapped towards point, and they scurry across for one

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: farcical running. Hasaranga was halfway down the pitch trying to take a single to mid-on, but heads back. That's the halfway mark, and I'll hand over to Sreshth for the rest of this innings
full ball on middle. Googly turns across the bat as Rajapaksa steps forward to fend. Whizzes past the outside edge.
this guy will never stop attacking! Moves a bit to the leg side as soon as Shadab delivers this full ball on middle. Drives with the turn, hitting the googly over extra cover
full ball on middle. Tries the drive but the legbreak hits the bat's inside half. Rolls away to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: flatter delivery. Length on off and turning away. Hasaranga backs away before flaying a cut behind square, and he's struck this past the fielder in the deep!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: fullish on off. Googly is punched past the non-striker. Shadab runs to his right to try and stop it
ten off the over, just what SL needed after that drinks break. This was a fullish ball outside off and turning away. Batter tried to cut but missed out

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: full ball on middle. Darted in. Nudged off his pads to midwicket. But hit too hard for them to consider a second run
around the stumps. Full on middle and leg. Gets down on one knee to play the slog sweep. Inside edged onto his body
full on off and angling into middle. Skips down the ground and drives to long off

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Iftikhar to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: full ball on middle. Hasaranga clears the front leg and tries the slog across the line. Hits it straighter than he wanted. To wide long on
around the stumps again, and Rajapaksa sticks his bat out to this length ball outside off to successfully hit a late cut past short third man for another four!
good length ball. Wide outside off and turning away. Cut to deep extra cover
short ball on leg stump. Aimed at his body. Hits him near his shoulder and rolls away to deep third. #WellDirected

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: yorker attempted. Almost perfect at the base of off stump. Backs away, sticks the bat out, and guides a shot to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: low full toss on middle stump. Attempts the drive, comes off the bat's sweet spot and the ball races along the carpet to deep extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, 2 runs
commentary: slapped over cover but Zaman in the deep takes a tumble and stops the four. Fullish ball on middle and Hasaranga backed away to free his arms

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, SIX runs
commentary: back to bowling short. But doesn't have the line. Short and wide. Hasaranga backs away and uses Hasnain's pace to flay a cut behind square. Flies over deep third!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: full ball just outside leg. Wants to fend it to the on-side but hits the bat's outside half and rolls away to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 run
commentary: tossed up outside leg. Hasaranga comes down the track and plays an inside out drive to wide long off. Team hundred
up and over! Tosses it up on leg. Rajapaksa comes down the track and hammers it back over Shadab's grasp. #StraightAsAnArrow

length ball on leg. The googly is turning towards off. Rajapaksa nurdles it behind square on the off side and off they go for a single. Hasaranga dives at the batter's end trying to complete the run, and is safe despite a good throw at the top of the stumps

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: flatter. Length ball on off and turning away. Cut to point, but can't beat the fielder

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: fullish just outside off. Cut with the turn, but a tad close to his body. Stopped at point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Shadab to Hasaranga de Silva, 1 leg bye
commentary: Shadab finishes with 1 for 28 and Hasaranga will keep strike. Quicker ball on leg and the googly takes it further down leg. But he essentially ends up following Wanindu, who had moved to the leg side to make some room. Hits him on the pad and the ball rolls away to short cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hasaranga de Silva, no run
commentary: back of a length on off and angling into leg. Aimed at Hasaranga's body despite him backing away. Cut uncomfortably to point

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hasaranga de Silva, 2 runs
commentary: slapped in front of cover, but there's protection in the deep. Another short ball angling into Hasaranga, but he somewhat expected that line so was better prepared to play the shot. Fifty partnership in just 33 balls

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: thumped over the bowler's head! Length ball on off, 126kph, and Hasaranga picks the change of pace quickly. Backs away slightly and then flat-bats this hammered shot straight over

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hasaranga de Silva, FOUR runs
commentary: two in two! And this one flies juuuuust over the diving point fielder who could've taken a catch! Low full toss on middle. Hasaranga backs away and then opens the bat's face, ending up flaying a shot behind square on the off side.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to Hasaranga de Silva, OUT
commentary: Rauf has the last laugh! Overpitched ball just outside off. Hasaranga backs away to play a square drive, but the ball moves away slightly, takes the outside edge of the bat, and Rizwan gobbles it up! A sigh of relief for Pakistan with Hasaranga showing off his wares

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: Full on off stump, 149kph. Gently drive to wide long on

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: around the stumps. Full on middle. Goes down for the paddle sweep. Finds short fine leg though

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: another dot. Full on off. Big stride forward to defend
finally gets the left-hander on strike. Full toss on off, and caressed to long off
continuing around the stumps. Full on middle, and clattered past the diving bowler to long off, where Shadab cleans it up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Nawaz to C Karunaratne, no run
commentary: full on off. Presses forward and fends it back to Nawaz
full ball on off stump. Push-and-run to cover's right. Just three off Nawaz's first

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to C Karunaratne, 1 leg bye
commentary: good length ball on middle, and hitting the batter near the gut in front of leg stump. Extra bounce forces the error from Karunaratne, but they manage to pinch a legbye

short ball, slower delivery. Lands on a leg-stump line and cutter takes the ball over middle stump. Batter tried to play a ramp, but misses. Hits Rizwan near his face because of the awkward bounce, but he's alright.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: good length ball angling into middle. Turned off his hips to square leg for a single

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rajapaksa, SIX runs
commentary: breaks his wrists and deposits a six over deep backward square leg! Fullish on leg. And he plays the shot behind square with an awesome pick-up shot off his pads. Picked the slower ball well too
full outside leg. Rajapaksa makes room offering all three stumps to the batter before driving to deep extra cover

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to C Karunaratne, SIX runs
commentary: bring out your best golf club! In the slot on middle stump. Chamika clears the front leg and absolutely creams a lofted shot over wide long on. Well into the stands, and the Sri Lanka flags are out in the crowd!
around the stumps. Back of a length outside off. Cut to deep third, where Naseem cleans up

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to C Karunaratne, 4 leg byes
commentary: over the stumps. Slower ball, fullish on off. Karunaratne misses the flick, but the ball hits him on the thigh-guard and rolls past the diving Hasnain at short fine leg!

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: full ball just outside off. Driven to cover, hit quite hard, so has to hurry to the other end. But he's safe since it isn't a direct hit

around the stumps. Full, slow ball on off. Rajapaksa goes for a big shot, but ends up skying the shot high up. Massive air time since the ball has gone high into the night sky, and Shadab settles under it at long off. Tries to take a reverse cup catch, but the ball hits his finger and goes behind him thereafter. Lucky him that doesn't go for four, however it will go down as a dropped catch

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Haris Rauf to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: fullish outside off. Tapped towards cover for a single
back of a length on off. Guided with soft hands to backward point. Fifty in 35 balls! What a cruclal innings, and earns a hug from Chamika too. Rauf bowls out at 3/29.
fullish ball on leg stump but angling across to off. Slapped to cover's right, albeit mistimed. 124kph

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: sticks with the slower ball. Good length on off and angling into leg. He swivels to pull, but misses. Hits his body, rolls to the keeper's left

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: back of a length on leg stump. Guides a cut to backward point, but fielder hovering there

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: swing and miss. Back of a length ball on leg. Rajapaksa gets in position to swipe this short ball across the line, but the ball goes over the blade, and through to Rizwan.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: top over so far from Hasnain as the keeps varying his pace. Only 132kph, this length ball on leg. Rajapaksa moved to the off side to play a cute paddle, but was deceived by the lack of pace

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Mohammad Hasnain to Rajapaksa, SIX runs
commentary: two fielders collide, and even better for Sri Lanka, this has gone over the ropes! Shadab is lying down on the floor, Asif Ali the other man. Good length on middle stump. Rajapaksa swiped this across the line. Shadab at deep midwicket runs to his right. Asif at long on runs to his left. Both get under it. Shadab's head crashes into Asif's elbow, ball hits Asif's palm, and the momentum makes the ball pop out of his hands. Over the ropes.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to C Karunaratne, 1 run
commentary: hands the strike over to Rajapaksa. Swings across the line to this length ball, and hits it to deep square leg
gets back on strike with some hard running. Slower ball on leg. Swings across the line, and gets a top edge. Lands safely in front of deep backward square leg. Fielder throws it back in
another double. And 160 is breached. Full ball, almost a yorker on middle. Gets the bat down and ends up squirting the shot through to deep square leg

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rajapaksa, no run
commentary: short ball, slower ball on middle. Rajapaksa waits for it to get to him to try and ramp it over Rizwan, but misses

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs
commentary: cute shot! Full on middle and leg. Rajapaksa moves to the off side, gets low, and plays a paddle behind the keeper for four! Lands an inch or two inside the boundary line.

bowler_to_batsman, runs: Naseem Shah to Rajapaksa, SIX runs
commentary: momentum with Sri Lanka! And the tournament's official hosts finish on 170 for 6! What a finish for Sri Lanka as this full ball outside off is smeared over deep extra cover! Flat six, 10 off the last two, Pakistan need 171 to win, and the Sri Lankans will be absolutely delighted with how the innings has ended.
